If I say this, you say that―You will have the last word.

You must do that before you can be this―No cause, no effect.

ああなったのも皆自分が悪いからだ

〈名〉Love; affection; fondness; the tender passion:(=する) to love, like, be fond of, have a love for, take kindly to (a person or thing)

content.content: 神は愛なり
God is love.
我は国を愛す
I love my country―My country is dear to me.
誰でも名を愛さぬ者はない
Everybody loves fame―Fame is dear to every heart.
博く衆を愛す
to love all men―love mankind―be philanthropic―be a philanthropist
あの先生は我が子のように生徒を愛する
She has a mother's affection for her pupils.
日本の妻は献身的に夫を愛す
The Japanese wife is devoted to her husband.
海国民は船を愛す
An insular people will take kindly to the sea.
身体の弱い少年は往々学問を愛する
A boy of weak constitution will take kindly to his books.
女は美服を愛す
Women are fond of finery.
男が美服を愛す(のは可笑しいから)
He has a weakness for fine clothes.
老人は一人の娘を掌中の玉と愛した
The old man loved her as the apple of his eye.
彼は誰にでも愛せられる
He is beloved of all.
あの少年は愛すべき性質だ
The boy is of an amiable disposition.
(お前は可愛らしいことを言う)愛すべし
Bless you!
親の愛
parental love―paternal love
母の愛
maternal love
子の愛
filial love―(子を愛するの意味なら)―love for one's children
夫婦の愛
conjugal love―connubial affection
男女の愛
sexual love
精神的の愛
spiritual love―Platonic love
愛の神
Cupid

I read in the intervals of business.
(いくらか)間を置いて

木が二間ずつ間を置いて植えてある
The trees stands at intervals of twelve feet.
電車は五分ずつ間を置いて出る
The cars leave at intervals of five minutes.

content.content: 二人相愛す

朋友相信ず
Friends should trust each other.
両雄相知る
Great men know each other―“Like knows like.”
二者は氷炭相容れず
They are antagonistic to each other.
宮殿と獄屋と相対している
The palace and the prison stand opposite each other.［注意］含蓄の場合多し。
同病相憐れむ
They are companions in misery―“Misery loves company.”
同気相求む
“Like draws to like.”
夫婦相和す
Husband and wife should live in concord.
悦びと悲しみと相半す
to feel mingled joy and sorrow.
功罪相半す
His merits offset his faults.

content: 2. (Prefixed to verbs in ornate style without any particular meaning.)

content.content: 相変らず飲んでいるね
You have been drinking as usual.
相変らず酔っているね
You are as drunk as ever.
君はいつも相変らずだね

You are in good health as usual―enjoying your usual good health.
相変らず御勉強ですか
Are you working as hard as ever?
いくら稼いでも相変らず貧乏だ
For all my labours, I remain as poor as ever.

彼は医者の注意も聴かずに相変らず飲んでいる

〈名〉Attractiveness; charm; (a beauty's) smiles; (a business-man's) courtesy:(=ある) attractive (person); charming (woman); engaging (manner); winning (ways); winsome (smile); taking (address); pleasing (countenance); pretty (eyes); prepossessing (appearance); genial (nature); debonair (woman about town); amiable (fault); humourous (attack, etc.)

content.content: あの人はどこか愛嬌がある
There is a certain charm about him―a something about him that attracts you.
あの女は愛嬌がある
She is charming.
僕は美人より愛嬌のある女の方が好きだ
I prefer a charming woman to a beautiful woman.
愛嬌こぼれるよう
She is brimming over with charm―overflowing with smiles.
美人が愛嬌を振り撒く
She is profuse of her smiles.
誰にでも愛嬌を振り撒く
She has a smile for everybody.
あの人は様子に愛嬌がある
He has an engaging manner―a taking manner.
様子に無限の愛嬌がある
His manner has infinite charm.
あの娘はにっこと笑うと実に愛嬌がある
She will smile a winning smile―a winsome smile.
目に愛嬌がある
Her eyes charm you―She has pretty eyes.
偉人は愛嬌があるものだ

さすがは老練の政治家だけあっていつも愛嬌たっぷりだ

(常に澄ましている人が馬鹿げた失錯などすると)そこが愛嬌だ

to court favour

It is the business of the artiste to court public favour.

content.content: 挨拶に当惑した

to snap one's nose off―bite one's nose off

to give one the cold shoulder―show one the cold shoulder―turn the cold shoulder on one

content: 2. (=会釈)greeting; salutation; welcome; civilities; courtesies; compliments; respects; a formal speech or address:(=する) to greet, salute (a person); to welcome (a visitor); to make one's honours (to the master); to present one's compliments (to a person); to pay one's respects (to a superior); to make a formal speech; to give a formal address; to pass the time of day

content.content: 帽を取って挨拶する
to take off one's hat―raise one's hat―lift one's hat―to any one
主人に挨拶する
to greet―salute―make a bow to―make one's honours to―pay one's respects to―the master of the house
亭主が挨拶する
The host makes a speech to welcome the guests―welcomes the guests in a speech―bids the guests welcome.
ちょっとご挨拶を
Gentlemen, (you will allow me to speak) a word of welcome.
ちょっとご挨拶までに
In conclusion, I must thank you for gracing the evening with your presence.
校長が職員一同に代って挨拶した

パリ到着早々大使館へ挨拶に行った
Immediately on arrival in Paris, I went to pay my respects to my flag.

to exchange civilities―exchange courtesies
一通りの挨拶が済むと早速例の問題を持ち出した

to pass the time of day―give each other the time of day

to introduce oneself to a person
二人は初対面の挨拶をした
They introduced themselves to each other―exchanged courtesies on the occasion of their first meeting.
改めて初対面の挨拶をすることはあるまい

Not at all!―Don't mention it!
(本を評して紙屑とは)そりゃ御挨拶だ
You put it strong―That's putting it strong.

content:
あいそ〔愛想〕
〈名〉
1. (=愛想が好いの愛想)civility; courtesy; affability; amiability; sociability

content.content: 愛想の好い人だ
He is a civil man―a courteous man―an affable man―an amiable man―an agreeable man―a sociable man.
愛想の無い男だ
He is an unaffable man―a morose man―a sullen fellow―a surly fellow.
愛想の無いふうだ
He has a cold manner―a frigid manner―a freezing manner―a frosty manner―an icy manner.
愛想の無い返事
a curt answer―a dry answer
愛想無く断る
to refuse flatly―refuse point-blank―to do anything

content: 2. (=愛想を言うの愛想)civilities; courtesies; compliments

content.content: 愛想を言う
to pay one compliments―speak one fair―say agreeable things
あの人は愛想がうまい
He is fair-spoken―complimentary.
誰にでも愛想が好い
He has a kind word for everybody.

content: 3. (=愛想をするの愛想)entertainment; hospitality

content.content: 何のお愛想もございません
We have nothing to entertain you with.
婦人が客人にお愛想をしている
The lady is doing the amiable to her guests.
西洋では男が婦人にお愛想をする
In foreign countries, a man does the agreeable to the ladies.
愛想の無い景色
an inhospitable country―inhospitable shores
愛想が尽きる
to be disgusted with―out of love with―a person or thing
あの男には愛想が尽きた
I am disgusted with the man.
彼の欲張るのには愛想が尽きた
I am disgusted at his avarice.
さすがの豪傑も莫連{ばくれん}には愛想を尽かした様子だ
The great man himself seems to be disgusted with the Jezebel.
あれじゃ愛想もこそも尽き果てる
One can not but be thoroughly disgusted with him.
何事をしてもうまくいかないので世に愛想が尽きた
My constant failures have put me out of love with the world.
自分ながら愛想が尽きた
I am angry with myself.
彼は友達にまで愛想を尽かされた
He was given up by his friends even.

content:
あいぞう〔愛憎〕
〈名〉Love and hatred; one's likes and dislikes; partiality

content.content: 彼は部下に対して愛憎がある
He shows a partiality towards his subordinates.
すべての人を愛憎無く扱う
I treat all men impartially―I do not discriminate between people.

content:
あいそづかし〔愛想尽かし〕
〈名〉
1. Harsh words, hard words, unkind words (spoken with intent to make one's lover cut connections with the speaker)

content.content: 女が男に思い切らせようと思って愛想尽かしを言った
She said unkind things to her lover, that he might have done with her.

content: 2. (=勘定書)a long bill

あいた
〈間投詞〉It hurts!; Ouch!

content:
あいた〔愛他〕
〈名〉Altruism

content.content: 愛他心、愛他主義
altruism
愛他主義者
an altruist
愛他的
altruistic
釈迦やキリストの教は愛他主義である
The doctrines of Sakyamuni and Christ are altruistic.

content:
あいた〔明いた〕
〈形〉
1. (=開いた)open (mouth)

content.content: びっくりして開いた口が塞がらぬ
to be in open-mouthed surprise―to gape and stare
開いた口に牡丹餅だ
It is a godsend―a windfall.
そんな相談なら開いた口に牡丹餅だ
I would jump at such a proposal.
開いた口に牡丹餅は落ちて来ぬ
“Larks do not fall ready-roasted into your mouth.”

content: 2. (=空な)empty (bottle); unoccupied (room, seat, chair); vacant (hour, position); disengaged (hand); blank (space)

content.content: この室はあいているか
Is this room unoccupied?
君の時間はどこがあいているか
Which of your hours are vacant?
学校にあいた地位は無い
There is no vacant position in the school.
電話があいているか
Is the telephone disengaged?
あいたところに書き入れる
to fill in the blanks

content:
あいだ〔間〕
〈名〉
1. (=間{ま})interval (of space or time)

content.content: 柱と柱の間
intervals between the posts
食事と食事との間には物を食べない事にしている
I make it a rule never to eat (in the intervals) between meals.
仕事の間に読書する
I read in the intervals of business.
間を置いて
at intervals
暫く間を置いて
at short intervals
長く間を置いて
at long intervals
(いくらか)間を置いて
at intervals of...
二間ずつ間を置いて木が植えてある
The trees stand at intervals of twelve feet.
五分ずつ間を置いて電車が出る
The cars start at intervals of five minutes.

content: 2. (=距離)space; distance

content.content: 東京と横浜の間は二十五マイルある
The distance between Tokyo and Yokohama is twenty-five miles.
家と塀との間が六尺ある
There is a space of six feet between the house and the wall.
間を開ける、間を透かす
to leave spaces between
この間が明き過ぎている
The space is too wide.

content: 3. (=時)time; while

content.content: 久しい間であった
It was a long time.
暫くの間であった
It was a short time―a little while.
彼は東京へ来て間がない
It is only a short time since he came to Tokyo.
汽車が出るまでだいぶ間がある
It will be a long while before the train starts.
船が出るのはもう間がない
It will not be long before the ship sails.
ついこの間の事だ
It happened the other day.
ついこの間逢ったばかりだ
It was only the other day, that I met him.
その間に(話変って)
Meanwhile,―In the meantime,―In the interim,...

content: 4. (=間柄)relation

content.content: 夫婦の間
the relation between husband and wife
日本では親子の間が隔っているように見える
In Japan, the relation between parent and child seems to be distant.
二人の間を裂く
to estrange two friends―alienate two friends―come between two friends

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=二者の間)Between

content.content: 名古屋は東京と京都の間だ
Nagoya lies between Tokyo and Kyoto.
両極端の間の中を取る
to take (golden) mean between two extremes
夫婦の間に秘密はない
There should be no secret between husband and wife.
二人の間に子ができた
The couple had a child between them.
二人の間にできた子
the child born to the couple
二人の間にできた子が有名な太郎
The fruit of their union was the famous Taro.
二人の間に何事か(相談、打合せなどが)あったか
Did anything pass between the two?
二人の間に入る、二人の間に立つ
to go between―mediate between―intermediate between―intervene between―two parties
二人の間の邪魔になるもの
Something stands between―lies between―the two.
二人の間に意志の疎通を欠いている
No understanding subsists between the two―A gulf lies between them.
貧富の間の意志が疎通せぬ
The barrier of rank stands between the rich and the poor.
二人の間に狭まる
to get between two
二人の間に挟って実に困った
I find myself between two fires.
目と鼻の間にある
It is (right) under your eyes―under your (very) nose.

content: 2. (=多くの物の間)Among

content.content: 敵は樹木の間に隠れた
The enemy concealed themselves among the trees.
千軍万馬の間を往来する
to fight many battles
千軍万馬の間を往来した古兵だ
He is a veteran of a hundred battles.

content: 3. (=多くの異分子の間)Amidst

content.content: 危険の間に立って冷静自若としている
They are cool and steady amidst dangers―in the midst of dangers.

content: 4. (=時や距離の間)For

content.content: 暫時の間お待ち下さい
Please wait for a little while.
久しい間英語をやっている
I have been studying English for a long time.
汽車を降りて長い間人家が無い
After leaving the train, you see no human habitation for a long distance.
幾里も幾里もの間野原続きだ
A wild plain stretches for miles (and miles).

content: 5. (=事の続く間)During

content.content: 休暇の間にいっぺん行っておこう
I will go there once during the holidays.
戦争の間は商売を休んだ
The business was closed during the war.

content:
〈接続詞相当〉
1. ［時］While; as long as

content.content: 戦争の続く間は物価は下らぬ
The prices will not fall while the war lasts.
僕が飯を食う間待っているか
Will you wait while I eat my dinner?
俺が生きている間はお前達に不自由はさせぬ
You shall not want for anything as long as I live.

content: 2. ［理由］Since; as

content.content: 事情の斯くの如くに候間暫時お待ち下され度候
Since such is the case,―(前置詞に訳せず)―Under these circumstances,―I request you will wait for a while.
準備の都合も有之候間諾否御一報願上候{じゅんびのつごうもこれありそうろうあいだだくひごいっぽうねがいあげそうろう}
As we must make the necessary preparations,―(前置詞に訳せば)―In view of the preparations to be made,―I request you will let me know whether or no you will honour me with your acceptance.

content: 3. ［事由］That

content.content: 明日は臨時休業仕候間此段御通知申上候{みょうにちはりんじきゅうぎょうつかまつりそうろうあいだこのだんごつうちもうしあげそうろう}
I beg to inform you that the school will be closed tomorrow.

content:
あいたい〔相対〕
〈名〉Common consent

content.content: 相対で、相対ずくで
by common consent
相対ずくなら仕方がない
If the thing was done by common consent, it can not be helped.
(第三者を入れずに)相対で決めます
We will settle the matter between ourselves.

content:
あいたいげんか〔相対喧嘩〕
〈名〉A got-up quarrel; a got-up affair

content.content: 相対けんかをする
to get up a quarrel

content:
あいたいす〔相対す〕
〈自動〉(Two buildings) face each other, front on each other; (two things are) over against each other, opposite each other

content.content: 宮殿と獄屋と相対している
The palace and the prison stand opposite each other.
両軍河をさしはさんで相対した
The two armies faced each other across the river.
相対する軍勢
the contending armies
相対する角
opposite angles

content:
あいたがいに〔相互に〕
〈副〉Mutually; reciprocally; each other

content.content: 相互に譲り合う
to concede to each other―make mutual concessions

content:
あいだがら〔間柄〕
〈名〉
1. (=親族、主従等の間柄)relation (to a person―between two persons―of master and servant, etc.)

content.content: 親子の間柄
the relation of father and son
兄弟の間柄
brotherly relation
夫婦の間柄
conjugal relation
主従の間柄
the relation of master and servant
君は彼とはどう言う間柄か
What relation is he to you?―How are you related to him?
伯(叔)父甥の間柄だ
Our relation is that of uncle and nephew―He is my uncle.
Socrates と Plato は何という間柄か
What was the relation between Socrates and Plato?
師弟の間柄だ
They are master and pupil.

content: 2. (=交際上の間柄)relations (with a person); (on) terms, a footing (with a person)

content.content: 彼とは親密な間柄だ
I am on intimate terms with him―I am on an intimate footing with him.
あの一家とは往来し合う間柄だ
We are on visiting terms with that family.
彼とは逢えば物を言うくらいの間柄だ

途中で逢えば互いに会釈するだけの間柄だ
I am on bowing terms with him―on nodding terms with him.

content:

content.content: 僕は間食いはしない事にしている

content.content: 二人は互に愛着している

content:
あいぢゃく〔愛着〕

content.content: あいちゃく〔愛着〕

content:
あいつ
〈指摘代名詞〉
1. That one
2. (=彼奴)(contemptuous form for) he or she

content.content: 僕はあいつらと遊ばない

content:
あいついで〔相次いで〕
〈副〉In succession; one after another:(二つなら) one after the other

content.content: 事件が相次いで起こった

content:

content.content: 相槌を打つ

content:
あいて〔相手〕
〈名〉
1. (=仲間)a companion; a fellow; a mate

content.content: 貴婦人のお相手役
a lady's companion
男が婦人のお相手役をする
A man gallants a lady.
お相手をしましょう
I will keep you company―bear you company.

content:
2. (=共に商売などをする仲間)one's partner
3. (=敵手)(one's) adversary, antagonist, opponent, match

content.content: 彼は相手として不足は無い
He is a good match for me―a foeman worthy of my steel.
あの相撲は相手を上手にあしらう
He handles his antagonist with skill.

content: 4. (=競技の敵手)one's rival; one's competitor

content.content: 競争の相手を抜く
One outruns one's competitor―(船なら)―One ship outsails another

content: 5. (=けんかなどの相手)one's man; the other party

content.content: さあ来い、俺が相手になってやる
Come on, I am your man.
誰でも来い、俺が相手になってやる
Let any one come, I am his man.
相手は知れている
I know my man―I know whom I have to deal with.
僕は相手を見損なったことが無い
I never mistook my man.
けんか相手
some one to quarrel with
相手の無いけんかをする
to fight windmills
相手の無いけんかはできぬ
“It takes two to make a quarrel.”
相手は無いか
Will any one quarrel with me?
相手になろう
I will be your man.
こんなけんかの相手にならぬ
I will be no party to such a quarrel―I will have nothing to do with such an affair.
恋わずらい? 相手は誰だ
Love-sick? Who is the other party?
訴訟の相手方
the other party

content: 6. (=相手になれるなれぬの相手)a match (for some one); (one's) match, equal, rival, fellow

content.content: 僕はとても君の相手にはなれぬ
I am no match for you―not a patch upon you.
君は強過ぎて相手になれぬ
You are more than a match for me―too much for me.
俺の相手になれる奴が無い
I never met my match―I can not find my fellow―I shall never see my equal.
学問ではあの人の相手は無い
In learning, he has no equal―no rival.
彼は相手にするに足らぬ
He is no match for me―not worthy of my steel.
君を相手にして勝てる見込みが無い
I stand no chance against you.

content: 7. (=一対の片々の相手)the fellow (to a shoe, a glove, etc.)

content.content: この手袋の相手が無い
I can not find the fellow to this glove.

content:
8. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人を相手にする
to deal with a man
相手が田舎者だと見ると先生なかなか吹く
When he has a countryman to deal with, he will blow pretty hard.
相手は弱い女だと思うと脅そうとする
When he has to deal with a woman, he will try to intimidate her.
彼はこんな難物を相手にしている
He has to deal with such troublesome characters―He has such hard cases to deal with.
相手は知れている
I know whom I have to deal with.
相手が相手だから油断はできぬ
I must be on my guard, for I have no common enemy to deal with.
相手は名代の悪党だ
I have to deal with a notorious scoundrel.［注意］「相手にならぬ」を“have not to deal with”と言わずに“have nothing to do with”と言う。
僕はあんな者の相手にならぬ
I will have nothing to do with such men―have nothing to say to such men.
そんなことを言う奴があるなら俺が相手だ(そんなことを言うと俺が承知しない)
Those who say such things, will have to deal with me―have to reckon with me.
誰もあの男を相手にしない
Nobody will have anything to do with him―have anything to say to him―take any notice of him.
英語の雑誌といえば学生を相手にする雑誌ばかりだ
The English magazines are all those appealing to the students.
話し相手
one's interlocutor
話し相手が欲しい
I want some one to talk to.
話し相手が無くて困る
I have no one to talk to.
相談相手
an adviser―a counsellor
相談相手が欲しい
I want some one to whom I can go for advice.
相談相手が無くて困る
I have no one to go for advice―I am thrown upon my own resources.
酒飲み相手
a boon companion
相手をしてくれんか
Will you take wine with me?
お相手いたしてもよろしい
I don't mind taking a glass of wine with you.
女将に酒の相手をしてもらった
I asked the landlady to take wine with me―I requested her company over my wine.
茶飲み相手
one's crony
老人には茶飲み相手が必要だ
An old man must have his crony.
碁や将棋の相手
some one to play chess or go with
あの人は親父の碁の相手だ
He plays go with my father.
お相手をしましょうか
Will you have a game with me?

あいてかた〔相手方〕
〈名〉The other party (in a lawsuit, etc.)

The old man dotes on his young wife.

content.content: 二人は相弟子だ
They are fellow-pupils―fellow-apprentices.

content.content: 彼を失える我等は哀悼の情禁ずる能わず
We deeply lament his loss.

content:
あいどくする〔愛読する〕

content.content: この本は老少共に愛読する
This book is a favourite with young and old.
愛読の本
one's favourite book―one's favourite author
愛読者

紅葉は愛読者が多い
Koyo has a host of admirers.

content:
あいにく〔生憎〕
〈副〉
1. (=折悪しく)unfortunately; unluckily; by ill luck; as ill luck will have it

content.content: あいにくその日に限って便船が出なかった

そりゃあいにくだ

あいにく持合せが無かった

僕はあいにく不在だった

content: 2. (=遺憾ながら、残念ながら)I am sorry; It is a pity

content.content: あいにく天気が悪い

あいにく金の持合せが無い

おあいにくさま

content: 〈形〉(=の) inopportune, unseasonable, untimely (weather, etc.)

content.content: あいにくの天気だ

あいにくの雨だ

アイヌ

アイノ

content.content: 誰と相乗りで
in the same carriage with some one

content.content: 二人の性質は相反している

合間仕事
odd jobs

content:
あいまい〔曖昧〕
〈形〉Ambiguous (meaning); equivocal (answer); evasive (rejoinder); non-committal (reply); dubious (attitude); double-faced (person); double-barrelled (compliment); vague (statement); obscure (hint); mysterious (trade); lax (code); suspicious (character, etc.)

content.content: ここの意味が曖昧だ(二様に取れる)
The passage is ambiguous in meaning.
曖昧な返事をする
(意味の二様に取れる返事なら)to give an equivocal answer―(漠然とした返事なら)―give a vague answer―(言を左右に托した返事なら)―give an evasive answer―(煮え切れない返事なら)―give a dubious answer―(言質を避けるような返事なら)―make a non-committal reply.
彼の態度が曖昧だ
His attitude is dubious.
態度の曖昧な奴だ
He is a dounble-faced rascal.
(悪く気を廻せば廻せるような)意味の曖昧な言葉
a word of double meaning
(賞られるのか誹られるのか)曖昧なお世辞
a double-barrelled compliment
陳{のぶ}るところ極めて曖昧
His statements are very vague.
この事実は歴史には曖昧に(暗に)仄してある
The fact is obscurely hinted at by the historians.
この点に就いては法文は甚だ曖昧である
The law is very ambiguous―obscure―lax―on this point.
あれは曖昧な奴だ(怪しい奴、胡散臭い奴)
He is a suspicious character.
彼は曖昧な商売をしている
He is engaged in some mysterious business.
あの婦人はお婆さんのようでもあり若いようでもあり頗る曖昧な年だ
She is of a non-committal age.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は曖昧な事を言う(言を左右に託す)
He equivocates―prevaricates―shifts and prevaricates.
彼は往々曖昧な取引(後ろ暗い取引)をする
He often engages in shady transactions―underhand transactions―hole-and-corner transactions.
黒人{くろうと}につかず素人につかず極めて曖昧な女だ
She is neither flesh nor fish.
曖昧女
a demi-rep
曖昧連
the demi-monde
曖昧屋
a house of ill fame―a house of evil repute

content:
あいまつ〔相待つ〕
〈自動〉To be necessary to each other

content.content: 両者を相まって一つの働きができる
Both are necessary to the work.
智徳相待って始めて完全な人を成す
Knowledge and virtue are both necessary to make a complete man.
理論と実際とは相待つべきものである。
Practice should go hand in hand with theory.

content:
あいみたがい〔相身互〕
〈名〉Mutual sympathy; mutual aid

content.content: 武士は相身互
The samurai should aid each other―The brave should love each other.

あいもかわらぬ〔相も変らぬ〕
〈形〉Usual (spirits); everlasting (lectures); eternal (pork and beans, etc.)

content:
あいもち〔相持ち〕
〈名〉Mutual support; mutual dependence

content.content: 世は相持ち
Men must depend on one another―“Hand washes hand.”
地震の時は町家は相持ちに持つ
In earthquakes, town-houses prop each other up.

content:
あいやど〔相宿〕
〈名〉Lodging together (with a stranger):(=する) to lodge together (with a stranger)

content.content: 知らない人と相宿する
to lodge together―share a room―sleep in the same room―with a stranger
お相宿を願います
I request you will share the room with me―(亭主が言えば)―I beg you will share the room with another guest.

content:
あいゆう〔隘勇〕
〈名〉A native Formosan soldier (disciplined by Japanese methods)

content.content: 隘勇線
a native Formosan picket line

あいらしい〔愛らしい〕
〈形〉Lovely; pretty

content:
あいるらんど〔愛蘭<アイルランド>〕
〈固名〉Ireland:(=の) Irish

content.content: アイルランド人
an Irishman―(集合的に言えば)―the Irish.

content:
あいるらんど〔愛蘭<アイルランド>〕
〈固名〉Ireland:(=の) Irish

content.content: アイルランド人
an Irishman―(集合的に言えば)―the Irish.

content:
あいれん〔哀憐〕
〈名〉Pity; compassion:(=する) to take pity on (one); to take compassion on (one)

content.content: 哀憐の情に堪えず
I am moved with pity―touched with compassion.

あいれんする〔愛憐する〕
〈他動〉To caress, fondle (a child)

あいろ〔隘路〕
〈名〉(=山間の隘路)A defile

content:
あう〔逢う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=人に逢う)to meet (a person); to fall in with (the enemy); to come across (a strange man); to come upon (an old friend, etc.)

content.content: 彼には今日学校で逢う
I shall meet him in school today.
彼に初めて逢った時は変な男だと思った
The first time I met him, I thought him a strange fellow.
好いところで逢った
I am glad to have met you―Well met!
ひと足違いで逢わなかった
I just missed meeting him.
逢いたかった
I wish I had met him―I should like to have met him.
彼に逢ったのが身の幸福
I met him in a good hour.
彼女に逢ったのが身の不幸
I met her in an evil hour.
逢うは別れの始め(とも言うべし)
We meet only to part―Meeting is, in a sense, the beginning of parting.
別れてもまた逢う
We part only to meet again.
逢うて別れの浮世の習い
Those who meet, must part―(に相当する格言は)―“The best of friends must part.”
逢うて嬉しや
What a joy it is to meet!
別れの辛さ
How hard it is to part!
逢うて別れが
Would that we could ever meet,
無けりゃ好い
Never, never to part!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 偶然人に逢う
to light upon―happen upon―chance upon―come upon―come across―run against―a person (by chance)
門を出る途端にパッタリ逢ったのは意外な人
As I went out at the door I was met by an unexpected person―was confronted by an unexpected person―stood face to face with an unexpected person.
地獄で仏に逢ったようだった
I had found a friend in need.

content: 2. (=事に逢う)to meet with (a misfortune); to come across (a genuine article); to come upon, fall upon, light upon (good or bad times); to encounter, experience (a difficulty); to suffer, sustain (a calamity)

content.content: 不幸に逢う
to meet with a misfortune―fall upon evil days―light upon bad times―(近親に死に別れるの意味なら)―have a loss［注意］「不幸に逢う」の“misfortune”には二構文あり。
不幸に逢ったのがかえって幸福となった
I met with a misfortune―A misfortune happened to me―A misfortune befell me―A shadow fell on me―which turned out a blessing.
彼は不幸に逢ってかえって世間の同情を得た
He gained public sympathy by meeting with a misfortune―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His misfortune gained him public sympathy.
重ね重ねの不幸に逢う
to meet with a chapter of accidents―to be the sport of fortune―the sport of chance
災難に逢う
to meet with a calamity―suffer a calamity―sustain a calamity
不慮の災難に逢う
to have a mishap
危難に逢う
to be exposed to danger―run into danger
彼は危難に逢っても平気でいる
He is cool in danger―in the presence of danger.
彼はどんな危険に逢ってもビクともせぬ
He will not turn a hair in the presence of any danger.
日本は二度国難に逢った
Japan has been twice in danger.
乱世に逢う
to fall upon troublous times
水難に逢う
to be drowned―be shipwrecked
難船に逢う、破船に逢う
to be shipwrecked―suffer shipwreck
盗難に逢う
(人なら)to be robbed―(物なら)―be stolen―(途でなら)―fall among thieves
追いはぎに逢う
to be waylaid by a footpad
女難に逢う
to suffer from woman―be pursued by a woman
火事に逢う
to have one's house burnt down―(焼け出されるの意味なら)―be burnt out (of house and home)
家が火災に逢う
A house is destroyed by fire.
どんな目に逢う
to have such an experience―have such a time of it
こんな目に逢うのはへその緒切って初めてだ
I never had such an experience in my life.
ひどい目に逢った
I had a hard time of it―I had a woeful experience―(無人称構文にすれば)―It went hard with me―(虐待されたの意味なら)―I have been ill-used.
君にはひどい目に逢った
You have used me ill―dealt hardly by me.
君にこんな目に逢わされようとは思わなかった
I did not expect such usage―such treatment―at your hands.
そんなことをするとひどい目に逢わしてやる
You shall smart for it―You shall pay dearly for it.
怖い目に逢う
to have a dreadful experience―get a scare
危ない目に逢う
to be in danger
踏んだり蹴ったりの目に逢った
I suffered wrongs and contumelies―They added insult to injury―heaped insults upon me.
死ぬ目に逢った
I looked death in the face―Death stared me in the face.
人の死に目に逢う
to be present at one's death―attend one's deathbed
彼の死に目に逢わなかった
I could not attend his deathbed―I was away when he died.
碁打親の死に目に逢わず
A go-player can not attend his father's deathbed (the game is so absorbing).
(途中で)雨に逢う、夕立に逢う
to be caught in a shower
海上で嵐に逢う
to be overtaken by a storm―encounter a storm―at sea
暴風に逢う
to be overtaken by a gale
雷雨に逢ったら大木の下に雨宿りするな
Do not take shelter under a tree in a thunderstorm.
顔が逢う
(相撲なら)to be matched against each other―meet one on the ring―(役者なら)―appear in the same play
二人は顔が逢ったことが無い
(相撲なら)They never met on the ring―(役者なら)―They never appeared in the same play―never played together.
時に逢う
to come to luck―be fortunate―prosper
孔子も時に逢わず
Great men and great fortune do not come together.

content:
あう〔会う〕
〈他動〉
1. To see (a person)

content.content: お会いになりますか
Will you see him?
明日会おう
I will see him tomorrow.
(残念ながら)会われぬ
I can not see him―I must deny myself the pleasure of seeing him.
会いに行く
to go to see one
彼に会って来よう
I will go and see him.
彼に会って来た
I have been to see him.
会いたい
I wish to see him―I want to see him―I am dying to see him.
会って見たいものだ
I should like to see him―I am curious to see him.
二人は会いたがっている(会いたい見たい顔見たい)
They are dying to see each other.
彼に会いたかった
I wish I had seen him―I should like to have seen him.
君には久しく会わなかった、会いたかった
I have not seen you for an age. I have been dying to see you.
(あの時)二人は会いたかったろう
They would have liked to have seen each other.
彼は誰にも会わない
He will not see any one―He denies himself to callers.
彼にちっとは会うか
Do you see anything of him?
ちっとも会わない
I see nothing of him.
あまり会わない
I do not see so much of him.
あの頃はよく会った
I saw much of him then.
遠く離れて
When far apart are we,
会われぬ時は
And can't each other see,
月が鏡と
I wish the moon could be
成れば好い
A mirror clear to me!

content: 2. To meet (a lover or a sweetheart)

content.content: 鳥の鳴かない日はあっても二人の会わない日はない
Not a day passes without their meeting.
人目を忍んで会う
to meet in secret―arrange clandestine meetings
惚れて通えば
Love laughs at distance, Love!
千里も一里
A thousand miles is one to love;
会わずに帰れば
But when I do not meet my love,
又千里
A thousand is a thousand, love!
中に入って二人を会わせる
to arrange a meeting between the two
(会いたがる)二人を会わせぬ
to prevent the two from meeting―prevent their meeting―keep them apart

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼に会う機会を得ない
I can not get at him.
社長はいつ行っても会ってくれる
The president is always accessible.
誰が行っても会ってくれる
He is accessible to everybody―easy of access.
誰が行っても会ってくれない
He is inaccessible to everybody―difficult of access.
今日は誰が来ても会わないよ
I am not at home to any one today.
社長は今日誰が来ても会わなかった
The president was denied to all callers today.
彼は不在とばかりで誰が行っても会わない
He is never at home to any one.

content:
あう〔合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=一致する)to agree, accord, correspond, coincide, harmonize, chime, rhyme, tally, square, hit, consist, conform (with each other―in or on a point)

content.content: 意見が合う
to agree in opinion
君と意見が合う
We agree in opinion―I agree with you―I concur with you in your views―Your views accord with mine―Your views coincide with mine.
意見が合わぬ
to disagree in opinion―differ in opinion
彼と意見が合わない
We disagree in opinion―We differ in opinion―I do not agree with him―I disagree with him―I differ with him.
意見が合わないから止めたのだ
I left him, because I could not agree with him.
気が合う
to agree in temper―agree in disposition
彼と気が合う
I agree very well with him―We agree very well together―We are in sympathy with each other―We are of congenial tempers―We are congenial spirits.
二人は気が合わぬ
They do not agree together―They are out of sympathy with each other―They are of uncongenial tempers.
夫婦は気が合っている
The couple are happy together―They hit it off together―They hit it off with each other.
(人と)話が合う
to get on well with one
あの二人は話が合う
They get on very well together―They are of like tastes.
二人の話が合っている
Their accounts agree with each other.
皆の話が合っている
All accounts agree with one another―They are at one with one another.
皆の話の合わぬ節がある
The accounts disagree in some points―They are at variance in some points.
この点については歴史家の説が皆合っている
All the historians agree on this point―They are all at one on this point.
陳述が事実と合わぬ(食い違う)
The statement disagrees with―clashes with―conflicts with―jars with―the facts.
調子が合う
to tune with each other―chime with each other―harmonize with each other
このピアノは調子が合っているか、調子が合っておらぬ
Is this piano in tune?―Is is not in tune.
音と意味と調子が合って始めて詩になる
The sound must harmonize with the sense in order to make poetry.
外国語が入ると後先と調子が合わない
A foreign word does not chime with the flow of the language.
詩が音楽に合う
The poem harmonizes with the music.
この歌は三味線に合う
The song goes well with the samisen.
踊りの拍子が音楽に合う
The dancer keeps time with the music.
(何と何と)韻が合う
“Love” rhymes with “dove.”
計算が合っているか
Do the accounts agree?―tally?
合っておらぬ
They do not agree―do not tally.
ちょうど合っている
They agree exactly―tally exactly.
勘定を調べて見ると合っている
I find the accounts all right.
チャンと合っている
They are quite correct.
帳尻が合うか
Do the accounts balance?
帳尻がどうしても合わぬ
I can not make the accounts balance.
合印が合っている
The counter-marks agree with each other―tally with each other.
答案が合っている
The answer is right―correct.
食物が腹に合う、腹に合わぬ
The food agrees with my constitution―disagrees with my constitution.
卵は僕の腹に合わない
Eggs do not agree with me―disagree with me.
肉食の合わない人がある
Meat diet does not agree with all constitutions―disagrees with some constitutions.
気候が身体に合う、合わぬ
The climate agrees with my constitution―disagrees with my constitution.
日本の気候は貴方に合いますか
Does the climate of Japan agree with you?
日本の気候に合わない西洋人がある
The climate of Japan does not agree with all foreigners―disagrees with some foreigners.
世に合う、時世に合う
to be in sympathy with the times―in tune with the times
あの人は世に合わぬ
He is out of sympathy with the times―out of tune with the times―ahead of his age.
そんな説は道理に合わぬ
Your theory is not consistent with reason―contrary to reason.
そんな議論は理屈に合わぬ
Your argument is illogical.
君のやり方は規則に合わぬ
Your procedure is against rule.
君のやり方は世間の習慣に合わぬ
Your course of conduct does not conform with custom.
伝道学校は国風に合わぬ
Mission schools do not conform with the national custom.
彼女の性行は家風に合わぬ
Her character does not conform with the family tradition.
あの先生の教授法は校風に合わぬ
His teaching does not conform with the school tradition.
前後の言が合わぬ
His statement are inconsistent with each other.

content: 2. (=適合する、似合う、釣り合う)to fit (the body); to suit (one's taste); to become (one); to match (with something)

content.content: 君は洋服が合う
Foreign clothes become you (very well).
この上衣は合うか
Does this coat fit me?
よく合う、キチンと合う、ピッタリ合う
It fits you very well―fits you to a nicety―fits you to a T―fits you like a glove―fits you like wall-paper―It is a good fit―a nice fit―a rare fit.
この靴は足に合わぬ
These shoes do not fit me―They are a misfit.
よく合うようにこしらえてくれ
You must make it a good fit―make me a good fit.
この眼鏡は目に合う
These spectacles suit my eyes.
(食物が)口に合う
to suit one's taste―suit one's palate
日本料理はお口に合いますか
Does Japanese food suit your taste?―Do you find Japanese food to your taste?―to your appetite?―to your liking?―Do you like Japanese food?
何かお口に合うものがありそうなものだ
Perhaps I can find something to your taste―something you like―something you fancy.
そんな物はお口に合いますまい
Perhaps you don't like it.
口には合うが腹に合わない
I like it, but it does not like me.
(品物が)気に合う
to please one―suit one―suit one's fancy―hit with one's humour or temper
お気に合った品がありませんか
Do none of these articles suit you?
気に合った教科書は一つも無い
None of the text-books suit my fancy―hit with ideal.
嗜好に合う、性{しょう}に合う
to suit one's taste―be congenial to one's tastes
この仕事が一番に僕の性に合っている
This work is most to my taste―congenial to my tastes.
性に合った仕事
congenial work
作物が土地に合う、地味に合う
The crop suits the soil.
牧羊は日本の土地に合わぬ
Sheep-farming is not suited to Japan―Japan is not suited for sheep-farming.
道具が座敷に合わぬ
The furniture does not match with the room―The furniture is out of keeping with the room.

content: 3. (=相当する)to correspond to (a term); to answer to (the description); to be equivalent to (a term)

content.content: 人相書に合う人がつかまった
A man answering to the description has been identified.
「流石{さすが}」に合う英語があるか
Is there an English word corresponding to “sasuga”?―Is there an English equivalent for “sasuga”?

content:
4. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 時計が合う
to keep good time
君の時計は合うか
Does your watch keep good time?―Is your watch a good time-keeper?
よく合わん
It does not keep good time―It is a bad time-keeper.
あの時計は合っているか
Is that clock right?
合っておらぬ
It is wrong.
彼の言うことはつじつまが合わぬ
What he says, is incoherent―inconsistent―self-contradictory.
間に合う
(充分の意味なら)to be enough―be sufficient―(用が足りるの意味なら)―do (the business)―answer the purpose―serve one's turn―(役に立つの意味なら)―be useful―be of service―(何に間に合う)―be in time (for something)
これだけありゃ間に合う
These are enough―These will do.
これだけ金がありゃ当分間に合う
This sum will do for the present.
明日で間に合うか
Will tomorrow do?
(月給で暮らせるかと問われて)どうかこうか間に合う
I can meet my expenses―make both ends meet.
この金が無くとも間に合う
I can do without this money.
あの人がいなくともけっこう間に合う
We can do very well without him―He can be very well done without.
どの紙でも間に合う
Any paper will do―answer the purpose―serve my turn.
急行に間に合ったか
Were you in time for the express?
間に合わなかった(遅れた)
I was not in time―too late―(for the express).
試験に間に合うように帰ります
I shall be back in time for the examination.
博覧会に間に合うように米国へ行く
I shall go to America in time to see the fair.
あの男はなかなか間に合う
He is quite useful―very useful.
こんな物はいざという時に間に合わない
Such things are useless in the moment of action.
割りに合う
to pay―to be worth one's while
割に合う仕事なら引き受けよう
I will undertake the work if it pays―if it is worth my while―If I find my account in it.
割に合わぬ
It does not pay―It is not worth my while―I do not find my account in it―“The game is not worth the candle”―“The game is not worth powder and shot”
百円以下で売っては割に合わぬ
It wouldn't pay to take less than 100 yen for it.
新聞事業は割に合わぬ
Journalism doesn't pay.
顔が合う
(相撲なら)to be matched against each other―meet on the ring―(役者なら)―appear in the same play―play together
二人は土俵で顔が合ったことが無い
They never met on the ring.
舞台で顔が合ったことがない
They never played together.

あうん〔阿吽〕
〈名〉Inspiration and expiration; the beginning and end of things; alpha and omega

content:
あえぐ〔喘ぐ〕
〈自動〉To pant, gasp (for breath)

content.content: 一人の男が喘ぎ喘ぎ重い物を背負って行く
A man is panting under a heavy load.
彼が喘ぎながら言う事がどうしても解らなかった
He gasped out something, which I could not, for the life of me, understand.

content:
あえず〔敢えず〕
〈副〉Before one can

content.content: 礼を言わせも敢えず立ち去った
He left me before I could thank him―before I had time to thank him.

content:
あえて〔敢えて〕
〈副〉
1. (動詞に訳して)to dare, presume (to do something)

content.content: 敢えて何々せん
I shall presume to...
敢えて不遜を顧みず思うところを述べん
I shall presume to give my opinion.
敢えて言う
I venture to say―I shall take upon me to say―that...
敢えて問う
I venture to ask―I should like to know―how it is that...

content:
2. 
〈打消に伴えば単に強調詞〉

content.content: ドイツは亡国なりと言うも敢えて過言にあらず
It is no exaggeration to say―not too much to say―that Germany is a ruined country.
彼の成功は敢えて怪しむに足らず
It is no wonder that he should have succeeded.

彼にも秘密を明かしておく必要がある

to reveal the truth to some one

to lay a scheme bare―lay a plan open―to one's audience
意中を明かす、胸中を明かす
to open one's heart―open one's mind―to one
心底を明かす
to reveal one's inmost thoughts to one
罪を明かす
to confess one's guilt
(手品などの)種を明かす
to reveal the trick―show one's hand
この事は誰にも明かさずにおく(胸に蔵めておく)
I keep the matter to myself―I keep the matter from everybody.
ことに彼に明かさない
I keep him in the dark about the matter.
鼻を明かす
to put one's nose out of joint

あかすり〔垢擦り〕
〈名〉A wash-rag (for rubbing off dirt)

content.content: 県主
a prefect

content:
あかつき〔暁〕
〈名〉
1. Dawn

content.content: 鶏鳴暁を報ず
The crowing cock proclaims the hour of dawn.
春眠暁を覚えず
In spring the sleeper knows not the hour of dawn.
暁見千兵擁大牙
The dawn reveals a mighty host drawn up around their standard.
有明のつれなく
The waning moon so cold did shine
見えし別れより
When we at morn did part,
暁ばかり
The hour of dawn is since become
憂きものはなし
A sadness to my heart.
(何々の)暁には
on the morrow of―in the event of―in case of
いよいよ開戦となった暁には条約は反古だ
Treaties are scraps of paper on (the morrow of) the outbreak of war.
事成就した暁には勝てば官軍で苦情を言う者は無くなる
Might will become right in the event of success.
事失敗に帰した暁には死あるのみだ
We can but die in case of failure.

〈名〉Atonement (for a sin); expiation (of a crime); compensation (for a loss); indemnity (for damage); reparation (for an injury); satisfaction (for a wrong); a ransom (for a captive); redemption (of one's life); buying back (of anying)

あがないきん〔購い金〕

content:
あがなう〔購う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=償う)to atone for (a crime); to expiate (a sin); to repair (a loss); to make good (a loss); to compensate (a loss―for a loss―one for a loss); to indemnify (one for damage); to make reparation for (damage); to make satisfaction for (a loss); to redeem (one's life); to ransom (a captive)

content.content: 罪を購う
to atone for a sin―expiate a crime
死を以て罪を購う
to expiate a crime with death
善行を以て罪を購う
to atone for one's sins by good works
(キリストのように)世の罪を購う
to redeem man from sin and damnation
身を購う
to redeem oneself
償金を出して人の生命を購う
to redeem one's life―ransom a man

content:
2. (=購買する)to buy, purchase, pay for (an article)
3. (=懸賞する)to offer a reward for (anything)

content.content: 千金で人の首を購う
to set a price of 1000 yen on one's head

あかなす〔赤茄子〕
〈名〉The tomato

content:
あかぬ〔飽かぬ〕
〈形〉Untired; untiring; that one never tires of

content.content: 飽かぬ眺め
an untiring prospect―a prospect one never tires of gazing upon
二人は飽かぬ仲だ
They are lovers―inseparable―bound up in each other.

content:
あかぬけ〔垢抜け〕
〈名〉(Town) polish; refinement

content.content: 垢抜けした人だ
He is a polished man―a refined person.
垢抜けした風だ
He has a polished manner.
垢抜けのしない人だ
He is an unpolished man―an unrefined person―a rustic.
垢抜けしない風だ
He has an unpolished manner―an unrefined manner―a rustic manner.
あの子はちょっと垢抜けがしている
She has some town polish.
垢抜けのした絵
a chastened painting

content:
あかね〔茜〕
〈名〉The madder

content.content: 茜色
madder red
茜さす
to redden―glow―(は日の枕言葉)a permanent epithet of the word “sun”
茜さす日の御旗
the sun-flag
茜さす日の本の国
the Land of the Rising Sun

content:
あかのたにん〔赤の他人〕
〈名〉(We are) utter strangers

content.content: あの人とは赤の他人だ
He is a perfect stranger to me―We are utter strangers.
赤の他人じゃない
He is no stranger to me.
切れてしまえば赤の他人だ
We are nothing to each other now.

content:
あかはじ〔赤恥〕
〈名〉Burning shame; howling shame; open disgrace; public insult

content.content: 赤恥をかく
to be covered with burning shame―be clothed with open disgrace
赤恥をかかせる
to insult one in public―(無意志なら)―put one to howling shame
赤恥をかかされる
to be insulted in public―(無意志なら)―be put to howling shame

content:
あかはだか〔赤裸〕
〈形〉Entirely naked; stark naked; stript to the skin

content.content: 赤裸で歩きまわる
to go about stark naked―in buff
赤裸になる
to become entirely naked―strip (oneself) to the skin
赤裸にする
to strip a man of all his clothes―(金品を奪うの意味なら)―fleece a man of all his possessions
赤裸にされる
to be stripped of all one's clothes―be shorn of all one's possessions

あかばむ〔赤ばむ〕
〈自動〉To redden

あかはら〔赤腹〕
〈名〉The brown ouzel; the dusky ouzel

あかひげ〔赤髭〕
〈名〉
1. A red beard
2. (=西洋人)a red-bearded foreigner; a red-beard

あかぶどうしゅ〔赤葡萄酒〕
〈名〉Red wine

あかぼ〔赤穂〕
〈名〉A kind of rice-plant with red ears

content:

〈名〉A railway porter; a station porter

content.content: 荷物を赤帽に預けた
I have given my luggage (in charge) to the porter.
荷物を預けた赤帽
the porter in charge of my luggage
赤帽に預けた荷物
the luggage in the charge of the porter

あかほん〔赤本〕
〈名〉Juvenile books; cheap books

content:

〈名〉A tinge of red; a reddish tint

content.content: 赤味を帯びている
It has a reddish tint―It is tinged with red―It is reddish.
