〈名〉Red rice (rice boiled with red beans)

content:
あがめる〔崇める〕
〈他動〉To worship (a deity); to reverence (a superior); to revere (a saint); to adore (a hero); to venerate (age); to esteem (talent); to respect (all men)

content.content: 長者を崇めよ
Reverence your elders.
老人を崇めるものだ
You should venerate old men―have a respect for age.

あからがお〔赤ら顔〕
〈名〉A florid countenance

content:
あからさまに
〈副〉Openly; plainly; broadly; frankly; candidly; directly; straightforwardly; outright; downright

content.content: あからさまに言う
to say things outright―tell the downright truth―state the straightforward fact―speak out―speak plain―speak in plain English―hint broadly―call a spade a spade
あからさまに言えば詐欺だ
In plain words,―In plain terms,―In plain English,―To be plain with you,―To be frank with you,―To be candid with you,―I shall call it fraud.
あれはあからさまに物を言う人だ
He is outspoken.
あの人はあからさまに然{しか}りとか否{いな}とか言わぬ
He never says a direct “Yes” or “No”―He never gives a direct answer.

content:
あからむ〔赤む〕
〈自動〉To redden; to turn red; to colour:(恥じてなら)to blush:(激してなら)to flush

content.content: 酒を飲んで赤らんでいる
He is flushed with wine.

content:
あからめる〔赤らめる〕
〈他動〉To redden

content.content: 顔を赤らめる
to colour―(恥じてなら)―blush―(激してなら)―flush

content:
あかり〔明かり〕
〈名〉
1. (=光線)light

content.content: 明かりを取る
to let in the light
明かり取り
a skylight
明かりは窓から入る
The light comes in at the window―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The window lets in the light―admits the light.
ランプの明かり
the light of a lamp―lamplight
ランプの明かりで読書する
to read by the lamplight
月の明かり
moonlight
月の明かりで読書する
to read by the moonlight
雪の明かり
the blink of snow
雪の明かりで読書する
to read by the snow-blink
明かりにかざして見る
to hold up anything to the light

content: 2. (=灯火)a light; a lamp; a candle

content.content: 遠方に明かりが見える
I see a light in the distance.
明かりをつける
to make a light―light a candle―light the lamp
明かりがついている
The light is burning―The lamps are lighted―The lamps are alight.
明かりのつく頃に家に帰った
We got home at candlelight―It was candlelight when we got home.
明かりを消す
to extinguish the light―put out the light
明かりを消せ
Put out the light―Out with the light!―(泥棒の符牒でいうと)―Douse the glim!
明かりが消えた
The light has gone out.
明かりを消しはせぬ、独りで消えたのだ
I did not put out the light. It went out of itself.
教室の明かりは電灯ですか
Are the class-rooms lighted by electricity?
明かりはガスです
They are lighted by gas.
人に明かりを見せる
to light one
明かりを見せて案内する
to light one the way
明かりを持って二階へ案内する
to light one upstairs
明かりを持って家へ送り届けた
I lighted him home.
明るい明かり
a bright light
ぼんやりした(暗薄い)明かり
a dim light―a glimmering light
明かりがちらちらする
The light flickers.

content: 3. (=身の明かり)innocence

content.content: 身の明かりを立てる
to establish one's innocence―clear oneself (of the charge)―right oneself―justify oneself―exculpate oneself (from the charge)―vindicate one's character
僕が君の明かりを立てよう
I will prove your innocence―clear you of the charge.
人に迷惑をかけて我が身の明かりを立てるのは男らしくない
It is not manly to clear oneself at another's expense.

content:
あがり〔上がり〕
〈接尾詞〉

content.content: あの人は兵隊上がりだ
He is an ex-soldier―a returned conscript―He has served his time (in the army).
あれは懲役上がりだ
He is an ex-convict―a returned convict―He has served time (in prison).
病気上がりだ
He has just recovered from an illness―He is convalescent.
細君は芸者上がりだ
His wife is an ex-geisha―a redeemed geisha.
女郎上がりだ
She is an ex-prostitute―a redeemed prostitute.
役者上がりだ
He is an exactor―He has trod the boards.

あがり〔上り〕
〈名〉
1. (=上ること)rising; a rise; ascension; an ascent
2. (=上達)progress; improvement
3. (=物価の騰貴)rise, advance (in price)
4. (=人の昇進)a rise; promotion
5. (=上がり高)the profits (of a business); the proceeds (of a sale); the returns (of an investment); the takings (of a shop); the issue, rent-roll (of an estate)
6. (=終り)the completion (of some work); the finishing (of a reading-book)
7. (=身体のある部分などの上がり)being set in a higher position than usual

content:
あがりおり〔上がり降り〕
〈名〉Going up and down; ascent and descent:(=する) to go up and down; to ascend and descend

content.content: 梯子段の上がり降りだけでも好い運動になる
The going up and down the stairs alone gives you good exercise.

content:
あがりくち〔上がり口〕
〈名〉An entrance (to a house)

content.content: 梯子段の上がり口
the lowest stair of a staircase

content:
あがりこむ〔上がり込む〕
〈自他動〉To enter (a house) for a long talk

content.content: 案内もなく上がり込む
to enter a house unannounced―force one's way into a house

content:
あがりさがり〔上がり下がり〕
〈名〉Rise and fall (of the mercury or temperature); up and down (of a road); fluctuations (of price); the high or low position (of a part of the body)

content.content: 物価には上がり下がりがある
The prices are liable to fluctuations.
物価の上がり下がりは需要供給によって定まる
The rise and fall of prices is regulated by demand and supply.

content:
あかりさき〔明かり先〕
〈名〉One's light

content.content: 人の明かり先に立つ
to stand in one's light
君がそこにいると僕の明かり先の邪魔になる
You are standing in my light.
明かり先の邪魔になるからどけ
Stand out of my light!

あがりだか〔上がり高〕
〈名〉The profits (of a business); the proceeds (of a sale); the returns (of an investment); the takings (of a shop); the issue, rent-roll (of an estate)

あがりだん〔上がり段〕
〈名〉A step; the door-steps; the footboard (of a street-car)

あかりとり〔明かり取り〕
〈名〉A skylight

あがりば〔上がり場〕
〈名〉A landing-place

あがりばな〔上がり花〕
〈名〉The first infusion of tea; fresh-drawn tea

content:
あがりめ〔上がり目〕
〈名〉
1. Turned-up eyes; oblique eyes
2.

content.content: 物価の上がり目
an upward tendency (of the market)

あがりもの〔上がり物〕
〈名〉(A polite name for) food; an article of food

content:
あがる〔上がる、揚がる〕
〈自他動〉
1. To go up; to come up; to rise; to ascend; to mount; to climb

content.content: 風船が上がる
A balloon goes up―rises―ascends―mounts―into the air.
風船が高く上がっている
The balloon is high up in the air.
寒暖計が上がる
The thermometer rises―goes up.
寒暖計が百度に上がった
The mercury has risen to 100° (one hundred degrees).
熱が上がる
Fever rises.
温度が上がる
The temperature rises.
花火が上がる
Fireworks are set off.
あれ花火が上がった
There go the fireworks!
今晩は両国で花火が上がる
There is a display of fireworks―a pyrotechnic display―at Ryogoku this evening.
火の手が上がる
A tongue of fire shoots up.
火の手が炎々と上がる
Tongues of fire flare up.
火の手が大分上がった
The fire is raging.
旗が上がる
A flag is put up.
旗が上がっている
The flag is up.
団扇が上がる
A fan is raised.
団扇が西の方に上がった
The umpire's fan is raised in favour of the West―The West is declared the victor.
鯨波(ときのこえ)が上がる
A shout of triumph rises on the air.
一段上がる
to mount a step
一段階上がる
to rise another notch

content: 2. (=どこから上がる)

content.content: 船から上がる
to land from a ship
船から上がるところを掴まった
He was caught as he was landing.
湯から上がる
to come out of the bath
牢から上がる
to get out of prison―get out of jail

content: 3. (=どこまで上がる)

content.content: この熱は四十度まで上がる
The fever will rise to 40°.
水が床まで上がった
The water reached the floor.

content: 4. (=どこへ上がる)

content.content: 陸へあがる
(上陸する)to land―(船から一時上陸するなら)―go on shore
二階へ上がる
to go upstairs
学校へ上がる
to enter a school
椅子へ上がってようやく届く窓
You can just reach the window by getting on a chair.
この酒は頭へ上がる
This wine gets into head―It is heady wine.

content: 5. (=何を上がる)

content.content: 梯子段を上がる
to go up the stairs―ascend the stairs―mount the stairs
石段を上がる
to go up the stone-steps―ascend the stone-steps―mount the stone-steps
坂を上がる
to go up a slope―ascend a slope―mount a slope
坂を上がると宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.

content: 6. (=入る)go to in; to come in; to enter (a house)

content.content: お上がりなさい
Please come in―walk in―step in.
茶屋へ上がる
to enter a tea-house

content: 7. (=訪う{おとなう})to call (on a person―at a house)

content.content: いつ上がりましょうか
When shall I call on you?―When shall I wait on you?
お別荘の方へ上がります
I shall call at your villa.

content: 8. (=騰貴する)to go up; to rise (in price); to advance in price; to appreciate

content.content: 物価が上がる
The prices rise―go up.
物価が上がった
The prices have risen―The prices are up.
物価は上がるばかりだ
The prices go on rising.
物価は三倍に上がった
The prices risen by two hundred percent.
米が上がる
The price of rice rises―Rice rises in price―advances in price―appreciates.
米が上がった
Rice is up.
米が上がると暮らしに響く
A rise in the price of rice affects the living.
人の価値が上がる
A man rises in the public estimation.

content: 9. (=上達する)to progress; to advance; to improve

content.content: 君は学問がたいそう上がった
You have progressed in your studies―made great progress in your studies.
英語が上がる
to improve in English
僕は英語が上がりますか
Am I improving in my English?
君は英語がめっきり上がった
You show a marked improvement in your English.
手が上がる
to improve in one's handwriting
芸が上がる
to improve in one's art
腕が上がる
to improve in one's ability
酒が上がる
to improve in one's liquid capacity
男振りが上がる
to improve in one's looks
風采が揚がる
to improve in appearance
風采揚がらず
He cuts a poor figure―cuts a sorry figure.
風采が揚がらない人だ
He is a cheap-looking man.

content: 10. (=昇進する)to rise; to be advanced; to be promoted

content.content: 官等が上がる
to be promoted
位が上がった
He has risen in rank.
月給が上がった
I have had my salary raised.
試験で何番上がる
to go up or rise (by) so many seats in the examination
今度の試験で十番上がった
I have risen ten seats in last examination.
名が揚がる
One becomes known―become famous.
彼は一夜の中に名が揚がったと言っている
He says he awoke one morning to find himself famous.
国威揚がる
The national prestige is raised―The glory of the nation is enhanced.
意気揚がる
to be elated―triumphant―exultant―jubilant
意気揚がらず
He is dejected―cast down.
元気揚がらず
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the blues―in the dumps.
店から利益が上がる
Profits accrue from the business―issue from the business―proceed from the business.
地代が一万円上がる
He has 10,000 yen from his land-rent.
家賃もだいぶ上がるだろう
He must have a great deal from his house-rent.
売上が五百円上がった
The proceeds amount to―come up to―500 yen.
入費はいくらで上がるだろうか
What will the expenses amount to?―come up to?
普請(建築費)は一万円以下では上がらない
The cost of building will amount to―come up to―not less than 10,000 yen.
入費が安く上がる
The expenses come low.
神社に賽銭が上がる
Money is offered―Money-offerings are made―at a shrine.
あの神社にはだいぶ賽銭が上がるだろう
The offertory at that shrine must amount to a great deal.
いつも酒や餅が上がっている
I always see offerings of wine and cake at the shrine.

content:
16. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 天気が上がる
The weather clears up.
雨が上がった
It has stopped raining―The rain has held up―The rain has let up.
梅雨が上がった
The rainy season is over.
本が上がった
I have finished the book.
色が上がる
The colour comes out.
証拠があがる
Evidence is found―The truth comes out―The crime is proved.
犯人が上がる
The culprit is caught (or taken).
蚕が上がる
The silkworm begins (or finishes) spinning.
傷に肉が上がる
A wound granulates.
役が上がった、足が上がった
He has lost his place―lost his situation.
魚が上がった
The fish is dead.
誰でもあの人の前へ出ると頭が上がらない
No one can hold up his head before him.

content: 〈他動〉(A Polite term for) to eat or drink

content.content: 肉を減らして野菜をもっとお上がりなさい
I would advise you to eat less meat and more vegetables.
貴方はお酒を上がりますか
Do you drink (wine)?
ご飯はどこで上がりますか
Where will you take your meals?
何をお上がりになりますか
What will you have?
(西洋人に向って)貴方は日本食をお上がりなさいますか
Can you live on Japanese food?
ご馳走が出ました、さあお上がりなさい
There is good cheer on the table. Please fall to!

content:
あがる〔上がる、揚がる〕
〈自他動〉
1. To go up; to come up; to rise; to ascend; to mount; to climb

content.content: 風船が上がる
A balloon goes up―rises―ascends―mounts―into the air.
風船が高く上がっている
The balloon is high up in the air.
寒暖計が上がる
The thermometer rises―goes up.
寒暖計が百度に上がった
The mercury has risen to 100° (one hundred degrees).
熱が上がる
Fever rises.
温度が上がる
The temperature rises.
花火が上がる
Fireworks are set off.
あれ花火が上がった
There go the fireworks!
今晩は両国で花火が上がる
There is a display of fireworks―a pyrotechnic display―at Ryogoku this evening.
火の手が上がる
A tongue of fire shoots up.
火の手が炎々と上がる
Tongues of fire flare up.
火の手が大分上がった
The fire is raging.
旗が上がる
A flag is put up.
旗が上がっている
The flag is up.
団扇が上がる
A fan is raised.
団扇が西の方に上がった
The umpire's fan is raised in favour of the West―The West is declared the victor.
鯨波(ときのこえ)が上がる
A shout of triumph rises on the air.
一段上がる
to mount a step
一段階上がる
to rise another notch

content: 2. (=どこから上がる)

content.content: 船から上がる
to land from a ship
船から上がるところを掴まった
He was caught as he was landing.
湯から上がる
to come out of the bath
牢から上がる
to get out of prison―get out of jail

content: 3. (=どこまで上がる)

content.content: この熱は四十度まで上がる
The fever will rise to 40°.
水が床まで上がった
The water reached the floor.

content: 4. (=どこへ上がる)

content.content: 陸へあがる
(上陸する)to land―(船から一時上陸するなら)―go on shore
二階へ上がる
to go upstairs
学校へ上がる
to enter a school
椅子へ上がってようやく届く窓
You can just reach the window by getting on a chair.
この酒は頭へ上がる
This wine gets into head―It is heady wine.

content: 5. (=何を上がる)

content.content: 梯子段を上がる
to go up the stairs―ascend the stairs―mount the stairs
石段を上がる
to go up the stone-steps―ascend the stone-steps―mount the stone-steps
坂を上がる
to go up a slope―ascend a slope―mount a slope
坂を上がると宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.

content: 6. (=入る)go to in; to come in; to enter (a house)

content.content: お上がりなさい
Please come in―walk in―step in.
茶屋へ上がる
to enter a tea-house

content: 7. (=訪う{おとなう})to call (on a person―at a house)

content.content: いつ上がりましょうか
When shall I call on you?―When shall I wait on you?
お別荘の方へ上がります
I shall call at your villa.

content: 8. (=騰貴する)to go up; to rise (in price); to advance in price; to appreciate

content.content: 物価が上がる
The prices rise―go up.
物価が上がった
The prices have risen―The prices are up.
物価は上がるばかりだ
The prices go on rising.
物価は三倍に上がった
The prices risen by two hundred percent.
米が上がる
The price of rice rises―Rice rises in price―advances in price―appreciates.
米が上がった
Rice is up.
米が上がると暮らしに響く
A rise in the price of rice affects the living.
人の価値が上がる
A man rises in the public estimation.

content: 9. (=上達する)to progress; to advance; to improve

content.content: 君は学問がたいそう上がった
You have progressed in your studies―made great progress in your studies.
英語が上がる
to improve in English
僕は英語が上がりますか
Am I improving in my English?
君は英語がめっきり上がった
You show a marked improvement in your English.
手が上がる
to improve in one's handwriting
芸が上がる
to improve in one's art
腕が上がる
to improve in one's ability
酒が上がる
to improve in one's liquid capacity
男振りが上がる
to improve in one's looks
風采が揚がる
to improve in appearance
風采揚がらず
He cuts a poor figure―cuts a sorry figure.
風采が揚がらない人だ
He is a cheap-looking man.

content: 10. (=昇進する)to rise; to be advanced; to be promoted

content.content: 官等が上がる
to be promoted
位が上がった
He has risen in rank.
月給が上がった
I have had my salary raised.
試験で何番上がる
to go up or rise (by) so many seats in the examination
今度の試験で十番上がった
I have risen ten seats in last examination.
名が揚がる
One becomes known―become famous.
彼は一夜の中に名が揚がったと言っている
He says he awoke one morning to find himself famous.
国威揚がる
The national prestige is raised―The glory of the nation is enhanced.
意気揚がる
to be elated―triumphant―exultant―jubilant
意気揚がらず
He is dejected―cast down.
元気揚がらず
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the blues―in the dumps.
店から利益が上がる
Profits accrue from the business―issue from the business―proceed from the business.
地代が一万円上がる
He has 10,000 yen from his land-rent.
家賃もだいぶ上がるだろう
He must have a great deal from his house-rent.
売上が五百円上がった
The proceeds amount to―come up to―500 yen.
入費はいくらで上がるだろうか
What will the expenses amount to?―come up to?
普請(建築費)は一万円以下では上がらない
The cost of building will amount to―come up to―not less than 10,000 yen.
入費が安く上がる
The expenses come low.
神社に賽銭が上がる
Money is offered―Money-offerings are made―at a shrine.
あの神社にはだいぶ賽銭が上がるだろう
The offertory at that shrine must amount to a great deal.
いつも酒や餅が上がっている
I always see offerings of wine and cake at the shrine.

content:
16. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 天気が上がる
The weather clears up.
雨が上がった
It has stopped raining―The rain has held up―The rain has let up.
梅雨が上がった
The rainy season is over.
本が上がった
I have finished the book.
色が上がる
The colour comes out.
証拠があがる
Evidence is found―The truth comes out―The crime is proved.
犯人が上がる
The culprit is caught (or taken).
蚕が上がる
The silkworm begins (or finishes) spinning.
傷に肉が上がる
A wound granulates.
役が上がった、足が上がった
He has lost his place―lost his situation.
魚が上がった
The fish is dead.
誰でもあの人の前へ出ると頭が上がらない
No one can hold up his head before him.

content: 〈他動〉(A Polite term for) to eat or drink

content.content: 肉を減らして野菜をもっとお上がりなさい
I would advise you to eat less meat and more vegetables.
貴方はお酒を上がりますか
Do you drink (wine)?
ご飯はどこで上がりますか
Where will you take your meals?
何をお上がりになりますか
What will you have?
(西洋人に向って)貴方は日本食をお上がりなさいますか
Can you live on Japanese food?
ご馳走が出ました、さあお上がりなさい
There is good cheer on the table. Please fall to!

content:
あがる〔上る〕
〈接尾詞〉

content.content: 勝手にしあがれ
Do as you please and be damned!
行くなら勝手に行きあがれ
Go and be damned!
どこへでも勝手に行きあがれ
Go anywhere you like and be damned!
また来あがった
He is here again, bad luck to him!
何をしあがるんだい
What is that for?
奴、金を貸しあがらん
He will not lend me the money―He refuses to lend me the money.
この薪は燃えあがらん
This wood will not burn―refuses to burn.
この抽斗は開きあがらん
This drawer will not open―refuses to open.
この口は抜けあがらん
The cork will not come out―refuses to come out.

content:
あかるい〔明るい〕
〈形〉
1. (=Dark に対し)light (room, etc.)

content.content: この座敷は暗い、もっと明るい座敷は無いか
This room is dark. Isn't there a lighter room?
四時にはもう明るくなる
It is light at four.
段々明るくなる
It grows light.
直ちに明るくなる
It will soon be light.
外はもう明るい
It is already light outside.
外はまだ明るい
It is still light without.
梟は明るい所では目が見えぬ
The owl can not see in the light.
明るいうちに着けるか
Can we get there before dark?
足下の明るい内に帰れ
Go home before it gets too dark to see―(より転じて)―Beat a retreat while you can see your out―(の意味を通例)―“Beat it while your shoes are good.”

content: 2. (=Dim に対し)bright (light, etc.)

content.content: 電灯は明るい
The electric light is bright.
月夜で昼間のように明るい
The moonlight is as bright as day.
日光を除いてマグネシヤほど明るい物は無い
With the exception of sunlight, nothing is brighter than the magnesium light.
空が明るくなる
The sky brightens.
ランプを明るくせよ
Make the lamp brighter―Turn up the light.

content: 3. (=何学に明るい)(to be) versed in, learned in, well read in, posted up in, conversant with, familiar with (some subject)

content.content: 彼は歴史に明るい
He is versed in history―conversant with history.
文学に明るい
He is versed in literature―well read in literature.
当世文学に明るい
He is posted up in current literature.
法律に明るい
He is learned in the law.
君はこのあたりの地理に明るいようだ
You seem to be versed in the topography of the neighbourhood―You seem to know every inch of the neighbourhood.
彼はこの道に明るい
He is versed in the subject―in the line.

content: 4. (=この道に明るい、事情に明るい)(to be) in the know, in the swim, in the trade, in the business, in the line, in the fashion

content.content: その社会の事情に明るい人は皆この事を知っている
Everybody who is in the know―in the swim―is aware in the fact.
上流社会の事情に明るい人に聞けばわかる
Any one who is in the fashion, will tell you the reason.
僕は実は商売仲間でその道に明るいのだから素人扱いにされては困る
I am really in the business―in the trade―in the line―and must be treated as such.
吉原が明るくなれば家は闇
When one is at home about town, it is dark at home.

content: 5. (=潔白な)innocent

content.content: 明るい身になる
to establish one's innocence―clear oneself (of the charge)―Vindicate one's character
出る所へ出て明るい身体にして貰わなければならない
Let us appear before the magistrate, I will prove my innocence.

content:
あかるみ〔明るみ〕
〈名〉The light:(より)the public

content.content: 事を明るみへ出す
to bring the matter before the public―bring the matter before the court
暗闇の恥を明るみへ出す
to bring a secret disgrace before the public―(に相当するは)―“wash one's dirty linen in public”

content:
あかれる〔飽かれる〕
〈受動〉To tire (one); to weary (one)

content.content: (人の家へ行った時は)飽かれないうちに帰れ
Leave a welcome behind you.

あかんたい〔亜寒帯〕
〈名〉The subfrigid zone

content:
あかんべい〔赤ん目〕
〈名〉Turning the lower eyelid with a finger (which signifies a strong refusal)

content.content: 赤んべいをする
to turn the red of the eye (to one)［注意］西洋でこれをすれば―“Do you see any green in my eye?”―(この目に黄色いところがあるか、己をだます気か)―の意味。

content: 〈間投詞〉I will die first.; I will see you hanged first.; Catch me!

あかんぼう〔赤ん坊〕
〈名〉A baby; a babe

content.content: 僕は生まれ立ての赤ん坊じゃないよ
I was not born yesterday.
その頃君はまだ赤ん坊だった
You were then still in long clothes.

content:
あき〔秋〕
〈名〉Autumn:(米国にては)fall:(=の) autumnal

content.content: 秋になった
Autumn has come.
いずこも同じ秋の夕暮
Autumn is autumn everywhere.
秋は悲しい
Autumn is a pensive season.
秋の彼岸
the autumnal equinox
秋の夜
an autumn night
秋の月
an autumn moon
秋の七草
the seven flowers of autumn
秋は日がつまる
The days grow shorter in autumn.
秋の日は釣瓶落し
Autumn dusk comes without warning.
秋は木の葉が落ちる
Trees shed their leaves in autumn.
秋は紅葉
Leaves turn red in autumn.
男心と秋の空
Men are as fickle as autumn weather―(西洋では)―“Woman is as fickle as April weather.”
秋の扇と棄てられる
to be thrown away like an old hat
一葉落ちて秋を知る
“A straw shows which way the wind blows.”
秋は過ぎた
Autumn is over.
秋の田のかりほの
In autumn's field I vigil keep
いほのとまをあらみ
'Neath shelter roughly thatched anew;
我衣手は
And lo! my sleeves that droop and weep
露に濡れつつ
Are, as with tears, all moist with dew.

content:
あき〔飽き〕
〈名〉Tiredness; weariness; satiety; satiation

content.content: 飽きが来る
to grow tired (of anything)―become satiated (with anything)―(殊に)―One's love cools towards the object of one's affection
あの女に飽きが来たと見える
He seems to be tired of the girl.
顔が綺麗なだけでは飽きが来る(長持ちがせぬ)
Mere beauty does not wear well.
あのような先生は飽きが来ない(長持ちがする)
Such a man will wear well as a teacher.

content:
あき〔明き〕
〈名〉A gap; an empty opening; a blank space; a vacancy; a vacant post

content.content: あきがあったらその人を使ってみよう
I will employ the man when there is a vacancy.
追々にあきができる
A vacancy will occur by and by.
どの級にもあきが無い
There is no vacancy in any of the classes.
あきをふさぐ
to fill a vacancy―stop a gap
あきがふさがった
The vacancy is filled.
あきを埋める
to fill a blank―fill up a gap―fill up a space
あき時間
vacant hours

content:
あきあきする〔飽き飽きする〕
〈自動〉To be sick of (flattery); to be sated with (pleasure); to be satiated with (luxury, etc.)

content.content: もう戦争は飽き飽きだ
We have had enough of war.
このことはもう飽き飽きだ
I am sick of the whole business.

content:
あきうど〔商人〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あきんど〔商人〕

content:
あきかぜ〔秋風〕
〈名〉The autumn wind

content.content: 秋風が立つ
The autumn wind begins to blow―(より秋を飽きに掛けて)―One's love cools towards the object of one's affection.

あきぐさ〔秋草〕
〈名〉The autumn flowers

content:
あきこ〔秋蚕〕
〈名〉The autumn-silkworm

content.content: 秋蚕を飼う
to raise ［rear］ the autumn-silkworm

あきさめ〔秋雨〕
〈名〉The autumn rain

あきしょう〔飽き性〕
〈名〉A fickle disposition; a flighty temperament

あきすねらい〔空巣狙い〕
〈名〉A sneak-thief; a prowler

あきだな〔空き店〕
〈名〉(英は)an unoccupied shop:(米は)a vacant store

content:
あきたらぬ〔飽き足らぬ〕
〈自動、形〉(To be) insatiable; (to be) unsatisfied; (one) never has enough

content.content: 強欲はいくら有っても飽き足らぬ
Avarice is insatiable―“Avarice knows no bounds.”
遊ぶだけ遊ばないと飽き足らぬ心地がする
If you do not take your fill of pleasure, you have an unsatisfied feeling.
そういうやり方ではあきたらぬ
That way of doing things is unsatisfying.

content:
あきたる〔飽き足る〕
〈自動〉To be sated with, be satiated with, be surfeited with, be cloyed with (pleasure, etc.)

content.content: 飽き足るほど遊ぶ
to take one's pleasure to satiety―take one's fill of pleasure

あきち〔空き地〕
〈名〉Unoccupied land; vacant ground

あきつしま〔秋津洲〕
〈固名〉(An archaic name for) Japan

content:
あきつす〔秋津洲〕
〈固名〉→『

content.content: あきつしま〔秋津洲〕

content:
あきっぽい〔飽きっぽい〕
〈形〉Fickle; flighty

content.content: 君は飽きっぽくて困る
You can stick to nothing.
君は飽きっぽいから何事も成功しないのだ
You do not succeed in anything, because you do not know how to stick to anything.
飽きっぽい者が物の役に立ったためし無し
A man who could stick to nothing, was never known to be good for anything.

content:
あきない〔商い〕
〈名〉Trade; commerce; business; traffic

content.content: 商いをする
to carry on trade―ply one's trade―(これからするのなら)―engage in commerce―engage in business―go into trade
商いしている
He is engaged in business―in business―in trade.
何に商いをしているか
What line of business is he engaged in?―What does he deal in?
商いを始める
to take to business―take to trade
商いを止める
to give up one's trade―retire from business
商いがありますか
How is business doing?―Are you doing good business?
商いがちっともありません
We are doing no business at all―Business is at a standstill.

content:
あきなう〔商う〕
〈他動〉To deal in, trade in, traffic in, handle, sell (some goods)

content.content: 何をお商いになりますか
What line of goods do you deal in?―What do you sell?

あきはてる〔飽き果てる〕
〈他動〉To be sick of (flattery); to be sated with (pleasure); to be satiated with (luxury, etc.)

あきびん〔空き瓶〕
〈名〉An empty bottle:(宴会などでは)dead men; old soldiers

content:
あきま〔空き間〕
〈名〉A vacant room; an unoccupied room; an empty room

content.content: 空き間があったら置いて下さい
You will take me if there is a vacant room.
空き間は一つもありません
There is not a single vacant room in the house.

あきめくら〔明き盲〕
〈形、名〉(An) illiterate (person); (an) unlettered (person)

あきや〔明屋〕
〈名〉A vacant house; an unoccupied house; a deserted house

content:
あきやすい〔飽き易い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: あきっぽい〔飽きっぽい〕

あきょう〔阿嬌〕
〈名〉A pretty girl; a lovely maiden; a comely maid; a bonny lass

content:
あきらか〔明らか〕
〈形〉
1. Clear, bright (light); clear, plain, obvious (meaning); clear, distinct (eyesight or pronunciation); clear, lucid, perspicuous (style); clear, distinct, vivid (idea or imagination); clear, explicit, express (statement); clear, perspicacious, sagacious (mind); clear, plain, evident, manifest (proof); clear, plain, obvious, patent, glaring (fact); clear, plain, evident, obvious (reason); clear, plain, evident, apparent (sign); clear, sharp (distinction); clear, well-defined (figure); clear, decided (difference, superiority or inferiority); clear, obvious (mistake); clear, obvious, pronounced (tendency):(=に) clearly; plainly; evidently; manifestly; obviously

content.content: 彼が無罪な事は明らかだ
It is clear that he is innocent.
彼の陳述が明らかにこの事実を示している
His statement clearly shows the fact―plainly points to the fact.
明らかに発音する
to speak distinctly
この方が明らかに勝っている
This is decidedly superior to the other.
自ら明らかだ
It is self-evident―The fact speaks for itself.
火を見るよりも明らか
It is as clear as day―as plain as a pikestaff―as plain as the nose on your face.
明らかに言ってある
It is expressly stated―explicitly stated.
意味が明らかだ
The meaning is clear―The meaning is plain―The meaning is obvious.
あの人の文章は明らかだ
He writes a perspicuous style―a lucid style.
彼は想像が明らかだ
He has a vivid imagination.
そうだという明らかな証拠がある
There is evident proof―manifest proof―that it is so.
彼が辞職した理由は明らかだ
He has resigned for an obvious reason.
二者は明らかな区別がある
There is a sharp distinction between the two.
世は民主主義に傾く傾向が明らかである
There is a pronounced tendency towards democracy.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 一見して明らか
“He who runs may read.”
彼が凡人でないことは一見して明らかだ
One can see at a glance―see with half an eye―that he is no common being.
彼の短所は一見して明らかだ
His faults lie on the surface.
事を明らかにする
to make the matter clear
秘密を明らかにする
to clear up a mystery
己が立場を明らかにする
to define one's position
権限を明らかにする
to define one's powers
向背を明らかにする
to define one's attitude―declare for or against a cause―declare oneself
理否曲直を明らかにする、白黒を明らかにする
to inquire into the merits of the case
論点を明らかにする
to elucidate a disputed point
疑わしい事を明らかにする
to clear a doubt―resolve one's doubts―dispel all doubts―enlighten one on a doubtful point―throw light on a doubtful matter
銭厘までも明らかにする
to account for every sen
預った金の行方を明らかにしなければならぬ
The money in my charge must be accounted for.
明らかになる
to become clear―become plain
それで事が明らかになった
That makes the matter clear.
お話で事が明らかになりました
Your information throws light on the matter.

content: 4. (=明るい)(to be) versed in, conversant with (a subject)

content.content: 彼は事情に明らかだ
He is versed in the state of things―conversant with the state of affairs.

content:
あきらめ〔諦め〕
〈名〉
1. (=仕方が無いと諦めること)resignation (to one's fate); reconcilement (to one's lot); consolation (for a loss):(=る) to resign oneself (to one's fate); to reconcile oneself (to one's lot); to console oneself (for a loss); to get over (a loss)

content.content: 人間諦めが肝腎
Resignation is the great lesson of life.
天命と諦める
to resign oneself to God's will―submit to the will of Heaven―bow to fate
天なり命なり諦めるよりほかはない
I must resign myself to Heaven's will―God's will be done!
天命と諦めた
I am resigned to Heaven's will.
前世の約束事と諦める、因果ずくだと諦める、因縁ずくだと諦める
to resign oneself to the decree of karma
運命と諦める、仕方がないと諦める、諦めをつける
to resign oneself to one's fate―bow to fate―submit to necessity―abide by the inevitable―accept the situation―take things as they are
諦めました、運命だと諦めました
I am resigned to my fate.
犯人は仕方がないと諦めたと見えて神妙にお縄を頂戴した
The culprit seemed to accept the situation, and suffered himself to be bound.
世の中はこんなものだと諦めた
I take the world as it is―I take the world as I find it―I “hold the world but as the world”―I take things as they are―I take things philosophically―I take things like a philosopher―I use philosophy.
人生は善かれ悪しかれこんなものだと諦めるほかはない
We must take life for better or for worse―take life for good or evil―take life whether for good or for bad.
自業自得と諦めるよりほかはない
One must take the consequences of one's own deeds―lie on the bed one has made―drink as one has brewed.
時世時節と諦めしゃんせ
Take the times as they are!
損は仕方ないと諦めた
I am reconciled to my loss.
この損ばかりは諦めがつかぬ
I can not reconcile myself to this loss.
損をしてもこれで儲けりゃ諦めがつく
By this gain, I can reconcile myself to my former loss―(他動詞構文にすれば)―This gain will reconcile me to my former loss.
尽すだけ尽しておけば失敗しても諦めがつく(諦めようがある)
If you fail after doing best, you can console yourself (for your failure) with the thought that you have left no means untried.
なるほど失敗はしたが尽すだけ尽したと思えば多少諦めがつく
We have failed, it is true, but after doing our best, and that's one consolation.
尽すだけ尽さずに失敗すると思いが残って諦めがつかぬ
If you fail without doing your best, you will regret that you have left undone what ought to have been done.
遊ぶだけ遊ばないと思いが残って諦めがつかぬ
If you do not take your fill of pleasure, you will have an unsatisfied feeling.
彼女は一人息子を無くして諦めかねている
She can not get the loss of her son―get over his loss.
遺族は諦めかねている
The bereaved family are unconsolable (for the loss of their beloved one)―He has left a disconsolate family behind him.
彼は諦めの好い人だ
He is easily reconciled to his loss―easy to please―easily contented―easily satisfied.
諦めの悪い人だ
He is not easily reconciled to his loss―hard to please―peevish―querulous.

content: 2. (=駄目だと諦めること、思い切ること、断念)abandonment of hope; relinquishment of hope:(=る) to abandon all hope, relinquish all hope, give up all hope (of success); to give up the attempt, abandon the attempt (in despair); to give up the idea, abandon the idea (of doing something); to have done with

content.content: とても成功はできぬと諦めた
I have given up all hope of success―abandoned all hope of success―relinquished all hope of success.
やってもみないうちから諦めをつけるのは早計だ
It is premature to abandon hope before you have tried―(英語風にすれば)―It will be time enough to give up hope when you have tried and failed.
(何度やっても失敗ばかりするから)駄目だと諦めた
I have given up the attempt in despair―given it up as a bad job.
(金が出ないから)洋行を諦めました
I have given up the idea of going abroad―abandoned the idea of going abroad.
人が死んだものと諦める、助からぬものと諦める
to give up a person for lost
君はとてもこちらの者になるまいと諦めておった
I had given you up for lost.
あの人は漫遊中に幾度も死んだものと諦められたことがある(幾度も線香を立てられた)
He was often given up for lost while on his travels.
船が水雷に触れた時はもうこれまでだと諦めた
When we struck a mine, I give myself up for lost.
無い縁だと諦めて下さい
You must give it up as an impossible union.
悪縁と諦めろ
You must give it up as hopeless love.
なにとぞこれまでの縁と諦めてくれ
I can not keep up the connection with you any longer.
男じゃないか、あんな女を諦めてしまえ
Be a man, and give her up!―Be a man, and have done with her!
あんな男はいくらでもある、諦められないか
Such men are to be found by the cartload. Can't you have done with him?
凡夫の浅ましさに諦めようと思って諦めかねている
As I am but an ordinary mortal, I can not have done with her.

content: 3. (=る)(=心を決める)to make up one's mind; to determine; to resolve

content.content: 諦められぬと諦めた
I have made up my mind that I can not have done with her.

content:
あきる〔飽きる〕
〈自動〉To become tired, become weary, become sick (of anything); to be cloyed, be sated, be satiated, be surfeited (with good thing); to have enough of (anything):(打消の場合は)to tire, weary (of anything)

content.content: どんなよい物でも終い{しまい}には飽きる
We get tired of―grow weary of―the best things in the end.
この仕事はもう飽きた
I am tired of this work.
この仕事は単調で飽きる
The work is monotonous and tiresome.
同じことを仕飽きた
I am tired of doing the same thing over and over again.
あの芝居は見飽きた
I am tired of seeing that play.
その歌は聞き飽きた
I am tired of hearing that song.
この本は読み飽きた
I am tired of reading this book.
もう待ち飽きた
I am weary of waiting.
世の中はもう飽きた
I am sick of life.
戦争はもう飽きた
We are tired of war―We have had enough of war.
けれど貴方はもう飽きた
But I have had enough of you.
旨い物を食い飽きる
to become sated with dainties
君は旨い物を食い飽きている
You are sated with―surfeited with―cloyed with―dainties.
飽きるほど旨い物を食う
to eat dainties to satiety
飽きるほど会ってみたい
I should like to see her to satiety.
彼は遊び飽きている
He is satiated with pleasure―blas?.［注意］打消には自動詞となる。
この景色は幾度見ても飽きない(いつ見てもよい)
I never tire of gazing upon this view.
この音楽は幾度聴いても飽きない(いつ聴いてもよい)
I never weary of listening to this music.
この本は幾度読んでも飽きない(いつ読んでもよい)
I never tire of reading this book.
彼の強欲は飽くことを知らぬ
His avarice is insatiable―His avarice knows no bounds.
少年は食い飽きるということが無い
A boy never has enough―“A school-boy has a wolf in his stomach.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 長居して飽きられるな
Do not wear out your welcome!―outstay your welcome!―strain your welcome!
飽きられないうちに帰れ
Leave a welcome behind you!
同じ物ばかりだと飽きるから今日は何か変わった物にしよう
Let us have something else today for change―for a change.
飽きも飽かれもせぬ仲だ
They still love each other.
飽きも飽かれもせぬ仲を世間の義理故遠ざかる
We lovers must part to satisfy the demands of custom.

content:
あきれかえる〔呆れ返る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: あきれはてる〔呆れ果てる〕
あきれかえるね
I am flabbergasted―It is enough to make a cat speak.

content:
あきれがお〔呆れ顔〕
〈名〉An astonished look; a look of amazement

content.content: あきれ顔をする
to look astonished―look amazed―stare aghast

content:
あきれはてる〔呆れ果てる〕
〈自動〉To be dumfoundered; to be flabbergasted

content.content: あきれ果てた奴だ
He is a disgusting fellow.
あきれ果てたばかだ
He is an egregious ass.
あきれ果てた仕打だ
His conduct is atrocious.
あきれ果てた発音だ
His pronunciation is outrageous.
あきれ果てた要求だ
His demands are preposterous.
あきれ果てた値段だ
The price is exorbitant.
あきれ果てた道路だ
The road are execrable.
君はあきれ果てた人だ
You are a horrible man.

content:
あきれる〔呆れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To be aghast, stand aghast, stare aghast (at something); to be astonished, be amazed (at something); to be dumfounded; to be flabbergasted

content.content: あの男には実にあきれるね
I am astonished at his conduct―amazed at his conduct.
その返答にあきれて互いに顔を見合わした
Aghast at the reply, we looked at each other.
その光景を見て皆あきれた
Everybody stood aghast at the sight―stared aghast at the sight.
僕の健忘には我ながらあきれる
I am astonished at my own forgetfulness.
あきれてものが言えぬ
I am dumfounded―dumb with astonishment―It is enough to make a cat speak.
あきれてものが言えなかった
I was struck dumb with astonishment―Astonishment deprived me of my power of speech.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼のあつかましいにはあきれる
I like his impudence.
あきれた奴だ
He is a disgusting fellow.
君はあきれた人だ
You are a horrible man.
あれはあきれたばかだ
He is an egregious ass.
君はあきれたことを言う人だ
You talk egregious nonsense.
彼はあきれたばかなことをする
He commits egregious follies.
あきれた仕打だ
His conduct is atrocious.
あきれた発音だ
His pronunciation is outrageous.
あきれた要求だ
His demands are preposterous.
あきれた値段だ
The price is exorbitant.
あきれた道路だ
The roads are execrable.
聞いてあきれる…,
indeed!
文学もないものだ、聞いてあきれら
Literature, indeed!
慈善がどうした、聞いてあきれら
Charity, forsooth!

content:
あきんど〔商人〕
〈名〉(卸商売、貿易商、問屋なら)a merchant:(店を開いている小売商なら)a tradesman (複数―tradesmen, tradespeople); a shopkeeper

content.content: 僕は商人になりたい
I wish to be a merchant―I aspire to commercial honours―I am an aspirant to commercial honours.
彼は商人になった
He has become a merchant―entered upon a commercial career.
商人根性
a sordid spirit―a mercenary spirit
彼は商人根性を遺憾なく発揮している
He displays his sordid spirit in all its naked glory.

content:
あく〔悪〕
〈名〉(物の善悪の悪)badness:(道徳上の悪)evil; wickedness; vice

content.content: 悪に染まる
to be steeped in vice
悪に染まるな
Eschew evil.
悪に染った人
a vicious man
悪に陥る
to fall into evil ways
悪には陥り易い
One easily falls into evil ways.
善は悪に勝つ
Virtue triumphs over vice.
悪に強ければ善にも強い
“A strong enemy will make a strong friend.”
彼は善にも悪にも強い
He is capable of good and evil―He has a power for good and evil.
悪に報いるに善を以てする
to return good for evil
善を以て悪に報い人を慚愧せしむ
to heap coals of fire on one's head

content:
あく〔灰汁〕
〈名〉Lye:(野菜のあく)potash; a harsh taste

content.content: あくに漬ける
to steep anything in lye
野生の野菜はあくが強い
Wild vegetables taste strongly of potash―They are harsh to the taste.
あくを出す、あくを抜く
to draw out the harshness
あの人はあくが抜けている、あくが抜けない
He has a chastened manner―an unchastened manner.

content:
あく〔飽く〕
〈他動〉To become tired, become weary (of anything); to be sated, be satiated, be surfeited, be cloyed (with good things); to have enough of (anything)

content.content: 美味に飽く
to be sated with dainties―be satiated with delicacies―have a pampered taste
君たちのような貴公子は美味に飽いているから何を食っても旨くあるまい
You, sybarites, with a pampered taste, can enjoy no delicacy.
美味に飽く者は美味の美味たるを知らず
A pampered mouth knows no delicacy.
美味を食って飽く事を知らず
He is an insatiable epicure.
学童は食に飽くことなし
A school-boy never has enough―“A school-boy has a wolf in his stomach.”
その強欲飽くことを知らず
His avarice is insatiable―His avarice knows no bounds.

content:
あく〔明く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=門などが開く)to open:(より) to begin; to commence

content.content: 木戸がいつに開くか
What time does the door open?
木戸が開いた
The door has opened―The door is open.
門は九時でないと開かない
The gate does not open till nine.
戸がにわかに開く
The doors fly open.
重い扉が左右にぎゅーと開く
The gates swing open right and left.
黄金の鍵で開かない錠は無い
A golden key opens every door―Every door opens to a golden key.
この抽斗{ひきだし}はなかなか開かない
This drawer will not open―refuses to open.
目が明く
One's eyes open.
目が明いた(これまでの誤りを悟った)
My eyes are opened―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
この箱の蓋が容易にあかない
This box will not open―refuses to open.
芝居の蓋がいつあくか
When does the theatre open?
芝居があく
The theatre opens―The play begins―The performance commences.
幕が開く
The curtain rises―The plays begins―The performance commences.
埒があく
The matter lends itself to arrangement.
埒があいた
The matter is arranged―The matter is settled―The problem is solved―The difficulty is overcome.
埒があかない
The difficulty is not to be overcome―There is no way out of the difficulty―It is no use―It is no good―It is no go.
君とはいつまで話しても埒があかぬ
It is no use talking with you.

content: 2. (=場所などがあく)to become empty; to become vacant; to fall vacant; to fall void; to be vacated; to be disengaged; to become free

content.content: 徳利があいた
The bottle is empty―I have emptied the bottle.
あの座敷があいていますか
Is that room vacant?―unoccupied?
今ふさがっておりますがじきにあきます
It is now occupied, but it will soon be vacant.
御座敷があきましたからどうぞこちらへ
The room is ready for your reception. Please step this way.
空いている家は無いか
Are there no vacant houses?―no unoccupied houses?
今はありませんが来月空くのがあります
There are none now, but some will become vacant―be vacated―next month.
(芝居の)場所があいているか
Are there any seats left?
席がだいぶあいている
There are many vacant seats―many unoccupied seats.
(汽車の)一等室があいていますか
Is there any room in the first-class compartment?
一等はあいていません、二等なら一人だけあいています
There is no room in the first-class; there is room for one in the second class.
一等があきました
There is room for you now in the first class.
地位があく
A post falls vacant―falls void.
地位のあくのを待つよりほかは無い
We must wait for a position to fall vacant.
手があく
to become disengaged―become free
今お手があいていますか
Are you disengaged just now?
三時から手があきます
I shall be free―at leisure―after three.
今は手がふさがっていますがじきにあきます
I am busy just now. I shall be free―at leisure―at your service―in a minute.

content: 3. (=道具などがあく)to be disengaged; to be not being used:(人を主格にすれば)to have done with (anything)

content.content: 新聞がおあきになりましたか
Have you done with the paper?
おあきになったら拝借
Please lend it me if you have done with it.
あいている新聞があったら貸してくれ
Bring me any paper that is not being read.
本がおあきになったら返してください
Please return the book when you have done with it―when you have done reading it.
小刀があいたか
Have you done with the knife?―done using the knife?
あきました
I have done with it―have done using it.
電話があいていますか
Is the telephone disengaged?―Is no one using the telephone?
電話があいているかどうか見て来てくれ
Go and see if the telephone is disengaged―if anybody is using the telephone.
あいています
It is disengaged―Nobody is using it.
孔があく
A hole is made―(欠陥を生ずるの意味なら)―A gap is left―A deficit occurs.
雨滴で石に穴があく
Falling drops wear a hole in a stone―“Falling drops will wear a stone.”
石に孔があいている
The stone is perforated.
耳に孔があいている
The ears are pierced.
耳に孔があいて耳環を下げるようになっている
The ears are pierced for ear-rings.
丸い孔のあいた戸
a door with a round hole in it
孔のあいた靴下
stockings with holes in them―holed socks
孔のあいた石
a perforated stone
孔のあいた耳
pierced ears
近頃の物入りで身代に大穴があいた
My outlays have left a gap―caused a deficit―in my finances.
人の顔を穴のあくほど見る
to scrutinize one's face―scan one's face―(可愛くてなら)―devour one's face
年期があく
One's term (of service) expires.
私はじきに年があけます
My term will soon be up.
年があきました
My term has expired―My term is up.
喪があく
One's period of mourning expires.

content: 〈他動〉

content.content: 口を開く
to open one's mouth
口を開いている
His mouth is open―He has his mouth open.
大口を開く
to open one's mouth wide―gape
口を開いて眺めている
He is staring with his mouth open―with open mouth.
びっくりして開いた口がふさがらぬ
to be in open-mouthed surprise―to gape and stare
開いた口に牡丹餅だ
It is a godsend―a windfall.
そんな相談なら開いた口に牡丹餅だ
I would jump at such a proposal.
開いた口に牡丹餅は落ちて来ぬ
“Larks do not fall ready-roasted into your mouth.”

content:
あくい〔悪意〕
〈名〉
1. (=悪気)ill-will; malice; spite

content.content: 悪意を懐く
to bear one ill-will―bear one malice
僕は君に対して悪意は無い
I bear you no malice.
悪意でしたことではない
It was not done out of spite.
彼は(あんなことを言っても)悪意は無いのだ
He means no harm―means no offence.
僕の言うことを悪意に解してくれ給うな
You must not take it ill―take it amiss.
悪意の批評
malicious criticism

content: 2. (=悪心)an evil motive; a sinister motive

content.content: 何でもない行為を悪意あってした事のように解釈する
to impute a sinister motive to an innocent action
悪意ある企て
a sinister design

content:
あくうん〔悪運〕
〈名〉The good luck of the wicked; the devil's luck

content.content: 彼は悪運が強い
“The devil's child has the devil's luck.”
悪運強く法律の網をもぐっている
He has the devil's luck, and succeeds in evading the law.
悪運が尽きた
He has come to the end of his devil's luck.

content:
あくえき〔悪疫〕
〈名〉An epidemic; a pestilence

content.content: 悪疫発生す
An epidemic breaks out.
悪疫流行す
An epidemic prevails―An epidemic is prevalent.
悪疫流行の兆あり
There are signs of epidemics prevailing.
悪疫猖獗を極む
The epidemic is raging or rife or rampant.
悪疫流行地
an infected district
悪疫流行地を経て来る貨物は消毒を要す
Goods coming through infected districts must be disinfected.
悪疫に罹る
to be attacked with an epidemic
悪疫に罹っている
He is suffering from the epidemic.
悪疫に罹って斃れる
to die of the epidemic―succumb to the epidemic―fall a prey to the epidemic
悪疫に斃れる者何千
Thousands succumbed to the epidemic―The epidemic carried off thousands.
悪疫が町を荒らした、市民を荒らした
The epidemic―ravaged the town―worked havoc with the townspeople.
悪疫を撲滅する
to stamp out an epidemic
悪疫を媒介するものは主に水である
Water is the chief medium for the dissemination of epidemics.

content:
あくえん〔悪縁〕
〈名〉
1. (=悪運)evil destiny

content.content: あの人に逢ったのは身の悪縁だ
I met him in an evil hour.

content: 2. (=悪い縁)an evil connection

content.content: 悪縁と手を切る
to fling off an evil connection
切っても切れない悪縁
a fatal connection

content: 3. (=ままならぬ縁)hopeless love

content.content: 悪縁と諦めろ
You must give it up as hopeless love.
諦められぬ悪縁
a fatal attachment

あくがた〔悪方〕
〈名〉
1. (=芝居の敵役)the villain (of a play)
2. (=芝居の荒役)the ruffian (of a play)

あくぎ〔悪戯〕
〈名〉Mischief; devilment; roguery:(普通名詞に用いれば)a prank; a practical joke; a (low) trick; a devilry; a deviltry

content:
あくぎゃくむどう〔悪逆無道〕
〈名〉
1. (=残忍非道)atrocity:(=なる) atrocious
2. (=叛逆)treason; treachery

content.content: 悪逆無道の徒
rebels―traitors

content:
あくさい〔悪妻〕
〈名〉A bad wife

content.content: 悪妻は六十年の不作
A bad wife is a lifelong dearth.

content:
あくじ〔悪事〕
〈名〉
1. An evil deed; a dark deed; a crime; a knavery; a villainy

content.content: 大悪事
a deed of the darkest dye
悪事をなす、悪事を働く
to do evil―work evil―commit a crime
悪事をなす者は枕を高くして寝られぬ
An evil-doer can not sleep in peace.
悪事を慎む
to eschew evil
悪事をたくらむ
to devise evil―plot mischief―scheme―intrigue―machinate
悪事をあばく
to expose a villainy
悪事は顕われる
An evil deed will be discovered―A dark deed will come to light―Murder will out.
悪事露顕に及ぶ
A villainy has come to light―The murder is out.

content: 2. (=凶報)ill news

content.content: 悪事千里
“Ill news runs apace.”

content:
あくしつ〔悪疾〕
〈名〉A foul disease

content.content: あの女は悪疾の血統を引いている
Her blood is tainted.

content:
あくじつ〔悪日〕
〈名〉An evil day; an unlucky day

content.content: 今日は如何なる悪日ぞ
Woe worth the day?

content:
あくしゅ〔握手〕
〈名〉
1. Shaking hands:(一回なら)a hand-shake:(=する) to shake hands (with one); to shake (one) by the hand

content.content: 彼は握手を求めた
He held out his hand.

content: 2. (=仲直り)reconciliation:(=する) to be reconciled (with one); to make up (with an estranged friend)

content.content: 彼ともう握手した
I am reconciled with him―I have made up with him.

content: 3. (=和合)harmony; good understanding:(=する) to come to an understanding; to join hands (with rival, etc.)

content.content: 両派が握手した
The two parties have joined hands with each other.

content:
あくしゅう〔悪習〕
〈名〉A bad habit; a bad custom; an evil practice; a vice

content.content: 彼は虚言の悪習がある
He has the vice of lying.
悪習がつく
to contract a bad habit
悪習を脱する
to get rid of a bad habit―break oneself of a habit―lay aside an evil practice―give up a vice
悪習を打破する
to break down a bad custom

content:
あくしゅう〔悪臭〕
〈名〉Bad smell; offensive smell; foul odour; stench; stink:(=の) foul (breath); stinking (ditch); rank (fish); malodorous (matter, etc.)

content.content: 悪臭を放つ
to give out bad smell―stink
悪臭の呼吸
foul breath

content:
あくしょ〔悪所〕
〈名〉A bad quarter

content.content: 悪所通いする
to frequent bad quarters―frequent houses of ill fame

content:
あくじょ〔悪女〕
〈名〉An ugly woman; a plain woman; a homely woman

content.content: 悪女の深情け
The plainer the woman, the fiercer the love

content:
あくしょう〔悪性〕
〈名〉
1. (=悪い性質)evil nature:(=の) evil-natured (man)

content:
あくせく
〈名〉Fuss; fussiness:(副詞に用いれば)fussily:(=する)to fuss; to make a fuss; to fidget; to fret; to worry:(形容詞に用いれば)(to be)fussy, fidgety, restless, uneasy, over-anxious, too eager

content.content: 小人はあくせくする
Small people are fussy.
小人はつまらぬ事にあくせくする
Small people fuss about trifles―make a fuss about trifles―make too much fuss about trifles.
ただあくせくと日を送る
to pass a restless day―lead a restless life―be restlessly busy about nothing
あくせくと働く
to drudge it―slave it―fag it―plod away―grub away―toil and moil
彼らは一生あくせく働いて暮す
They drudge it all their lives.
彼はあくせく働く人だ
He is a drudge―a hack―a hackney.
あくせく働くこと
drudgery
あくせく働くのがいやになった
I am tired of drudgery.
彼があくせく働いてためた金だ
He has toiled and moiled for the money.
世人は金儲けにあくせくする
People are eager to make money―too eager for wealth.
成功にあくせくする
People are anxious to succeed―over-anxious for success.
今時の学生は試験にばかりあくせくする
Students nowadays worry over examinations only.
彼は超然としてあくせくする世人と交わらぬ
He keeps aloof from “the madding crowd.”

The wicked have fallen, and the good prosper. All is well that ends well.

content:
あける〔明ける、開ける〕
〈自動〉
1.

content.content: 夜が明ける
Day breaks―Morning dawns.
いま何時に夜が明けるか
What time does day break?
もう夜が明けた
It is daylight now.
一時間経てば夜が明ける
It will be daylight in an hour's time.
夜はほのぼのと明け渡る
Day is dawning.
夜が明けると銀世界
The day broke on a world of silver.
一夜明ければ大正十五年
The sun rises on the Fifteenth Year of Taisho.
明けても暮れても
night and day―early and late―awake or asleep
この事ばかりは明けても暮れても忘れぬ
I never forget the matter awake or asleep―The idea forms part of myself.
女ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Woman is the light of life.
女ならでは夜の明けぬ国
the land on which woman shines
君ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
You are the light of my eyes.
あの家は春子さんならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Haruko San is the light of the household.
君は春子さんでなければ夜も日も明けないだろう
Haruko San is the light of your eyes, isn't she?
年{とし}が明ける
The New Year opens―The New Year begins.
明けておめでとう
(I with you a) Happy New Year!―A happy New Year to you!
年(期)が明ける
One's term (of service) expires.
年{ねん}が明けた
My term has expired―My term is up.
私はじきに年が明けます
My term will soon be up.
早く年明け主{ぬし}のそば
How I long for my term to expire, that I may live with you!
喪が明ける
One's period of mourning expires.
寒が明ける
The cold season closes.
寒が明けた
The cold season is over.
梅雨が明ける
The rainy season closes.
梅雨が明けた
The rainy season is over.

content:

この戸を開けると通りへ出る
This door opens on the street.
この戸を開けると庭へ出る
This door opens into the garden.
この戸を開けると縁側

この戸を開けると廊下
This door opens into the passage.
この戸を開けると客間
This door opens into the parlour.
目を大きく開ける
to open one's eyes wide
口を大きく開ける
to open one's mouth wide―gape
口を開けている
He has his mouth open.
口を開けて眺めている
They are gazing with their mouths open.
目を開けて眠る
He sleeps with his eyes open.
本を開ける
to open a book
二十ページを開けて
Open your books at page 20.
本を開けておけ
Leave your book open!―(わざとなら)―Keep your book open!
一枚開ける
to turn over a page
一枚開けると図が有る
Turn over the page, and you will find an illustration.
本を一枚一枚開ける
to turn over the leaves of a book
蓋を開ける
to take off the lid―raise the cover―uncover a box―open a box
幕を開ける
to open the curtain―raise the curtain―draw (back) the curtain
包みを開ける
to open a package―undo a parcel
缶を開ける
to open a can―(は米、英は)―open a tin
樽の口を開ける
to broach a cask
開けて悔しき玉手箱
I find the casket empty―I find it an apple of Sodom―I find the bird flown.
埒をあける
to settle the matter
埒をあけてもらいたい
I want to have the matter settled.

content: 2. (=空にする) to empty (a cup); to vacate (a room); to quit (a house); to leave (a space); to clear (a table)

content.content: 盃をおあけなさい
Empty your cup!―Drain your grass!―Drink!
コップの水をあける
to pour out the water from the glass―empty the glass of the water
財布の金を卓上にあけた
I emptied my purse upon the table.
場所をあける
to clear a space―make room
場所をあけて人や物を入れる
to make room for a person or thing
座敷をあける
to clear a room―make room―(あけ渡す、又は不在にするのなら)―leave a room
(座敷は皆ふさがっておりますが)あけてお貸し申しましょう
We will make room for you.
この座敷を(若しふさがっているなら)あけてもらえますか
Can you have this room ready for me?
明日あけて上げます
We shall have it ready for you tomorrow.
(また来るから)この座敷をあけておいておくれ
Please hold this room for me.
それではあけておきます
Then we will keep it ready for your reception.
勘定をお払い下さらなければ座敷をあけておもらい申したい
If you will not pay the bill, I must ask you leave the room.
(ここには大事な物があるから)ちょっとでも座敷をあけないように願います
You must not leave the room even for a moment.
家をあける
to clear a house―(あけ渡すのなら)―vacate a house―quit a house―(不在にするのなら)―be away from home
月末までに家をあけていただきたい
I wish you would quit the house by the end of the month.
(家は皆ふさがっているが)一つあけて貸して上げましょう
I will get one of the houses ready for you.
あの人は滅多に家をあけない
He is seldom away from home.
君は家をあけ通しだ
You are always away from home.
倉を開ける
to clear (out) the godown―make room in the godown
倉を開けて荷物を入れる
to make room in the godown for the goods
倉を開けてもらえまいか
Can you make room for my goods?
席をあける
to make room for some one―give up one's seat to some one
どうも申しかねましたがこのご婦人に席をあけて下さいませんか
Might I ask you to make room for this lady?―resign your seat to this lady?
路をあける
to clear the track―make way for a person or thing
路をあけて人や車を通す
to make way for a person or a carriage
路をあけろ
Clear the track!―Make way for me!
馬車が来たから路をあけろ
Make way for the carriage!
群衆は路をあけて一行を通した
The crowd make way for the party.
地位をあける
(辞職してなら)to vacate a post―(あけておくのなら)―leave a position vacant
地位は責任者の無いためあけてある
The position is left vacant for want of a fit person.
机と机との間を開ける
to leave spaces between the desks
一行ずつ開けて書く
to write on every other line
二行ずつ開ける
to leave out every two lines―write on every third line
手をあける
to disengage oneself―find time to spare
ちょっと手をあけてもらえますか
Can you spare me a few minutes?
いま手をあけかねます
I am engaged just now.

content: 3. (=穿つ)to make (a hole)

content.content: 孔をあける
to make a hole
壁に孔をあける
to make a hole in the wall―pierce the wall―perforate the wall
壁をつついて孔をあける
to pick a hole in the wall
鼠が壁に孔をあける
A mouse gnaws a hole in the wall―gnaws through the wall.
障子に指で孔をあける
to tear a hole in the paper-screen
障子をなめて孔をあける
to lick a hole in the paper-screen
紙を鋏んで孔をあける
to snip a hole in paper
着物を焼いて孔をあける
to burn a hole in one's coat
岩に孔をあける
to bore a hole in the rock―perforate the rock
戸に錐で孔をあける
to bore a hole in the door―bore through the door
錐で鉄板に孔をあける
to drill (a hole in) an iron plate
耳に孔をあける
to make a hole in the ear―pierce the ear
耳に孔をあけて耳環を下げる
The ear is pierced for the ear-ring.
壁に窓があけてある
The wall is pierced with windows.
砲弾が舷側に孔をあける
A shell perforates the ship's side.
郵便切手に切取孔があけてある
Postage stamps are perforated.
(槍で)風孔をあける
to let daylight into one―let daylight through one
大穴をあける
to make a hole in the fund―leave a deficit (through peculation)
番頭が店に大穴をあけた
The head clerk has been peculating on a large scale―embezzling to a large extent.

content:
あける〔明ける、開ける〕
〈自動〉
1.

content.content: 夜が明ける
Day breaks―Morning dawns.
いま何時に夜が明けるか
What time does day break?
もう夜が明けた
It is daylight now.
一時間経てば夜が明ける
It will be daylight in an hour's time.
夜はほのぼのと明け渡る
Day is dawning.
夜が明けると銀世界
The day broke on a world of silver.
一夜明ければ大正十五年
The sun rises on the Fifteenth Year of Taisho.
明けても暮れても
night and day―early and late―awake or asleep
この事ばかりは明けても暮れても忘れぬ
I never forget the matter awake or asleep―The idea forms part of myself.
女ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Woman is the light of life.
女ならでは夜の明けぬ国
the land on which woman shines
君ならでは夜も日も明けぬ
You are the light of my eyes.
あの家は春子さんならでは夜も日も明けぬ
Haruko San is the light of the household.
君は春子さんでなければ夜も日も明けないだろう
Haruko San is the light of your eyes, isn't she?
年{とし}が明ける
The New Year opens―The New Year begins.
明けておめでとう
(I with you a) Happy New Year!―A happy New Year to you!
年(期)が明ける
One's term (of service) expires.
年{ねん}が明けた
My term has expired―My term is up.
私はじきに年が明けます
My term will soon be up.
早く年明け主{ぬし}のそば
How I long for my term to expire, that I may live with you!
喪が明ける
One's period of mourning expires.
寒が明ける
The cold season closes.
寒が明けた
The cold season is over.
梅雨が明ける
The rainy season closes.
梅雨が明けた
The rainy season is over.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=開く)to open (a door, a gate, a window, etc.)

content.content: 戸を開けろ
Open the door!
戸を開けて見ると誰もいない
I opened the door to find no one.
戸を開けておいてはいかん
You must not leave the door open.
窓を開けておけ
Keep the window open.
この戸を開けると通りへ出る
This door opens on the street.
この戸を開けると庭へ出る
This door opens into the garden.
この戸を開けると縁側
This door opens on the verandah.
この戸を開けると廊下
This door opens into the passage.
この戸を開けると客間
This door opens into the parlour.
目を大きく開ける
to open one's eyes wide
口を大きく開ける
to open one's mouth wide―gape
口を開けている
He has his mouth open.
口を開けて眺めている
They are gazing with their mouths open.
目を開けて眠る
He sleeps with his eyes open.
本を開ける
to open a book
二十ページを開けて
Open your books at page 20.
本を開けておけ
Leave your book open!―(わざとなら)―Keep your book open!
一枚開ける
to turn over a page
一枚開けると図が有る
Turn over the page, and you will find an illustration.
本を一枚一枚開ける
to turn over the leaves of a book
蓋を開ける
to take off the lid―raise the cover―uncover a box―open a box
幕を開ける
to open the curtain―raise the curtain―draw (back) the curtain
包みを開ける
to open a package―undo a parcel
缶を開ける
to open a can―(は米、英は)―open a tin
樽の口を開ける
to broach a cask
開けて悔しき玉手箱
I find the casket empty―I find it an apple of Sodom―I find the bird flown.
埒をあける
to settle the matter
埒をあけてもらいたい
I want to have the matter settled.

content.content: 盃をおあけなさい
Empty your cup!―Drain your grass!―Drink!
コップの水をあける
to pour out the water from the glass―empty the glass of the water
財布の金を卓上にあけた

場所をあける
to clear a space―make room
場所をあけて人や物を入れる
to make room for a person or thing
座敷をあける
to clear a room―make room―(あけ渡す、又は不在にするのなら)―leave a room
(座敷は皆ふさがっておりますが)あけてお貸し申しましょう
We will make room for you.
この座敷を(若しふさがっているなら)あけてもらえますか
Can you have this room ready for me?
明日あけて上げます
We shall have it ready for you tomorrow.
(また来るから)この座敷をあけておいておくれ
Please hold this room for me.
それではあけておきます
Then we will keep it ready for your reception.
勘定をお払い下さらなければ座敷をあけておもらい申したい
If you will not pay the bill, I must ask you leave the room.
(ここには大事な物があるから)ちょっとでも座敷をあけないように願います
You must not leave the room even for a moment.
家をあける
to clear a house―(あけ渡すのなら)―vacate a house―quit a house―(不在にするのなら)―be away from home
月末までに家をあけていただきたい
I wish you would quit the house by the end of the month.
(家は皆ふさがっているが)一つあけて貸して上げましょう
I will get one of the houses ready for you.
あの人は滅多に家をあけない
He is seldom away from home.
君は家をあけ通しだ
You are always away from home.
倉を開ける
to clear (out) the godown―make room in the godown
倉を開けて荷物を入れる
to make room in the godown for the goods
倉を開けてもらえまいか
Can you make room for my goods?
席をあける
to make room for some one―give up one's seat to some one
どうも申しかねましたがこのご婦人に席をあけて下さいませんか
Might I ask you to make room for this lady?―resign your seat to this lady?
路をあける
to clear the track―make way for a person or thing
路をあけて人や車を通す
to make way for a person or a carriage
路をあけろ
Clear the track!―Make way for me!
馬車が来たから路をあけろ
Make way for the carriage!
群衆は路をあけて一行を通した
The crowd make way for the party.
地位をあける
(辞職してなら)to vacate a post―(あけておくのなら)―leave a position vacant
地位は責任者の無いためあけてある
The position is left vacant for want of a fit person.
机と机との間を開ける
to leave spaces between the desks
一行ずつ開けて書く
to write on every other line
二行ずつ開ける
to leave out every two lines―write on every third line
手をあける
to disengage oneself―find time to spare
ちょっと手をあけてもらえますか
Can you spare me a few minutes?
いま手をあけかねます
I am engaged just now.

content: 3. (=穿つ)to make (a hole)

content.content: 孔をあける
to make a hole
壁に孔をあける
to make a hole in the wall―pierce the wall―perforate the wall
壁をつついて孔をあける
to pick a hole in the wall
鼠が壁に孔をあける
A mouse gnaws a hole in the wall―gnaws through the wall.
障子に指で孔をあける
to tear a hole in the paper-screen
障子をなめて孔をあける
to lick a hole in the paper-screen
紙を鋏んで孔をあける
to snip a hole in paper
着物を焼いて孔をあける
to burn a hole in one's coat
岩に孔をあける
to bore a hole in the rock―perforate the rock
戸に錐で孔をあける
to bore a hole in the door―bore through the door
錐で鉄板に孔をあける
to drill (a hole in) an iron plate
耳に孔をあける
to make a hole in the ear―pierce the ear
耳に孔をあけて耳環を下げる
The ear is pierced for the ear-ring.
壁に窓があけてある
The wall is pierced with windows.
砲弾が舷側に孔をあける
A shell perforates the ship's side.
郵便切手に切取孔があけてある
Postage stamps are perforated.
(槍で)風孔をあける
to let daylight into one―let daylight through one
大穴をあける
to make a hole in the fund―leave a deficit (through peculation)
番頭が店に大穴をあけた
The head clerk has been peculating on a large scale―embezzling to a large extent.

content:
あげる〔挙げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To raise

content.content: 手を挙げる
to raise one's hand―lift up one's hand―(採決の時なら)―show one's hand―(敬礼なら)―touch one's cap
仰天して両手を挙げた
He held up his hands―threw up his hands―in astonishment.
(抵抗せぬしるしに)両手を挙げろ
Hands up!
賛成な人は手を上げて
Let those who are in favour of the proposition, show their hands!
旗を挙げる
to raise a standard
義旗を挙げる
to raise one's standard in the cause of justice
叛旗を挙げる
to raise the standard of revolt
兵を挙げる
to raise an army―raise a war
義兵を挙げる
to raise an army in the cause of justice―raise a righteous war
事を挙げる
to raise a war
義の為に事を挙げる
to raise a righteous war
盃を挙げて人の健康を祝す
to drink one's health

content: 2. (=かかげる)to mention (names); to enumerate (names); to give (examples); to cite (instances); to adduce (a fact); to produce (evidence)

content.content: 人の名を挙げてはいかん
You must not mention names.
人の名を一々挙げる(列挙する)
to enumerate the names
挙げて数うべからず
They are too numerous to be mentioned―not to be enumerated―innumerable.
人の非を挙げるものでない
You should not mention others' faults.
彼の非を挙げるのはただご注意の為
I only mention his faults as a warning to you.
例を挙げる
(人や物なら)to give examples―(事実なら)―cite instances
事実を挙げる
to give the facts of the case―adduce facts
証拠を挙げる
to adduce proofs―(法廷でなら)―produce evidence
反証を挙げる
to produce counter-evidence―disprove the evidence―negative the evidence―prove a negative

content: 3. (=挙行する)to hold (a ceremony); to perform (a ceremony); to celebrate (a festival); to solemnize (a festival)

content.content: 式を挙げる
to hold a ceremony―perform a ceremony
結婚式(華燭の典)を挙げる
to celebrate a wedding―solemnize a marriage
今夜結婚式を挙げる筈
The wedding is to be celebrated this evening.
開業式を挙げる
to hold the inauguration ceremony

content: 4. (=全部を出す)to put forth one's all

content.content: 全力を挙げる
to do all one can―do everything in one's power
全財産を挙げて一事業に投ずるものでない
You should not invest your all in a single enterprise―risk your all on a single venture―put all your eggs in one basket.
全級を挙げて退校した
The whole class left school―The class left school in a body.
子を挙げる
(母なら)to bear children―(父なら)―beget children―(育て上げるの意味なら)―bring up children―raise up children―rear children
彼は三男二女を挙げた
He had three sons and two daughters (born to him).
人才を挙げる
to employ talent―open the public offices to talent
適材を挙げて適所に置く
to use the right man in the right place
犯人を挙げる
to catch the culprit―take the culprit―apprehend the offender
掏摸{すり}を挙げる
to send up a pickpocket
犯人が上がり次第槍玉に挙げる
We will make an example of the first offender we catch―The first offender shall be made an example of.

content:
あげる〔上げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To raise; to lift; to elevate; to send up

content.content: 顔を上げる
to raise one's head―look up
手を上げる
to raise one's hand―lift up one's hand
仰天して両手を上げた
He held up his hands―threw up his hands―in astonishment.
(抵抗せぬというしるしに)両手を挙げろ
Hands up!
賛成な人は手を上げて
Let those who are in favour of the proposition, show their hands!
手を上げて敬礼する
to touch one's cap
足を上げる
to raise one's foot
眉を上げる
to raise one's eyebrows
目尻を上げる
to show one's spirit
髪を上げる
to do up one's hair
熱を上げる
to heighten the fever
凧を上げる
to fly a kite
風船を上げる
to fly a balloon―send up a balloon
花火を上げる
to set off fireworks
狼火{のろし}を上げる
to fire a rocket―show a beacon
網を上げる
to haul up a net
釣った魚を上げる
to land a fish
床を上げる
to put away the bedding―(病人なら)―rise from a sick-bed
畳を上げる
to raise the mats
砲口(銃口)を上げる
to elevate the muzzle (of a gun)
声を上げる
to raise one's voice―lift up one's voice―raise a cry―set up a shout
ひと声上げる
to give a cry―give a shout
鯨波(ときのこえ)を上げる
to raise a shout of triumph
悲鳴を上げる
to shriek―give a shriek―utter a shriek
調子を上げる
to raise the pitch

content: 2. (=何をどこへ上げる)

content.content: 本を棚へ上げる
to set a book on the shelf
自分の事は棚へ上げて
“One can not see the beam in one's own eye”―“The pot calls the kettle black.”
子どもを学校へ上げる
to send a boy to school―put a boy to school
それでは誰が人を上げましょう
Then I will send somebody to you.
あんな人間を家へ上げてはいかん
You must not admit such a man (into the house).
犬を家へ上げてはいかん
You must not bring your dog into the house―let your dog into the house.
西洋では犬を家へ上げる
In foreign countries, they keep their dogs in the house.

content: 3. (=昇進せしむ)to raise; to promote; to advance

content.content: 役人を上げる
to promote an official
位を上げる
to raise one's rank
月給を上げる
to raise one's salary
給金を上げる
to raise the wages
賃銭を上げる
to raise the fare
相場を上げる
to raise the price
利息を上げる
to raise the interest
家賃を上げる
to raise the rent
地代を上げる
to raise the land-rent
値段を上げる
to raise the price
人の値段を上げる
to raise a man in the public estimation

content: 4. (=上達する)to progress; to improve; to advance

content.content: 彼は学問を上げた
He has progressed in his studies.
腕を上げた
He has improved in his ability.
芸を上げた
He has improved in his art.
男振りを上げた
He has improved in his looks.
器量を上げた
(女なら)She has improved in her charms―(男なら)―He has risen in the public estimation.
価値を上げた、男を上げた
He has risen in the public estimation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His conduct has raised him in the public estimation.

content: 5. (=終わる)to finish

content.content: 本を上げる
to finish a book
第三読本を上げたばかりだ
I have just finished the Third Reader.

content:
6. (=食った物を吐く)to vomit, reject, throw up, cast up, fetch up, spew, spue, puke (what one has eaten or drunk)
7. (=人に物を上げる)to give (one something); to offer (one something); to present (one with something―something to one); to write (one a letter―to one)

content.content: 何を上げましょうか
What shall I give you?―(食卓で言えば)―What shall I help you to?―(店番が言えば)―What do you want, sir(or madam)?
葡萄酒を一杯上げましょうか
May I offer you a glass of wine?―Will you have a glass of wine?
百円上げたらお取りになるか
If I offer you 100 yen, will you take it?
本がご入用なら一部上げよう
If you want the book, I will make you a present of a copy.
その金を上げるから取っておきなさい
You may keep the money.
一人娘だから上げる訳には行きません
She is my only daughter, so I can not give her away.
その事なら手紙を上げた筈だ
Didn't I write to you on the subject?
お供物を上げる
to make an offering to a deity
お賽銭を上げる
to make an offering of money
お灯明を上げる
to offer a candle at a shrine
君に上げたいものがある
I have something for you―I wish to make you a present.
これは少ないが君に上げる
Here is something for you.
この本は君に上げるのだ
This book is for you.
(代価を置いて)はい上げるよ
There you are!

content: 8. (=人に何かして上げる)(I will do it) for you

content.content: 今そこを開けて上げる
I'll open the door for you.
手紙が書けないなら書いて上げよう
If you can not write the letter, I will write it for you.
何でもして上げる
I will do anything for you.［注意］“for”を略して“you”を間接目的とする動詞あり。
靴を買って上げよう
I will buy you a pair of shoes.
洋服を拵えて上げよう
I will make you a suit of clothes.
切符を買って上げよう
I will get you a ticket.
好い地位を見つけて上げよう
I will find you a good position.
東京に地位を得て上げよう
I will secure you―procure you―a position in Tokyo.
案内して上げよう
I will show you the way.

content:
9. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 芸者を上げる
to engage a geisha (for a drinking party)
芸者を上げて騒ぐ
to have a geisha spree
お客に上げる
to admit a visitor (into a house of entertainment)
手前どもではふりのお客を上げません
We do not entertain strangers―serve strangers.
木が水を上げている
The tree is alive.
女が男に血道を上げている
She is infatuated with him.

content: 〈自動〉

content.content: 潮は今上げている
The tide is flowing―The tide is on the flow.

content:
あげる〔上げる〕
〈接尾動詞〉To finish

content.content: 本を読み上げた
I have finished reading―done reading―the book.
飯を食い上げた
I have finished eating―done eating.
仕事を仕上げた
I have finished my task.

content:
あげる〔揚げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To raise; to hoist; to put up

content.content: 旗を揚げる
to hoist a flag―put up a flag―hang out a flag
白旗を揚げる
to show a white flag―display the flag of truce
半旗を揚げて弔意を表わす
to half-mast the flag in token of mourning
団扇を揚げる
to raise the fan
行司が東の方に団扇を揚げる
The umpire raises his fan in favour of the East―declares the East the victor―declares for the East.
帆を揚げる
to hoist a sail
順風に帆を揚げる
to sail before the wind
錨を揚げる
to weigh anchor
荷を陸へ揚げる
to land cargo―discharge cargo
木は水を揚げている
The tree is alive.
名を揚げる
to win fame―win renown―win laurels―reap laurels―make a name for oneself―make a noise in the world
彼は学者として名を揚げた
He distinguished himself as a scholar.
国威を揚げる
to raise the national prestige―enhance the glory of the nation
油で揚げる
to fry fish or vegetables (in oil)

content:
あけわたす〔明け渡す〕
〈他動〉To give up, deliver up, surrender (a castle to the enemy); to evacuate (a town); to vacate, quit (a house); to leave (a room)

content.content: 城をあけ渡す
to surrender the castle to the enemy
家をあけ渡す
to vacate a house―quit a house
彼は店を債権者にあけ渡した
He has turned over his business to his creditors.
いよいよ内閣あけ渡しの時期が迫って来た
The time has come for delivering up the Cabinet to the Opposition.

content:
あけわたる〔明け渡る〕
〈自動〉(=夜が明けわたる)Day breaks

content.content: 夜はほのぼのと明けわたる
Morning is dawning.

content:
あご〔顎〕
〈名〉
1. The jaw

content.content: 上顎、下顎
the upper jaw―the lower jaw
顎がはずれる
The jaws get out of joint―The jaws become dislocated.
顎がはずれた
My jaws are out of joint―My jaws are dislocated.
あまり笑って顎をはずす
to laugh one's jaws out of joint
顎をはずして笑う
to roar with laughter―die with laughing

content: 2. (=頤)the chin

content.content: 二重頤
a double chin
人を頤であしらう
to turn up one's nose at a man
人を頤で使う
to have people at one's beck
旨くて頤が落ちそうだ
It is delicious―goluptious.
頤が干上がる
to lose one's means of livelihood―have nothing to live on―starve
そんなことをすると頤が干上がってしまう
If I do such a thing, I shall lose my place―It is as much as my position is worth to do such a thing.
頤をしゃくる
to turn up one's nose
頤で蠅を払う
to be debilitated by excess of sexual indulgence

あこがれる〔憧がれる〕
〈受動〉To yearn after (a person); to feel oneself drawn towards (a person); one's heart goes out towards (a person)

content:
あこぎ〔阿漕〕
〈形〉
1. (=あくまで貪る)insatiable
2. (=度重なる)frequent
3. (=非道な)unnatural; cruel

content.content: そんなあこぎなことをするな
Don't be so cruel!

あごひげ〔頤髯〕
〈名〉A beard:(剃り残しなら)a goatee

content:
あさ〔朝〕
〈名〉Morning:(副詞に用いれば) in the morning

content.content: 朝学校へ行く
I go to school in the morning.
あの朝は、あの朝に限って学校へ行かなかった
I did not go to school (on) that morning―on that particular morning.
日曜の朝に
on Sunday morning［注意］一般の朝には前置詞“in”を用い、特別の朝には“on”を用いる。
朝などに
of a morning
彼は朝学校へ行く途などに寄ることがある
He will sometimes look in of a morning, on his way to school.［注意］“of a morning”は“in the morning”の古文体、現今の英語にては不規則の習慣(往々あること)を表わすに用いる。
朝早く
early in the morning
朝早く立つ
I start early in the morning―at an early hour―bright and early.
朝早くどこへ行く
Where are you going so bright and early?
朝八時に
at 8 in the morning
三日の朝に
on the morning of the 3rd
三日の朝早く
early in the morning of the 3rd
三日の朝八時に
at 8 in the morning of the 3rd―at 8, on the morning of the 3rd
朝起きる
to rise in the morning―get up in the morning
朝起きるとすぐ薬を飲め
Take the medicine as soon as you get up in the morning―(を通例)―the first thing in the morning
朝早く起きる
to rise early―rise with the sun―rise with the lark
朝早く起きて空模様を見た
I was up betimes to mark the signs of the weather.
君は朝は早いか
Do you rise early?―Are you an early riser?
彼は朝は早く出て晩は遅く帰る
He goes out early in the morning and comes home late in the evening.
朝から晩まで
from morning till night―from dawn till dusk
毎朝
every morning
朝な朝な
morning after morning
朝な夕なに
morning and evening
朝方
towards morning
昨日の朝
yesterday morning
明日の朝
tomorrow morning
雪の朝は裸虫の洗濯
The morning sun shines bright and warm upon new-fallen snow.

content:
あさ〔麻〕
〈名〉Flax; hemp:(=の) hempen (rope); flaxen (cloth, etc.)

content.content: 天下麻の如く乱る
The country is torn by factions―Anarchy reigns over the land.
麻の葉
flax-leaf pattern (on cloth)
麻の実
linseed
麻縄
a hempen rope
麻糸
twine

content:
あざ〔字〕
〈名〉A local name (given to a section of a village)

content.content: 中村字根岸
Negishi in the village of Nakamura

content:
あざ〔痣〕
〈名〉
1. (=生来の痣)a birth-mark; a mole; a macula

content.content: 首のあざでその人とわかった
He was identified by a mole on his neck.

content: 2. (=打たれなどしてできた痣)a bruise

content.content: 打たれてあざになる
to be bruised by a blow
つねられてあざになる
to be bruised by a pinch
全身あざだらけだ
I am black and blue all over.
あざが引込む
A bruise disappears.

content:
あさい〔浅い〕
〈形〉
1. Shallow (water, river, well); shallow, superficial (knowledge, learning, wisdom, view); slight (acquaintance); light (draught)

content.content: 浅い河
a shallow river
浅い川も深くわたれ
Err on the safe side―Err on the side of prudence.
この船は吃水が浅い
The ship has a light draught.
彼は知恵が浅い
He has shallow wit―He is shallow-brained.
学問が浅い
His learning is shallow―His knowledge is superficial.
考えが浅い
He is thoughtless.
彼とは交際が浅い
I am but slightly acquainted with him―I know him but slightly.
二人は関係が浅い
They have but slight relations with each other.
二人は浅からぬ仲だ
They are deeply in love with each other―They are plighted lovers.

content: 2. (=日が浅い)short

content.content: 研究、日なお浅し
I commenced the study only a short time ago―It is not long since I commenced the study.
彼は開業してまだ日が浅い
It is not long since he set up in business―He set up in business only a short time ago―He is young in his business.
創立以来日なお浅し
It is not long since it was established―It was established but a short time ago―It has been runing but a short time.

あさうらぞうり〔麻裏草履〕
〈名〉Straw sandals (soled with hempen cords)

content:
あさおき〔朝起き〕
〈名〉(事)early-rising:(人)an early-riser:(=する) to rise early; to get up early; to rise with the lark; to rise with the sun

content.content: 君は朝起きか
Do you rise early?―Are you an early riser?
僕は近頃朝起きを始めた
I have taken to early rising of late.
朝起の習慣を養おう
I will cultivate the habit of early rising.
朝起は三文の得
It is something to get up early―(に相当する格言は)―“The early bird catches the worm.”

あさがえり〔朝帰り〕
〈名〉Morning return (from staying overnight in gay quarters or with a sweetheart)

content:
あさがお〔朝顔〕
〈名〉
1. The morning-glory

content.content: 朝顔に
The morning-glory, lo!
つるべ取られて
Hath robbed me of my bucket, O!
貰い水
And I a-begging water go.

content: 2. (=小便器)a Japanese urinal (so called from its shape)

あさがおなり〔朝顔形〕
〈形〉Flaring

content.content: 朝顔なりの椀
a flaring bowl

content:
あさがおびらき〔朝顔開き〕
〈名〉Splay

content.content: 朝顔開きの口(内開きの窓口、外開きの戸口など)
a splayed opening

あさがすみ〔朝霞〕
〈名〉The morning haze

あさかぜ〔朝風〕
〈名〉The morning breeze

あさぎり〔朝霧〕
〈名〉The morning fog; the morning mist

あさくさがみ〔浅草紙〕
〈名〉(A coarse kind of) toilette-paper

あさくさのり〔浅草海苔〕
〈名〉Dried lavers

あさぐつ〔浅靴〕
〈名〉(A pair of) shoes

あさぐもり〔朝曇り〕
〈名〉A cloudy morning sky

content:
あさぐろい〔浅黒い〕
〈形〉Dark

content.content: 彼は色が浅黒い
He has a dark complexion.
色の浅黒い美人
a dark beauty―a brunette
色の浅黒い苦味走った好い男だ
He is a dark handsome man.

あさげ〔朝餉〕
〈名〉The morning meal; breakfast

あざけり〔嘲り〕
〈名〉Derision; ridicule; scorn; scoff; sneer; jeer; mock

あざける〔嘲る〕
〈他動〉To deride, ridicule (a person or thing); to laugh (one) to scorn; to turn (anything) into ridicule; to scoff at (religion); to sneer at (a person); to jeer at (one in public); to mock (one―at one)

content:
あさごはん〔朝御飯〕
〈名〉(A polite name for) breakfast

content.content: 朝御飯は何時に召上りますか
What time do you breakfast, sir?
朝御飯には何を召し上りますか
What will you have for breakfast?
朝御飯の用意ができました
Breakfast is ready.

content:
あさざけ〔朝酒〕
〈名〉A morning draught

content.content: 朝酒は嬶{かかあ}を質に置いても飲め
One will go all lengths for a morning draught.

あさしお〔朝潮〕
〈名〉The morning tide

content:
あさじお〔朝潮〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あさしお〔朝潮〕

content:
あさせ〔浅瀬〕
〈名〉A shoal:(どこそこの浅瀬)the shallows (of...)

content.content: 船が浅瀬に乗り上げる
to run aground―go ashore―(わざとなら)―run the ship aground―beach a ship
負ぶった子に教えられて浅瀬を渉る
“A fool may teach a wise man.”

あさぢえ〔浅智慧〕
〈形〉Shallow-witted; shallow-brained

content:
あさつき〔浅葱〕
〈名〉The chive; the cive

content.content: 浅葱なます
chive-salad

あさづけ〔浅漬け〕
〈名〉Half-dried radishes lightly picked in salt and bran

content:
あさって〔明後日〕
〈名、副〉The day after tomorrow

content.content: あさって行こう
I will come the day after tomorrow.
あさっての朝
the morning after next
あさっての晩
the evening after next
紺屋のあさって
The dyer is proverbially behindhand with his work.

content:
あさっぱら〔朝腹〕
〈名〉Early morning

content.content: この朝っぱらからどこへ行く
Where are you going so early in the morning?―so bright and early?
朝っぱらから客に押しかけられることがある
I sometimes have company of a morning.

content:
あさつゆ〔朝露〕
〈名〉The morning dew

content.content: 人生朝露の如し
“Life is a bubble.”

content:
あさで〔浅手〕
〈名〉A slight wound; a flesh wound

content.content: 浅手を負う
to be slightly wounded

content:
あざな〔綽名〕
〈名〉A nickname; a sobriquet

content.content: 彼は唐芥子というあざ名がついている
He is nicknamed “Pepper.”

あさなあさなに〔朝な朝なに〕
〈副〉Morning after morning

content:
あざなう〔糾う〕
〈他動〉To twist (a rope)

content.content: 禍福は糾える縄の如し
Life is a bundle of good and evil.

あさなぎ〔朝凪ぎ〕
〈名〉Morning calm (on the sea)

あさなゆうなに〔朝な夕なに〕
〈副〉Morning and evening

あさなわ〔麻縄〕
〈名〉A hempen rope

content:
あさね〔朝寝〕
〈名〉Morning sleep; late-rising:(=する) to rise late; to get up late; to lie in bed till late in the morning; to sleep late into the morning; to oversleep oneself

content.content: 今日は朝寝をした
I have overslept myself.
朝寝の癖
the habit of late rising―a sluggish habit
朝寝の癖を直す
to cure oneself of the habit of late rising―(英語風に言うと)―break oneself of the sluggish habit
三千世界の
Throughout the world I'd kill
烏を殺し
The cawing morning crow,
主と朝寝が
And sleep at morn my fill
して見たい
With thee as bed-fellow.

content:
あさねぼう〔朝寝坊〕
〈名〉
1. A late-riser; a sleepyhead; a lie-a-bed; a sluggard

content.content: 夜更し朝寝坊、宵張りの朝寝坊
to keep late hours―keep bad hours
あさね〔朝寝〕
今日は朝寝坊をした
I have overslept myself.

あさのは〔麻の葉〕
〈名〉Flax-leaf pattern (on cloth)

content:
あさはか〔浅はか〕
〈形〉Shallow, superficial (view); shallow-brained, shallow-hearted (person); flimsy, frivolous (reason, pretext); foolish, silly (idea, etc.)

content.content: 浅はかな考え
a shallow idea―a foolish idea
悪口を言って人を害そうとは浅はかな考えだ
It is a foolish idea to think of injuring a man by calumny.
そんな浅はかな理由を以て断った
He refused for such frivolous reasons.
そんな浅はかな口実を以て拒んだ
He refused on such flimsy pretexts.
女心の浅はかさに眠れる牛の絵に目を入れた
In the shallowness of a female heart, she added the eyes to the picture of a sleeping cow.

content:
あさはん〔朝飯〕
〈名〉The morning meal; breakfast

content.content: 朝飯を喫する
to breakfast―take breakfast―eat one's breakfast―break one's fast

content:
あさばん〔朝晩〕
〈名、副〉Morning and evening

content.content: 彼女は朝晩よく稼ぐ
She works hard morning and evening―early and late.
朝晩は涼しくなりました
The mornings and evenings are getting cooler.

content:
あさひ〔朝日〕
〈名〉The morning sun; the rising sun

content.content: 朝日の御旗
the sun-flag
あの人は朝日の勢いだ
He is a rising man.
敷島の大和心を
The spirit of Yamato's isles
人問わば
If, chance, a stranger shall inquire,
朝日に匂う
Go show the morning sun smiles
山桜花
Upon the mountain-cherry fair!

content:
あさぼらけ〔朝ぼらけ〕
〈副〉At daybreak; at dawn; at peep of day

content.content: 朝ぼらけ有明の
At peep of day, the waning moon
月と見るまでに
Should seem to shed her paling light
吉野の里に
Upon Yoshino's hamlet lawn,
降れる白雪
The snow so bright doth make the night.

content:
あさましい〔浅ましい〕
〈形〉Wretched (man); woeful (plight); vile (predicament); base (motive); disgraceful (state); shameful (condition); pitiable (situation); damnable (falsehood); execrable (conduct); outrageous (attire); atrocious (deed); confounded (action, etc.)

content.content: あさましい奴
Wretch!
あさましいことをしてくれた
What a confounded thing you have done!
あなあさましき世の有様じゃなー
What a wretched world it is!
かかる事をなさんとはあなあさましや
What a shame that such things should be done!
彼はあさましい姿になったものだ
He is in a woeful plight―What a plight he is in!
あさましい身なりをして旧友を訪ねまわる
He comes round to his old friends in outrageous attire.
乞食までするあさましさ
That he should stoop to beggary!
人の物を盗むとはあさましい了簡になったものだ
What has come over you that you should steal?
どうしてそんなあさましい心を出したか
How could you stoop to such baseness?
そんなあさましい心を出すものじゃない
You should be above such baseness.
無知文盲の徒はあさましいものだ
Ignorance is to be pitied.
ロシアの現状はあさましいかな
Russia is in a bad way.
凡夫のあさましさに諦めかねている
As I am but an ordinary mortal,I can not have done with her.
畜生のあさましさ、親子兄弟の見境もない
As they are but dumb beasts, they wallow in promiscuous intercourse.

あさまだき〔朝まだき〕
〈副〉Before daybreak; before daylight

content:
あさみどり〔浅緑〕
〈名〉Light green:(歌では)azure

content.content: 浅緑澄み渡りたる
As broad and clear and lucid as
大空の
The boundless azure sky
広きを己が
Would I could make my heart and mind,
心ともがな
With even heaven to vie!

content:
あざむく〔欺く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=だます)to deceive, cheat, delude, circumvent (a person)

content.content: 始めは人を欺き終{つい}には己を欺く
One who begins by deceiving others, will end by deceiving oneself.
欺かれた人
a dupe

content: 2. (=匹敵する)to equal, rival (anything in some respect)

content.content: 花を欺く顔容{かんばせ}
a face rivalling a flower in beauty―a flower-like face
雪を欺く肌
a skin rivalling snow in whiteness―a snow-white skin
昼を欺く電灯
electric lights rivalling day in brightness―electric lights as bright as day

content:
あさめし〔朝飯〕
〈名〉The morning meal; breakfast

content.content: 朝飯を食う
to breakfast―take breakfast―eat one's breakfast―break one's fast
朝飯に何を食うか
What will you have for breakfast?
朝飯に卵を食う
I will have eggs for breakfast―I will breakfast on eggs.
彼は朝飯も食わずに出かけました
He went out without eating his breakfast―(だけでは足らぬ)―without waiting to eat his breakfast.
行ってみると家族は朝飯の最中
I found the family at breakfast.

content:
あさめしまえ〔朝飯前〕
〈副〉Before breakfast

content.content: そんな事は朝飯前だ
(直訳すれば)It is a before-breakfast job―(意訳すれば)―It is an easy task―(英語風に言えば)―I make nothing of it―I make short work of it―I can do it any day.
試験などは朝飯前だ
I make nothing of my examinations.
彼はビール一ダースくらいは朝飯前だ
He will make short work of a dozen bottles of beer.
彼を負かすくらいは朝飯前だ
I can beat him any day.
あの人の事だから朝飯前から飛んで歩くだろう
(直訳すれば)He will bustle about without waiting to eat his breakfast―(意訳すれば)―lose no time in effecting his purpose―(英語風に言えば)―“not let the grass grow under his feet.”

content:
あざやか〔鮮やか〕
〈形〉Clear (voice); bright (colour); brilliant (victory); beautiful (performance, etc.)

content.content: (人の演芸などをほめて)鮮やか(!)
Beautiful!
鮮やかな手際だ
It is a beautiful performance.
鮮やかな飛行ぶり
It was a beautiful flight―The flight was a beautiful performance.
鮮やかな弁舌
clear utterance―beautiful eloquence
鮮やかな発音
clear pronunciation
鮮やかな筆跡
to write a clear hand―a beautiful hand
鮮やかな色
a bright colour―a fresh colour
鮮やかな天気だ
It is beautiful weather.
鮮やかな出で立ち
She is conspicuously dressed.
鮮やかな生え際
Her hair is beautifully pencilled.
鮮やかな生涯
a brilliant career
鮮やかな働きぶり
brilliant behaviour

content:
あさやけ〔朝焼け〕
〈名〉The morning glow

content.content: 朝焼けがすると雨が降る
The morning glow is a sign of rain.

content:
あさゆ〔朝湯〕
〈名〉A morning bath:(英米では)a morning tub

content.content: 朝湯に入る
to take a morning bath―(英米なら)―have one's morning tub
僕は毎日朝湯に入る
I regularly have my morning bath.
東京の職人で朝湯に行かない者は無い
Not a Tokyo workman but goes for his morning bath.

あさり〔浅蜊〕
〈名〉A (marine bivalve) shell-fish (smaller than the clam, with rough shells, used to make a soup)

content:
あさる〔漁る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=漁猟する)to fish
2. (=探す)to seek for, search for (food)

content.content: 鳥獣が餌をあさる
Birds and beasts seek for food―(生き餌なら)―seek for prey.
餌をあさりまわる
to go about in quest of food―prowl about in quest of prey
魚が餌をあさっている
The fish are on the feed.
鶏が地を掻いて虫をあさる
Hens scratch for worms―scrape for worms.

あざわらい〔嘲笑い〕
〈名〉Derision; ridicule; scorn; scoff; sneer; jeer; mock; sardonic laughter

あざわらう〔嘲笑う〕
〈他動〉To deride; to ridicule; to laugh (one) to scorn; to scoff at (religion); to sneer at (a person); to jeer at (one in public); to mock (one―at one)

content:
あし〔芦〕
〈名〉The reed

content.content: 取る棹の心長くも
With patience I will row and guide
漕ぎ寄せん
My bark that slowly speeds,
芦間の小舟
Although the passage be not smooth
障りありとも
Among the rustling reeds.

content:
あし〔足〕
〈名〉
1. (=足部)the foot:(実用には成句のほかは複数)one's feet

content.content: 人には足が二本、獣には足が四本ある
Man has two feet; beasts have four feet.
四ツ足
a four-footed animal―a quadruped
頭から足の先まで
from head to foot―from top to toe
頭から足の先まで人を見る
to look over a person from head to foot―(を通例)―measure a man from head to foot(with one's eye)―look one up and down
足が冷たい
My feet are cold―I have cold feet.
足を冷やすな
Keep your feet warm.
足が痛い
