My foot hurts(me)―(靴で足が痛いのなら)―My shoes pinch me.
足を上げる
to raise one's foot
足を下ろす
to set one's foot down
足を踏ん張る
to plant one's feet firmly on the ground
足を踏み締める
to steady oneself
酒に足を取られる
to be carried off one's feet by whiskey
悪所に足を入れるな
Do not set foot in bad quarters!
足が軽い
to light-footed―nimble―alert
足が重い
to be heavy-footed―lazy―sluggish
足に赤切を切らす
to get one's feet chapped
足に赤切が切れた
My feet are chapped.
赤切の切れた足
chapped feet
足に霜焼けができる
to get one's feet frost-bitten
足に霜焼けができた
My feet are frost-bitten―I have got my feet frost-bitten.
霜焼けのできた足
frost-bitten feet
思想は天に昇れども足は地を離れず
Our thoughts may soar heavenward, but out feet are never off the earth.
人に足を向けて寝るは失礼
It is considered bad manners in Japan to lie down with one's feet toward any one.
恩人の方へは足を向けても寝ない
I do not lie down at night with my feet toward my benefactor―(英語風に言えば)―I never forget my gratitude to him, waking or sleeping.
(再び足踏みをせぬ決心で)足の塵を払って去る
to shake the dust off one's feet
片足突っ込んでいる(日本では棺桶に、英語では穴に)
He has one foot in the grave.
踊りの足が壺にはまる
The dancer's feet fall pat to the music.
足の指
a toe
足の親指
the big toe
人の足を踏む
to tread on one's toes
足の裏
the sole of the foot
草鞋{わらじ}が足を喰う
Straw-sandals eat into the soles.
足の甲
the instep

content: 2. (=立つ足、歩く足)a leg:(実用には常に複数)one's legs:(ある場合には)foot

content.content: 足で歩く
We walk on our legs.
足が立つ
One can stand―(病人なら)―He can get about―(いざりなら)―He has found his legs―He now feels his legs.
足が立たない
He is crippled―a cripple.
足が悪くて歩けない
I have lame legs―I am lame.
あまり歩いて足が棒になった、足をすりこぎにして歩いた
I have walked myself lame.
足を引きずって歩く
to drag oneself along
波に足をさらわれる
to be carried off one's legs by the sea
船に慣れないと足がフラフラする
One unaccustomed to the sea has unsteady legs.
船に慣れて足がフラフラしなくなる
One gets sea-legs on.
足がブラブラしなくなった
I have sea-legs on.
足にまかして急いだ
I hastened s fast as my legs could carry me.
足にまかして歩いた
I went wherever fancy led me.
君は足が達者だ
You are a good walker―a good pedestrian.
足が早い
to be swift-footed―swift of foot―fleet of foot―a fast walker―a fast runner
泥棒の奴僕より足が早くてとうとう逃がした
The fellow had the legs of me―had the heels of me―and escaped.
足を痛めた
I have sore feet―I am footsore.
足を痛めた旅人
a footsore wayfarer
足を出す
to put out a leg
人の前へ足を出すのは無作法だ
It is considered bad manners in Japan to thrust out your legs before people.
足を引き込ませる
to draw in one's legs
足を伸ばす(は散歩するの意味になる)
to stretch one's legs
足を組む
to cross one's legs―(は西洋風、日本風にあぐらかくは)―sit cross-legged (tailor-fashion―を加えなければ西洋人に解せぬことあり)
足がしびれた
My legs are benumbed―My legs are asleep.
足がしびれてチクチクする
I have pins and needles in my legs―My legs prickle like pins and needles.

content: 3. (=ひと足)a step

content.content: 学校までひと足だ
It is only a step―but a step―to the school.
ひと足前へ出る、ひと足後へ下がる
to take a step forward―take a step backward
ひと足ごとに深くなる
The water grows deeper at every step.
ひと足遅かった
(直訳すれば)I have missed it by a step―I am a step too late―(普通の英語は)―I am too late―Too late!
ひと足違いで逢わなかった
(直訳すれば)I missed meeting him by a step―(普通の英語は)―I just missed meeting him.
君が出ると彼はひと足違いに来た
He came just after you went out.
僕が出る時ひと足違いに入って来た人があった
Some one came in just as I was going out.
ひと足お先に
Excuse me, I shall go on before you―Excuse my going before you!
ひと足先に来た
I started a little before the others.
どこへ足を向ける
to turn one's steps―bend one's steps―direct one's steps―to or toward a place
彼は遊里へ足を向けることはめったに無い
He seldom turns his steps toward the gay quarters.

content: 4. (=歩調)pace; step; speed; foot

content.content: 犬には足の早いのと鼻の利くのとある
Some dogs are chosen for speed, others for scent.
足を早める
to quicken one's pace―quicken one's steps
足をゆるめる
to slacken one's pace―slacken one's steps
足を早めて(急ぎ足で)進む
to proceed at a quick pace―at a smart pace―at a brisk pace
足を揃える
to keep step―walk in step
人と足を揃える
to keep step with the others
ラッパに足を揃える
to keep step to the bugle
足を乱す
to break step―walk out step
足を換える
to change foot―change feet
足が早い
to be swift of foot―fleet of foot
足が遅い
to be slow of foot
並足
a walk―foot's pace
早足
a trot
駈け足
a run―(馬なら)―a gallop

content: 5. (=足場)a footing

content.content: 足を踏みはずす
to miss one's footing―lose one's footing―(失錯するの意味なら)―make a false step
大陸に足を踏み入れる
to gain a footing on the continent

content:
6. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君は足が強い、足が丈夫だ(健脚)
You are a good walker―a good pedestrian.
僕は足が弱い
I am a poor walker―a poor pedestrian.
つい手が触り足が触り
Chance joined us together.
足を踏む
to tread on the ground―step on the ground―(強くなら)―stamp on the ground―(久しぶりでなら)―set foot on the ground
座敷が散らかっていて足の踏みどころも無い
The room is so littered that there is not a spot to tread on―not a spot to step on.
人の地面に足を踏み込む
to trespass on another's ground―(領分を侵すの意味なら)―encroach on another's province
困難などを見て二の足を踏む
to hesitate at―boggle at―stagger at―jib at―stop at―a difficulty
軍隊が(支えかねて)浮き足になる
The troops waver―falter―begin to sway―begin to give way.
逃げ足になる
to seem inclined to run away
もう逃げ足になっている
He is ready to fly―showing the white feather.
気は早れども足は進まず
“The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
いたずら子はつかまえると足をジタバタして暴れる
A mischievous urchin, when caught, will kick and struggle.
足の向いた方へ行く、足にまかして歩く
I go wherever fancy leads me.
足を空して駈けまわる
to scamper about
足を運ぶ
to go
吉原へセッセと足を運ぶ
He frequents the gay quarters.
だまされて無駄足を運んだ
I went on a fool's errand.
足を留める
to stay―make a stay―in a place
ここに暫く足を留めようと思う
I mean to make a short stay here.
あそこに久しく足を留めた
I made a long stay there.
足を洗う
(乞食なら)to quit a beggar's life―(花柳界なら)―quit a life of shame
足がつく
A crime or a criminal is traced.
お尋ね者は長崎まで足がついた
The fugitive has been traced as far as Nagasaki.
(何から)足がつく
Something puts the police on the scent.
質に入れた時計から足がついた
The watch he pawned put the police on the scent.
これでは足が出る
The sum will not cover the expenses―The sum comes short of the amount.
勘定を払う時持ち合わせが足りなくて足を出してしまった
The money I had about me came short of the bill.
足を出す
to disclose a secret―let the cat out of the bag
足が近い
to be a frequent visitor
足が遠くなる
to cease to be a frequent visitor
結婚すると友人と足が遠くなる人がある
When some people marry, they let the grass grow on the path of friendship.
傷持つ足
“A guilty conscience needs no accuser.”
傷持つ足だから人のことは言われない
“One who lives in a glass house, should not throw stone.”
手の舞い足の踏むところを知らず
One is transported with joy―in a transport of joy―in an agony of joy―in raptures―in ecstasies.
その足で
at once―directly―straight
その足で彼の家へ行った
I went straight to his house―made straight for his house.
君に逢っちゃ手も足も出ない
I am helpless against you.
そんな値段じゃ手も足も出ない
I am powerless to bid at such a price―The price is paralyzing.

content: 8. (犬猫の足)paws:(タコやイカの足)tentacles; arms:(羊や豚の食用にする足)trotters:(卓子などの足)legs:(コップの足)a stem

content.content: 卓子には足が四本ある
A table has four legs.
三本足の腰掛け
a three-legged stool
タコには足が八本ある、イカにも
The octopus has eight arms, and so has the cuttlefish.

content: 9. (=船脚)draught

content.content: 足の深い船、足の浅い船
a ship of deep draught―of light draught

content:
10. (=銭)money
11. (=利息)interest

あじ〔味〕
〈名〉
1. Taste; flavour; savour:(旨味の意味なら)relish; zest; gusto

content.content: (どんな)味がする
to taste good or bad
どんな味がするか
How does it taste?
甘い味がする
It tastes sweet―It has a sweet taste―It is sweet to the taste.
苦い味がする
It tastes bitter―It has a bitter taste―It is bitter to the taste.
酸っぱい味
a sour taste
辛い味
a hot taste―a biting taste
渋い味
a rough taste―an astringent taste
舌が荒れて味がしない
My tongue is so rough that I can not taste anything.
味の好い
tasty food―savoury dish―palatable water―delicious fruit
味の悪い
ill-tasting food―unsavoury meat―unpalatable water
味の無い
tasteless water―flavourless vegetables―insipid fruit
純金は味のないので分かる
Pure gold is known by the absence of taste.
味の抜けた
flat beer―vapid wine―stale wine―dead champagne
味が抜ける
Wine will become vapid―Beer will become flat.
味が変わる
to become stale―turn sour
味をつける
to flavour a drink―season a dish
味の強い料理、味の軽い料理
a highly seasoned dish―a lightly seasoned dish
日本料理は味が強過ぎる
Japanese food is too highly seasoned.
味を見る
to taste soup―try the flavour of wine
味を覚える、味をしめる
to learn the taste of blood
一度人間の味をしめると忘れられぬ(と虎が言う)
Once a man-eater, always a man-eater.
味を添える
to give a flavour―give a relish―add a zest―impart a gusto―to food

content: 2. (=趣味、興味)taste; relish; zest; gusto; point

content.content: 読書の味を覚える、味を占める
to imbibe a taste for reading
いったん読書の味を占めるとやめられぬ
Once a reader, always a reader.
甘言の味を占める
to drink deep of flattery
君はしゃれの味がわかるか
Do you relish jokes?
英詩の味がわかるか
Can you appreciate English poetry?
味のある
expressive word―significant expression―suggestive phrase―pointed style
あの人の演説は味が無い
His speeches lack point.

content: 3. (=甘いも辛いも知っているの味)experience; practical knowledge

content.content: 働く味を知らない者は遊ぶ味がわからぬ
One who does not know what it is to labour, does not know what it is to enjoy.
君は借金の味を知るまい
You do not know what it is to be in debt, do you?
貧乏の味を知るまい
You don't know what it is to be poor―You are a stranger to poverty.
貧乏の味を知っている
I know what it is to be poor―I am no stranger to poverty.
味をやる
to play one's game
奴味をやりおるな
He is playing his little game―carrying it off well.
貴様は(あの後家を引掛けようとは)味をやりおるな
You are playing a pretty game.
あの子はなかなか味をやる
She carries it off very well.

content: 〈形〉(=な) quaint (expression); piquant (face); racy (story); spicy (story)

content.content: 味な顔だ
She has a piquant face.
先生は味な話をする
He tells racy stories―spicy stories.
君は味な事を言うね
You say quaint things.
味な文句で口説く
He makes love in a quaint way.
味なことをする、味な芸当をする
to play one's game
貴様は(人の財産を横領しようというのか)味な事をやりおるな
You are playing a pretty game.
二人は味な仲だ
They are kissing-kind to each other―Theirs is the old story.
縁は異なもの味なもの
“Marriage goes by destiny”―“Marriages are made in Heaven.”

あじ〔鰺〕
〈名〉The horse-mackerel; the scad

content:
あじあ〔亜細亜<アジア>〕
〈固名〉Asia:(=の) Asiatic

content.content: アジア州
the Continent of Asia
アジア人
an Asiatic

content:
あじあ〔亜細亜<アジア>〕
〈固名〉Asia:(=の) Asiatic

content.content: アジア州
the Continent of Asia
アジア人
an Asiatic

content:
あしあと〔足跡〕
〈名〉A foot-mark; a footprint; a footstep; a step; a track; a trace; a trail

content.content: 板の間に足跡をつける
to leave foot-marks on the floor
室内に足跡をつけて行った
He left footprints in the room.
雪があると足跡がつく
One leaves footprints on the snow―The snow will show the footprints.
畳に泥の足跡がついていた
There were muddy foot-marks on the mats.
足跡をつけて行く
(人のなら)to follow up one's footsteps―follow in one's track―(獣なら)―track an animal―trail an animal

あしあぶり〔足焙り〕
〈名〉A foot-warmer

content:
あしおと〔足音〕
〈名〉The sound of feet; a footstep; a footfall:(大きな足音)a tramp:(誰の足音)one's step, tread

content.content: 足音がする
I hear a footstep―I hear footsteps.［注意］単複共意味同じ。
廊下で足音がした
I heard a footstep in the passage.
梯子段を上がる足音がした
Footsteps were heard on the stairs.
耳を澄まして彼の足音のするのを待った
I listened for this footsteps.
僕の足音を聞きつけて出て来た
He heard my footsteps and came out.
あの人は足音でわかる
I know him by his step―by his tread.
皆彼の足音を聞いてふるえ上がっている
They all tremble at the sound of his footsteps.
足音を立てる
to make the sound of footsteps
足音を立てて歩く
to walk with sounding steps
足音を立てずにソッと家を抜け出た
I stole out of the house with soft steps―with stealthy steps.
にわかに聞こえる人馬の足音
All at once were heard the tramps of a multitude―A sound of multitudinous feet burst upon our ears.

content:
あじか〔海驢〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしか〔海驢〕

あしがかり〔足掛かり〕
〈名〉A footing; a foothold

content:
あしかけ〔足掛け〕
〈名〉
1. (=足掛かり)a footing; a foothold

content.content: 敵地に足掛けを得る
to gain a footing in the enemy's territory

content:
2. (=足を掛ける板)a footboard:(ボートのは)a stretcher (for the rower)
〈副〉Extending over (so many calendar years)

content.content: 足かけ三年ここにいる
My stay here extends over three calendar years―I have passed two New Years here.
足掛け五年
extending over five calendar years―three years and parts of two―over three years

content:
あしかせ〔足枷〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしがせ〔足枷〕

content:
あしがせ〔足枷〕
〈名〉Fetters; shackles; irons

content.content: 足がせをかける
to fetter a man―put a man in irons

あしがため〔足固め〕
〈名〉A pile-driver

content:
あしがら〔足がら〕
〈名〉A trick in wrestling

content.content: 足がらを掛ける
to trip up one's adversary

content:
あしからず〔悪しからず〕
〈命令法〉Do not take it ill; do not take it amiss

content.content: こう言うのも老婆心で言うのだからなにとぞ悪しからず
I say this out of kindness, so you must not take it amiss.

content:
あしがらみ〔足絡み〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしがら〔足がら〕

あしがる〔足軽〕
〈名〉The lowest of the feudal retainers; a foot-soldier

content:
あしき〔悪しき〕
〈形〉Bad; evil; ill; wicked; wrong

content.content: 人生は善かれ悪しかれ仕方がない
We must take life for better or for worse.
文明開化も善し悪しだ
Civilization has its drawbacks.

あじきき〔味利き〕
〈名〉A taster

content:
あじきなき〔味気無き〕
〈形〉Dreary; hollow; “stale, flat and unprofitable”

content.content: 味気無き世
the dreary world―the hollow world―stale, flat and unprofitable life―a world of stern realities
世の味気無さを知る
to awake to the stern realities of life

content:
あしくび〔足頸〕
〈名〉The ankle

content.content: 足くびをくじいた
I have sprained my ankle.

content:
あしぐるま〔足車〕
〈名〉A castor; a trundle

content.content: 足車のついた寝台
a bed on castors―a trundle-bed

あしげ〔芦毛〕
〈名、形〉(A) white (horse) shot with black; a white roan

content:
あしげ〔足蹴〕
〈名〉Kicking

content.content: 人を足蹴にかける
to kick a man

content:
あしげい〔足芸〕
〈名〉A trick done with the feet; a foot-trick

content.content: 足芸をする
to do tricks with one's feet

content:
あしこ〔彼処〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あそこ〔彼処〕

content:
あしこし〔足腰〕
〈名〉The nether parts of the body

content.content: 老人は足腰がたたぬ
The old man is crippled―a cripple.
足腰の立たぬ病人
a crippled invalid―a cripple

content:
あしごしらえ〔足拵え〕
〈名〉Equipment for the feet

content.content: 足ごしらえを厳重にする
to equip one's feet for travelling
足ごしらえを厳重にしておった
He had his feet equipped for the road―had his feet equipped with travelling sandals.

あじさい〔紫陽花〕
〈名〉The hydrangea

content:
あしざまに〔悪し様に〕
〈副〉Ill

content.content: 人を悪しざまに言う
to speak ill of―slander―calumniate―a person
彼のことを殿に悪しざまに言った者があった
Some one slandered him to his lord.

content:
あししげく〔足繁く〕
〈副〉Frequently

content.content: 足繁く廓へ通う
to frequent gay quarters

content:
あししろ〔足代〕
〈名〉A scaffolding; a scaffold

content.content: 足代をかける
to put up a scaffolding―erect a scaffolding―scaffold a house
足代が落ちた
The scaffolding gave way.

content:
あしじろ〔足代〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あししろ〔足代〕

content:
あしずもう〔足相撲〕
〈名〉Wrestling with the leg

content.content: 足相撲を取る
to wrestle with the leg

あしずり〔足摺り〕
〈名〉Stamping:(=する) to stamp (with impatience, etc.)

あしぞろえ〔足揃え〕
〈名〉Keeping step:(=する) to keep step; to walk in step

content:
あした〔朝〕
〈名〉Morning

content.content: 朝には紅顔の美少年夕には白骨となる
A fair-faced youth in the morning, crumbling bones in the evening―“Red at morn, dead at even.”
朝に道を聞いて夕に死すとも可なり
If learn the truth in the morning, I shall be content to die in the evening.

content:
あした〔明日〕
〈名、副〉Tomorrow

content.content: あしたは祭日だ
It is a national holiday tomorrow―(は副詞、名詞に用いれば)―Tomorrow is a holiday.
稽古はあしたから始まる
School begins tomorrow.
この魚はあしたまでもつか
Will the fish keep till tomorrow?―keep over night?
あしたでもよろしいか
Will tomorrow do?
それではあしたのことにしよう
Then let it be tomorrow―it shall be tomorrow.
あしたの課業の下読みをしなけりゃならぬ
I must read up tomorrow's lesson.
あしたの新聞に出る
It will appear in tomorrow's paper.
今日できる事をあしたまで延ばすな
“Do not put off till tomorrow what can be done today.”
あしたの百より今日の五十
“A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.”

content:
あしだ〔足駄〕
〈名〉Rain-clogs; high clogs

content.content: 足駄をはいていた
He was in rain-clogs.
(下女などが)足駄をはく
to squeeze―(米国では)―take graft
足駄の歯
supports of rain-clogs
足駄の歯入れ
a clog-mender

あしだらい〔足盥〕
〈名〉A flat tub for washing feet

content:
あしついでに〔足序に〕
〈副〉While one is about it

content.content: 足ついでに薬を取って来て下さい
Please go and get the medicine while you are about it.

content:
あしつき〔足付〕
〈名〉(One's) manner of walking, gait

content.content: あぶない足つきだ
He has an unsteady gait.

あしつき〔足付き〕
〈形、名〉(A) legged (utensil)

あしつぎ〔足継ぎ〕
〈名〉A footstool (for getting at things out of reach)

content:
あしてまとい〔足手纏い〕
〈名〉An encumbrance; a hindrance; an impediment

content.content: 荷物は足手まといになる
A luggage will encumber me.
彼は妻子という足手まといがある
He has an encumbrance in the shape of a wife and family―He is encumbered with a family.
彼は手助けどころかかえって足手まといだ
So far from being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance to me.

content:
あしどめ〔足止め〕
〈名〉
1. (=外出を止めること)keeping (one) indoors; confinement; a request to keep indoors:(=する) to confine (one) indoors; to request (one) to keep indoors

content.content: 今日は留守番で足止めを喰った
I am left in charge of the house, and must keep indoors.

content: 2. (=留任を促すこと) a request to stay; an inducement to stay:(=する) to request (one) to stay; to induce (one) to stay

content.content: 職人の給金を上げて足止めをした
They raised the wages to induce the men to stay.

あしどり〔足取り〕
〈名〉
1. (=歩き工合)(one's) manner of walking, gait, pace
2. (=相場の足取り)rise and fall (of prices)

あじない〔味無い〕
〈形〉Tasteless (liquid); flavourless (vegetables); insipid (fruit); vapid (wine); fresh (water)

あしなが〔足長〕
〈名〉A long-legged person; a longshanks

content:
あしなみ〔足並〕
〈名〉Step

content.content: 足並を揃える
to keep step―walk in step
人と足並を揃える
to keep step with the others
ラッパに足並を揃える
to keep step to the bugle
足並を乱す
to break step―walk out of step
足並が悪い
They do not keep step.
足並を正す
to make the men keep step

あしのうら〔足の裏〕
〈名〉The sole (of the foot)

あしのこう〔足の甲〕
〈名〉The instep

content:
あしのゆび〔足の指〕
〈名〉A toe

content.content: 足の親指
the big toe

content:
あしば〔足場〕
〈名〉
1. (=足代) a scaffolding; a scaffold

content.content: 足場を掛ける
to put up a scaffolding―erect a scaffolding―scaffold a house
足場が落ちた
The scaffolding gave way.

content: 2. (=足掛かり) a footing; a foothold

content.content: 敵地に足場を得る
to gain a footing in the enemy's territory
土手が急で足場が無い
The bank is steep and affords no foothold.

あしばやに〔足早に〕
〈副〉(To walk) at a quick pace, at a smart pace, at a brisk pace, briskly

あしふき〔足拭き〕
〈名〉A foot-towel

content:
あしぶみ〔足踏み〕
〈名〉Stepping; steps:(進行中なら)marking time:(=する) to step (on the ground); to set foot; step foot (in or on a place):(進行中なら)to mark time

content.content: 足踏みー(号令)
Mark time!
海外に足踏みをした事が無い
I never set foot on foreign soil.
あんなところへは二度と足踏みをせぬ
I will never set foot in such a place.
お前はこの家に足踏みをしてはならぬ
You shall not set foot in this house.
彼は僕の家に足踏みもせぬ
He never sets foot in my house―He never darkens my door.
再び足踏みをせぬ決心で足の塵を払って去った
I shook the dust on my feet.
舞の足踏みが壺にはまる
The dancer's steps fall pat to the music.

content:
あしまとい〔足まとい〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしてまとい〔足手纏い〕

あしまめ〔足まめ〕
〈形、名〉(To be) light of foot, a good walker

content:
あしもつれ〔足縺れ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしてまとい〔足手纏い〕

content:
あしもと〔足下〕
〈名〉
1. (=足の辺)one's feet

content.content: 足下に
at one's feet
うまいことが足もとに落ちている
Chances lie at out feet.

content: 2. (=足場)one's footing

content.content: 足もとにご用心
Mind your footing!―Be circumspect!

content: 3. (=足取り)gait

content.content: あの老人は足もとが危ない
That old man has an unsteady gait.
足もとから鳥が立つのを知らずにいる
He does not know what is passing under his eyes.
足もとを見る
to take advantage of one's weakness―take a mean advantage
旅人が疲れた様子を見せると車屋が足もとを見て高い事を言う
The jinrikishaman takes advantage of the traveller's fatigued condition, and asks an exorbitant fare.
彼は知ったふりをしながら足もとが見えない(自分の利益がわからない)
He is a knowing one, but blind to his own interests.
皆彼の足もとにも寄りつけぬ
They can not come near him―can not hold a candle to him.
数学では彼の足もとに寄りつける者が無い
No one can come near him―No one can touch him―No one can hold a candle to him―in mathematics.
足もとの明るいうちに
(直訳すれば)before it gets too dark to see.
足もとの明るいうちにお帰り
Beat a retreat while you can see your way out―(英語風に言えば)―“Beat it while your shoes are good.”
足もとの明るいうちに退いた方がいいぜ
You had better retire while you can do so with a good grace.

あじゃり〔阿闍利〕
〈名〉A holy teacher; a priest

content:
あしゆ〔足湯〕
〈名〉A foot-bath

content.content: 足湯を遣う
to take a foot-bath

content:
あしよわ〔足弱〕
〈形〉(To be) weak in the legs, slow of foot

content.content: 連れは足弱の女だから急げなかった
I could not use expedition, as my companion was a weak woman.

content: 〈名〉One slow of foot; a poor walker; a poor pedestrian

あしらい
〈名〉
1. (=扱い)treatment

content.content: 事を冗談あしらいにする
to treat a matter as a joke
彼はあの女にかかっては子どもあしらいにされる
She treats him as a child―He is a child in her hands.

content: 2. (=接待)reception

content.content: ていねいなあしらいを受けた
I met with a courteous reception.
英国人は客あしらいが好い
The English are hospitable.

あしらいもの〔あしらい物〕
〈名〉The garniture, garnish, garnishings (of a dish)

content:
あしらう
〈他動〉
1. (=扱う)to treat, manage, handle (a person―how?)

content.content: あの女はばかや気狂いを上手にあしらう
He manages a fool or a madman with tact―She knows how to manage fools or madmen.
どんな難物でも自在にあしらう
The hardest cases are wax in her hands.
あの相撲は相手を巧みにあしらう
He handles his adversary with skill―He knows how to handle his adversary.

content: 2. (=もてなす)to receive (a guest―how?)

content.content: あの人は客人をていねいにあしらう
He receives his guests with courtesy.
人を顎であしらう
to turn up one's nose at a person
鼻であしらう
to sniff at one
あの人は人を鼻であしらうふうがある
He has a supercilious air.
人をいい加減にあしらう
to put off a person with evasive answers

content: 3. (=取り合わせる) to arrange (flowers); to garnish (fish with vegetables, etc.)

あじろ〔網代〕
〈名〉Bamboo basketwork; a wickerwork fish trap

content:
あじわい〔味〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あじ〔味〕

content:
あじわう〔味わう〕
〈他動〉
1. (=味を見る)to taste

content.content: 支那料理を味わったことがあるか
Do you taste Chinese food?

content: 2. (=玩味する)to relish; to appreciate

content.content: 君は洒落が味わえるか
Do you relish jokes?
英詩が味わえるか
Can you appreciate English poetry?
一字一字味わって読む
to dwell on each word

content: 3. (=経験する)to experience

content.content: 彼はあらゆる幸不幸を味わっている
He has experienced all phases of fortune―tasted the sweets and bitters of life.

あしわらのみずほのくに

あしわらのみずほのくに〔葦原の瑞穂の国〕
〈名〉The Land of Reedy Plains abounding in Rice-plants (the ancient name of Japan)

content:
あす〔明日〕
〈名、副〉
1. Tomorrow

content.content: 明日は休みだ
There is no school tomorrow―(は副詞、名詞に用いれば)―To morrow is a holiday.
明日でも好いか
Will tomorrow do?
それでは明日のことにしよう
Then let it be tomorrow―it shall be tomorrow.
稽古は明日から始まる
School begins tomorrow.
この魚は明日まで置けるか
Will the fish keep till tomorrow?―keep overnight?
明日の朝、明日の晩
tomorrow morning―tomorrow evening
明日の課業の下読みをしなけりゃならぬ
I must read up tomorrow's lessons.
明日の新聞に出る
It will appear in tomorrow's paper.
今日できることを明日まで延ばすな
“Do not put off till tomorrow what can be done today.”
明日の百より今日の五十
“A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.”
明日明日と待てど暮らせど明日は来ず
“Tomorrow never comes.”
明日有りと
Hope not the transient blossom shall
思う心の仇桜
Until the morrow last:
夜半に嵐の
For who knows but the midnight gale
吹かぬものかは
Thy cherished hope my blast?
明日の日も知れない命
a precarious existence
(病人は)今日明日も危ない命
“His life hangs by a thread.”
今日は今日明日は明日
“Each day brings its bread.”
明日は明日の風が吹く
“Tomorrow brings its own fortune.”
明日の事は明日案じろ
“Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.”

あずかってちからあり

content:
あずかってちからあり〔与って力あり〕
〈他動〉To contribute to, go far towards, do much towards (the result); to help (to do something) to be instrumental in (doing something); to have a share in (effecting one's purpose)

content.content: 欧州大戦乱は世界の平和にあずかって力がある
The Great War of Europe has contributed to the peace of the world.
日本海の海戦は平和克復にあずかって力があった
The Battle of the Japan Sea contributed much to―went far towards―did much towards―the restoration of peace.
米国の加盟が同盟軍の勝利にあずかって力があった
America's participation in the war contributed greatly to―went a long way towards―the victory of the Allies.
君の助力が僕の成功にあずかって力がある
Your assistance has contributed much to―done much towards―my success.
君が譲歩すれば仲直りにあずかって力があるだろう
Your concession will contribute greatly to―go far towards―a reconciliation.
文学は国語を一定するにあずかって力がある
Literature helps to fix a language.
日本の今日あるは外国語の研究あずかって力がある
The study of foreign languages has helped to make Japan what she is.
目的の遂行にあずかって力ありしものは時機である
The times were instrumental in effecting our purpose―The times had a share in effecting our purpose.

content:
あずかり〔預り〕
〈名〉
1. Safe-keeping; keeping (anything for another); (taking) charge (of anything); (having) custody (of anything); (holding property in) trust; (placing money to one's) credit

content.content: どうぞこの荷物お預かりを願います
Will you please keep my luggage for me?―take charge of my luggage?
この金をお預かりにします
I will keep the money for you―I will take charge of the money―place the money to your credit.
百円だけ預かりにしておきます
I shall place 100 yen to your credit.
百円お預かりがあります
There is 100 yen to your credit―owing to you.

content:
2. (=預かり物)one's charge; one's trust
3. (=相撲の預かり)an undecided match

content.content: 相撲は預かりになった
The match was not decided.

content:
あずかりきん〔預り金〕
〈名〉A deposit; money on deposit; money deposited in bank; money deposited with one; money placed to one's credit

content.content: お預かり金が百円ありました
There is 100 yen to your credit―owing to you.
当座預かり金
a current deposit
定期預かり金
a fixed deposit

あずかりしょう〔預り証〕
〈名〉A deposit-receipt

content:
あずかりしる〔与り知る〕
〈他動〉To have concern with, have to do with (some matter)

content.content: そんな事はあずかり知らぬ
I have no concern with such matters―have no concernment with such matters―have nothing to do with such matters―That's none of my business―That's no business of mine.

あずかりどころ〔預り所〕
〈名〉(=劇場などの携帯品預かり所)A cloak-room

あずかりにん〔預り人〕
〈名〉A trustee; a depositee; a consignee

content:
あずかりぬし〔預り主〕
〈名〉The person in charge (of anything); the person in possession (of another's property, etc.)

content.content: 預かり主は半分の主
“Possession is nine points of the law.”

content:
あずかりもの〔預り物〕
〈名〉One's charge:(財産なら)one's trust; what one holds in trust:(金などなら)what is not one's own

content.content: この娘は私の預かりものだから人に手をつけさせぬ
The girl is my charge. No one shall touch her.
乗客は船長の責任ある預かりものだ
The passengers are the captain's charge for which he is responsible.
この金は預かりものだ
The money is not my own.
この財産は預かりものだ
The property is my trust.
(財産などの)預かりものをする
to take property in trust―hold property in trust―accept a trust
預かり物は当然その主に返すべきものだ
What one holds in trust, ought to be restored to its owner.

content:
あずかる〔与る〕
〈他動〉To take part in, participate in (an affair); to be concerned in (a matter); to join in (a debate); to share in (the benefits); to receive, come in for (a share); to partake of (a repast) ［注意］往々動詞の Passive Form に訳すことあり。

content.content: 相談にあずかる
to be consulted―take part in a consultation―be admitted into the consultation
評議にあずかる
to take part in a conference―participate in a conference
討議にあずかる
to take part in a debate―join in a debate
分配にあずかる
to come in for a share
利益の配当にあずかる
to share in the profits
我々の果てまでもこの戦争の恩沢にあずかる
We shall all share in the benefits of the war.
ご馳走のお相伴にあずかった
I partook of the repast.
招待にあずかる
to be invited―receive an invitation
お招きにあずかって有難う存じます
Thank you for your kind invitation―I am delighted to accept your invitation.
饗応にあずかる
to be entertained―be favoured with an entertainment
恩賞にあずかる
to be rewarded―receive a reward
篤き御恩賞にあずかり有難く御礼申上候
I beg to tender my thanks for your handsome reward.
おほめにあずかる
to be praised―meet with one's approbation
ご配慮にあずかりありがとう存じます
I am obliged to you for your solicitude in my behalf―interesting yourself in my welfare.
ひいきにあずかる
to be favoured with one's patronage→『あずかってちからあり〔与って力あり〕』

content:
あずかる〔預かる〕
〈他動〉［注意］始め英語を標準とす。
1. To keep (anything for any one); to keep (treasure) safe; to take (anything) into one's safe-keeping

content.content: この金を預かってくれんか
Will you keep this money for me?
学校へ忘れてきた本を小使が預かっておいてくれた
The servant has kept the book for me.
この荷物を取りにくるまでお預かり下さい
Please keep this luggage for me till I call for it.
私がたいせつな物を預かる
I will keep the valuables safe―take the valuables into my keeping―into my safe-keeping.
私がたいせつな物を預かっている
I am keeping the valuables safe―I have the valuables in my keeping―in my safe-keeping.
たいせつな物は私が預かっている
The valuables are in my keeping―in my safe-keeping.
(主人の不在中に金などを受け取って)ともかくもお預かりしておきます
At any rate, I shall keep it for you.

content: 2. To take charge of (anything); to take (anything) in charge; to take (anything) under one's charge

content.content: この金を預かってくれんか
Will you take charge of this money?
学校へ忘れてきた本を小使が預かっておいてくれた
The servant took charge of the book I left in the school.
この荷物を取りに来るまでお預かり下さい
Please take charge of my luggage till I call for it.
僕だ貴重品を預かろう
I will take charge of the valuables―take the valuables in charge―take the valuables under my charge.
僕が貴重品を預かっている
I have charge of the valuables―I am in charge of the valuables―I have the valuables in charge―I have the valuables under my charge.
貴重品は僕が預かっている
The valuables are in my charge―under my charge.
亭主が貴重品を預かっている
The landlord has charge of the valuables.
貴重品は亭主が預かっている
The valuables are in the charge of―under the charge of―the landlord.
貴重品を預かった人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人の預かった貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
荷物を預かった赤帽
the porter in charge of the luggage
赤帽の預かった荷物
the luggage in the charge of―under the charge of―the porter
私が留守を預かっている
I have charge of the house―I am left in charge of the house―during the absence of the master.
ご不在中は私が学校を預かります
I will take charge of the school during your absence.
校長の不在中私が学校を預かっております
I have charge of the school―I am left in charge of the school―during the absence of the principal.
親類が子どもを預かっている
The relatives have charge of the children―The relatives are in charge of the children.
子どもは親類が預かっている
The children are in the charge of―under the charge of―the relatives.

content: 3. To take custody of (anything); to take (anything) into one's custody

content.content: 私が貴重品を預かります
I will take custody of the valuables―take the valuables into my custody.
私が貴重品を預かっております
I have custody of the valuables―I am in custody of the valuables―I have the valuables in my custody.
貴重品は私が預かっております
The valuables are in my custody.
船長が貴重品を預かっている
The captain has custody of the valuables―The captain is in custody of the valuables.
貴重品は船長が預かっている
The valuables are in the custody of the captain.
貴重品を預かった人
The man in custody of the valuables.
その人の預かった貴重品
the valuables in the custody of the man
親類が子どもを預かっている
The relatives have custody of the children―The relatives are in custody of the children.
子どもは親類が預かっている
The children are in the custody of the relatives.

content: 4. To take care of (anything); to take (anything) under one's care

content.content: 私が大事な物を預かろう
I will take care of the valuables―take the valuables under my care.
私が大事な物を預かっている
I have the valuables under my care.
大事な物は私が預かっている
The valuables are under my care.
私が子どもを預かっている
I have the children under my care―The children are under my care.
校長の不在中私が学校を預かっている
I take care of the school during the absence of the principal.
私が留守を預かっている
I take care of the house during the absence of the master.

content: 5. To look after (anything)

content.content: 私が子どもを預かっている
I look after the children.
校長の不在中私が学校を預かっている
I look after the school during the absence of the principal.
私が留守を預かっている
I look after the house during the absence of the master.

content: 6. To be entrusted with (anything)

content.content: 私が貴重品を預かっている
I am entrusted with the valuables.
貴重品は私が預かっている
The valuables are entrusted to me―in my hands.
貴重品を預かった人
the man entrusted with the valuables
その人の預かった貴重品
the valuables entrusted to the man

content:
7. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: この金を預かってくれんか
Will you keep this money for me?―take charge of this money?
小使が本を預かっておいてくれた
The servant has kept my book for me―taken charge of my book.
この荷物を預かって下さい
Please keep my luggage for me―take charge of my luggage.
私が貴重品を預かろう

I will keep the valuables safe―take care of the valuables―take charge of the valuables―take custody of the valuables―I will take the valuables into my custody―into my safe-keeping―under my care―under my charge―in charge.
私が貴重品を預かっている

I have charge of the valuables―have custody of the valuables―I am in charge of the valuables―in custody of the valuables―entrusted with the valuables―I have the valuables in my custody―in my safe-keeping―under my care―under my charge.
貴重品は私が預かっている
The valuables are in my charge―in my custody―in my safe-keeping―in my hands―under my care―under my charge―entrusted to me.
貴重品を預かった人
the man in charge of―in custody of―entrusted with the valuables
その人の預かった貴重品
The valuables in the charge of―in the custody of―in the safe-keeping of―in the hands of―under the care of―under the charge of―entrusted to―the man.
私が留守を預かっている
I have charge of the house―take care of the house―look after the house―I am left in charge of the house―during the master's absence.
私が子どもを預かっている
I have charge of―have custody of―take care of―look after―the children―I have the children in my charge―in my custody―under my care―under my charge―I am in charge of―in custody of―the children.
子どもは私が預かっている
The children are in my custody―under my care―under my charge.
誰がこの店を預かっているか
Who has charge of―takes care of―looks after―tends―this shop?
財産を預かる
to take property in trust
子どもの大きくなるまで(相続人の成年するまで)伯(叔)父が財産を預かっている
The uncle holds the property in trust till the heir comes of age.
銀行で金を預かる
A bank receives money on deposit.
五銭以上お預かり申すべく候
Sums over five sen are received on deposit―may be deposited.
銀行は天下の金を預かっている
A bank holds the money of the public on deposit.
(取引中)この金をお預かり申します
I shall place the sum to your credit.
お預かりした金が百円あります
There is 100 yen to your credit―owing to you.
けんかを預かる
to take it upon oneself to settle the quarrel―constitute oneself arbitrator
このけんかは俺が預かった
Let me settle the quarrel!―Leave the quarrel to me!
相撲の勝負を預かる
to leave a match undecided
しばらく事を預かる
to defer matters
決定はしばらく預かっておく
We shall defer the decision.
名前は預かっておく
I will not mention his name―not give his name.

あずき〔小豆〕
〈名〉The red bean

あずきめし〔小豆飯〕
〈名〉Boiled rice and red beans; red rice

あずきもち〔小豆餅〕
〈名〉Mochi dressed with bean-paste

content:
あずけいれる〔預け入れる〕
〈他動〉To place (money) on deposit; to deposit (money) in bank

content.content: 預け入れる者より引出す者の方が多い
There are more people who draw money than those who deposit it.

content:
あずけきん〔預け金〕
〈名〉A deposit; money on deposit; money in bank:(=する) to place money on deposit; to deposit money in bank

content.content: 預け金は千円以上ある
There is over a thousand yen on deposit―in bank.
定期預け金
a fixed deposit
当座預け金
a current deposit

あずけにん〔預け人〕
〈名〉The depositor (of money in a bank)

あずけぬし〔預け主〕
〈名〉The depositor (of money in a bank)

あずけもの〔預け物〕
〈名〉Something given in charge:(財産なら)property given in trust

content:
あずける〔預ける〕
〈他動〉［注意］始め英語を標準とす。
1. To give (one something) to keep; to give (something) into one's keeping; to place (something) in one's safe-keeping

content.content: 金は会計に預けた
I gave the money to the treasurer to keep.
たいせつな物を亭主に預けた
I gave the valuables into the keeping of―into the safe-keeping of―the landlord―I placed the valuables in the keeping of―in the safe-keeping of―the landlord.
大切な物は亭主に預けてある
The valuables are in the keeping of―in the safe-keeping of―the landlord.
宝物は預けてある
The treasure is in safe-keeping.
この金は私が預けられた金だ
The money was given me to keep―given into my keeping―given into my safe-keeping.

content: 2. To charge (one with a task); to give (one) charge of (anything); to give (anything) in charge (to a person); to place (anything) in one's charge; to place (anything) under one's charge

content.content: 貴重品は亭主に預けた
I gave the valuables in charge to the landlord―gave the landlord charge of the valuables―placed the valuables in the charge of the landlord―placed the valuables under the charge of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に預けてある
The valuables are in the charge of―under the charge of―the landlord―The landlord is in charge of the valuables.
貴重品を預けた人
the man in charge of the valuables
その人に預けた貴重品
the valuables in the charge of―under the charge of―the man
荷物は赤帽に預けた
I gave my luggage (in charge) to the porter.
荷物を預けた赤帽
the porter in charge of the luggage
赤帽に預けた荷物
the luggage in the charge of the porter
下足を預けるのか
Must I give my foot-gear in charge?
がいとうを預けるところがありますか
Can I give my overcoat in charge?

content: 3. To give (anything) into one's custody; to place (anything) in one's custody

content.content: 貴重品は亭主に預けた
I gave the valuables into the custody of the landlord―placed the valuables in the custody of the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に預けてある
The valuables are in the custody of the landlord―The landlord is in custody of the valuables.
貴重品を預けた人
the man in custody of the valuables
その人に預けた貴重品
the valuables in the custody of the man
彼は親類に預けられた
He was given into the custody of―placed in the custody of―a relation.
今親類に預けられている
He is in the custody of a relation.

content: 4. To entrust, trust (a person with anything―anything to a person)

content.content: 貴重品は君に預ける
I will entrust you with the valuables―entrust the valuables to you.
貴重品を預けた人
the man entrusted with the valuables
その人に預けた貴重品
the valuables entrusted to the man
君ならどんな大金でも安心して預ける
I can trust you with any amount of money.
あの男に金を預けるのはけんのんだ
You can not trust him with money.

content: 5. To place (anything) in one's hands, in one's safe-keeping, in one's custody, in one's charge, under one's charge, under one's care

content.content: 貴重品は君に預ける
I will place the valuables in your hands―under your care.
金は君に預けておけば安心だ(銀行へ預けたも同然)
The money is safe in your hands.
事件は安心な人に預けてある
The matter is in safe hands.
私の小僧を先生にお預け申します
I will place my boy under your care.

content: 6. To leave (anything with any one)

content.content: あの金は会計に預けた
I left the money with the treasurer.
お前の首は暫く預けておく
I will leave your head with you for a time.

content:
7. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 貴重品は君に預ける
I will place the valuables in your hands―in your safe-keeping―in your custody―in your charge―under your charge―under your care―I will entrust you with the valuables―entrust the valuables to you.
金は会計に預けた

I gave the money to the treasurer to keep―gave the money in charge to the treasurer―left the money with the treasurer―placed the money in the hands of the treasurer―entrusted the treasurer with the money.
貴重品は亭主に預けた

I gave the valuables into the safe-keeping of the landlord―into the custody of the landlord―in charge to the landlord―I placed the valuables in the hands of the landlord―in the safe-keeping of the landlord―in the custody of the landlord―in the charge of the landlord―under the charge of the landlord―under the care of the landlord―I entrusted the landlord with the valuables―entrusted the valuables to the landlord.
貴重品は亭主に預けてある

The valuables are in the hands of―in the safe-keeping of―in the custody of―in the charge of―under the charge of―under the care of―entrusted to―the landlord―The landlord is in charge of―in custody of―entrusted with―the valuables.
貴重品を預けた人
the man in charge of―in custody of―entrusted with the valuables
その人に預けた貴重品
the valuable in the hands of―in the safe-keeping of―in the custody of―in the charge of―under the charge of―under the care of―entrusted to―the man
財産を預ける
to give property in trust―leave property in trust
彼は(子どもが未丁年だから)財産を弟に預けて死んだ
His son being still under age, he left his property in trust to his brother.
金を銀行に預ける
to deposit money in bank―consign money in bank―place money on deposit
金は銀行に預けてある
The money is in bank―on deposit.
金を貯蓄銀行へ預ける
to put money in the savings-bank
手荷物を預ける
to check one's luggage―register one's luggage
子どもを里に預ける
to put out a child to nurse

content:
あすこ〔彼処〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あそこ〔彼処〕

content:
あずさ〔梓〕
〈名〉The catalpa(-tree)

content.content: 腰は梓の弓となり
He is bent with age.

あずさゆみ〔梓弓〕
〈名〉A catalpa bow

あずち
〈名〉A target-mound (for archery practice)

あすなろ〔羅漢柏〕
〈名〉A garden shrub of the cypress family

content:
あずま〔東〕
〈固名〉The Eastern Provinces (of Japan)

content.content: 東男{あずまおとこ}に京女
Tokyo for men and Kyoto for women.

あずまこーと〔吾妻コート〕
〈名〉A (Japanese) lady's cloak

あずまや〔東屋〕
〈名〉A summer-house; a bower; an arbour

content:
あせ〔汗〕
〈名〉
1. Sweat; perspiration:(馬のは)foam; lather

content.content: 汗をかく
to sweat―perspire―get into a perspiration―get into a sweat―break into a sweat―(馬なら)―lather―(壁なら)―gather moisture
汗を掻いている
I am in a sweat―in a perspiration.
馬が汗をかいている
The horse is in a foam―in a lather.
壁が汗をかいている
The wall is damp (with gathered moisture).
びっしょり汗をかいた、全身汗だらけ
I am in a muck of sweat―all of a muck of sweat―in a profuse perspiration―in a lather.
着物が汗でびっしょり
My clothes are soaked with sweat―wet with perspiration.
ひと汗かく
to have a spell of work―have a combat
汗を出す、汗がでる
to sweat―perspire―(人のために恥じるの意味なら)―blush for one
君のために汗が出る
I blush for you―I am ashamed of you.
汗が流れる
I am running with sweat―streaming with sweat.
汗がダラダラ流れる
to perspire copiously―sweat profusely―welter in sweat―swelter
汗を流す
to sweat―toil hard
汗を流して取った金だ
The money was earned by the sweat of my brow―by toiling hard.
汗を取る
to bring on a perspiration―induce perspiration―(by taking a sudorific)
熱があるなら汗を取るとよい
If you have a fever, you had better (take a sudorific and) induce perspiration.
汗を取ると直る
A perspiration will set you right.
汗を出すのは薬だ
A sweat will do you good.
着物が汗になった
My clothes are moist with sweat―soaked with sweat.
フランネルは汗をはねる
Flannel does not get moist with sweat.
着物が汗臭い
My clothes smell of sweat.
汗を絞る
to wring out the sweat
汗を拭く
to wipe off the sweat―(額の汗なら)―mop one's brow
汗を洗い流す
to wash away the sweat
汗が引き込んだ
My sweat has dried.
玉の汗
beads of sweat
玉の汗をかいている
Beads of sweat stand on his brow―The sweat stands in beads on his brow.
冷汗
a cold sweat
冷汗を流した
I was in a cold sweat.
寝汗
a nightly sweat―a night-sweat
寝汗をかく
to have nightly sweats
人は額に汗してその日を送る
“Man must live by the sweat of his brow.”
手に汗を握って勝負を見ていた
We watched the contest with keen interest―with intense interest―with breathless interest―with bated breath―hardly daring to breathe.
綸言汗の如し
The Emperor's word, once passed, never returns.

あせあわ〔汗泡〕
〈名〉(=馬の汗泡)Foam; lather

content:
あせい〔阿世〕
〈名〉Pandering to the public

content.content: 曲学阿世の徒
debauched writers who prostitute learning to pander to the public―literary sycophants.

content:
あせかき〔汗かき〕
〈名〉One who sweats freely

content.content: 僕は汗かきだ
I sweat freely.

あせじゅばん〔汗襦袢〕
〈名〉A summer underwear; a sweater

あせとり〔汗取り〕
〈名〉A summer underwear

content:
あせばむ〔汗ばむ〕
〈自動〉To become moist with perspiration

content.content: 肌が汗ばんでいる
The skin is moist with perspiration.

あせふき〔汗拭き〕
〈名〉A handkerchief for summer use

content:
あせぼ〔汗疣〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あせも〔汗疣〕

content:
あせみず〔汗水〕
〈名〉(An emphatic form of) sweat

content.content: 汗水流して働く
to sweat―toil hard―toil and moil―drudge it―fag it―slave it―plod away
汗水流して取った金だ
It is money I have toiled hard for―hardly earned money.

content:
あせみずくで〔汗みずくで〕
〈副〉In a sweat

content.content: 汗みずくで働く
to sweat―toil hard―toil and moil―drudge it―fag it―slave it―plod away

content:
あぜみち〔畦路〕
〈名〉(=畦)A raised foot-path between rice-fields

content.content: 畦路伝えに田んぼを横切った
I crossed the rice-fields by a foot-path.

content:
あせも〔汗疣〕
〈名〉Prickly heat

content.content: あせもが出る
to have prickly heat―suffer from prickly heat

content:
あせる〔焦る〕
〈自動〉To be eager (for or to do something); to be impatient (to do something):(競技などにてあせる)to get hot, get wild, get mad, get furious, get savage; to lose one's temper; to be in a sweat

content.content: 彼は早く行きたがってあせっている
He is impatient to be gone.
成功をあせる
to be eager for success
君はあせるから成功しないのだ
You are too eager to succeed.
君はあせるから負けるのだ
You get wild, and that's why you are beaten.
あせるな
Keep cool!―Keep your hair on!―Play steady!

content:
あぜんたり〔唖然たり〕
〈自動〉To be dumfounded ［dumfoundered］; to be struck dumb ［speechless］ with astonishment

content.content: 人をしてあぜんたらしむ
to dumfound one―strike one dumb―strike one speechless
と聞いてあぜんたり
His words struck me dumb.

content:
あそこ〔彼処〕
〈名〉That place:(=に) there:(遠方を指して言えば)over there:(=へ) there:(=から) from there:(=まで)there:(=の) there(を名詞の次に置く)

content.content: あそこは好い所だ
That is a good place.
あそこの中学校では誰が英語を教えているかね
Who teaches English at the middle school there?
あそこに行くのは田中だ
There goes Tanaka!
あれあそこに
(上を指して言えば)Up there―(下を指して言えば)―Down there―(外を指して言えば)―Out there―(内を指して言えば)―In there―(遠方を指して言えば)―Over there
あそこに見えるのは火事じゃないか
Isn't that a fire over there?
彼はいつあそこへ行ったか
When did he go there?
あそこから帰った客は無い
No one ever returned from there.
あそこまで鉄道があれば好い
I wish there was a railway to get there.
あそこへ行ってみたぜ
I have been there―I have been you know where.

あそこいら〔彼処いら〕
〈副〉Somewhere about there; thereabouts

content:
あそばす〔遊ばす〕
〈他動〉To be pleased (to do something); to deign (to do something)

content.content: 今日は何を遊ばしますか
What are you pleased to do today?
お出遊ばした
He is pleased to come.
御前{ごぜん}何を遊ばす
What do you mean by that, my lord?―My lord is joking with me.

content:
あそばせ〔遊ばせ〕
〈命令法〉Be pleased, deign (to do something)

content.content: お嬢様ご覧遊ばせ
(Deign to) look there, mademoiselle!

あそばせことば〔遊ばせ言葉〕
〈名〉Polite language (of servants, etc.)

content:
あそばせる〔遊ばせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=面白がらせる)to amuse (children); to divert (people); to entertain (a guest, etc.)

content.content: あの女は人を上手に遊ばせる
She has tact in entertaining people.

content: 2. (=ただ置く) to have (a person or thing) idle

content.content: からだを遊ばせるのは好くない
It is not good to be idle.
からだを遊ばせるな
Don't be idle―keep yourself busy.
子どもを遊ばせておく
to have a boy idle―have a boy doing nothing
お前をあぞばせておく事はできぬ
I can not (afford to) have you idle.
いくら金持ちでも子どもを遊ばせておくものでない
However rich a man may be, he should not have his boy idle.
子どもを遊ばせておくな
Keep a boy busy.
(工場が暇なので)職工を遊ばしておく
They have the men lying idle.
金を遊ばせておくのは無益だ
It is unadvisable to have one's money lying idle―have one's money lying dormant.

content:
あそび〔遊び〕
〈名〉
1. (=戯れ)play; amusement; diversion; recreation; pastime

content.content: 子どもは遊びが好きだ
A child likes to play.
遊びに行く
to go out to play
子どもらは遊びに余念無い
The children are absorbed in play.
子どもの稽古は遊び半分だ
Children go to school half in play.
遊び半分に役所へ勤めている
I go to office to kill time.
そんなことは子どもの遊びだ
It is child's play.

content: 2. (=遊興)pleasure; gaieties; merry-making; jollity; jollification

content.content: あの人は遊びが好きだ
He is fond of pleasure―fond of merry-making―fond of jollity―a gay gentleman.
遊びにふける
to addict oneself to pleasure
彼は遊びにふけっている
He is addicted to pleasure.
遊びに現{うつつ}を抜かす
to abandon oneself to pleasures―give oneself up to pleasures
あの人は遊び専門だ
He devotes his time to pleasures.
遊び専門の生活をする
to lead a life of pleasure
遊びに旅行する
to travel for pleasure
あの人は遊びに行くことがあるか
Does he ever go out for pleasure?―visit gay quarters?
こっそり遊びに行く
He visits gay quarters on the sly.
遊びもよいが用のさまたげにならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with business.
遊びは用をすましてから
Business first, pleasure afterwards.
遊びがてら上京しました
I have come to town partly for pleasure―combining business with pleasure.
遊び半分に行くのだ
I combine business with pleasure―kill two birds with one stone.
都の遊び
the pleasures of the town
東京へ出て早速遊び方を始めた
I plunged into the pleasure of the town.
上品な遊びをする
to take refined pleasures
げびた遊びをする
to indulge in vulgar pleasures
ただら遊び、大尽遊びをする
to indulge in riotous pleasures―(平常なら)―lead a riotous life.
彼は遊び盛りだ
He is in the heyday of his youth.

content: 3. (=遊び歩き)holiday-making; a holiday excursion; a pleasure trip; a jaunt; an outing; a visit

content.content: (業を休んで)遊びに行く
to make holiday―take a holiday―go on a jaunt―go on a pleasure trip―go on a holiday excursion―
一週間ばかり遊びに行って来たい
I should like to take a week's holiday.
一日の遊びに屈竟な所だ
It is just the place for a day's outing.
日光へ遊びに行こうと思う
I intend to visit Nikko―make a trip to Nikko―go on a trip to Nikko.
人の家へ遊びに行く
to go to see a friend
ちょっと遊びに来給え
Come to see me!

content: 4. (=遊戯)a game; a sport

content.content: カルタ遊び
a game at cards

content: 5. (=博奕)gambling

content.content: 遊び人
a gambler

content: 6. (=空所)a vacant spot

content.content: 遊びのある顔
a vacant face―a blank face
あの女の顔に遊びがある
She has a blank face―a vacant expression.
彼の顔に遊びが無い
He has a smart face―an intellectual face.

あそびあいて〔遊び相手〕
〈名〉A playmate; a playfellow:(飲み相手なら)a boon companion

content:
あそびあきる〔遊び飽きる〕
〈自動〉To be sated with pleasure; to be satiated with pleasure

content.content: あれは道楽者で遊び飽きている
He is blas?.

あそびあるく〔遊び歩く〕
〈自動〉To go about in quest of pleasure; to travel for pleasure; to gad about

あそびか〔遊び家〕
〈名〉A man of pleasure; a gay gentleman

content:
あそびかた〔遊び方〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あそびぶり〔遊びぶり〕

content:
あそびがてら〔遊びがてら〕
〈副〉Partly for pleasure

content.content: 遊びがてら上京しました
I have come to town partly for pleasure―combining pleasure with business.
遊びがてら行って来よう
I will combine pleasure wit business―kill tow birds with one stone.

あそびがね〔遊び金〕
〈名〉Idle money; dormant money; money to spare

あそびきょうずる〔遊び興ずる〕
〈自動〉To disport oneself; to make merry; to frolic; to lark

あそびくらす〔遊び暮らす〕
〈自動〉
1. (=戯れ暮らす)to pass one's time in play; to play one's time away
2. (=遊興に日を暮らす)to pass one's time in pleasure; to lead a life of pleasure; to lead a gay life
3. (=ただ居て日を暮らす)to pass one's time in idleness; to idle one's time away; to lead an idle life; to eat the bread of idleness

あそびざかり〔遊び盛り〕
〈形〉(One) in the heyday of one's youth

content:
あそびしごと〔遊び仕事〕
〈名〉An easy task; a soft job

content.content: こんなことは遊び仕事だ
I make nothing of it.

content:
あそびずき〔遊び好き〕
〈名〉Love of pleasure:(形容詞に用いれば)pleasure-loving, gay (gentleman)

content.content: あの人は遊び好きだ
He is fond of pleasure―He is a gay gentleman.

あそびたわむれる〔遊び戯れる〕
〈自動〉To disport oneself; to frolic; to lark

content:
あそびつかれる〔遊び疲れる〕
〈自動〉To be fatigued with pleasure

content.content: あれは道楽者で遊び疲れている
He is blas?.

あそびつくす〔遊び尽くす〕
〈自動〉To drain the cup of pleasure to the dregs

あそびて〔遊び手〕
〈名〉A man of pleasure; a gay gentleman

あそびどうぐ〔遊び道具〕
〈名〉A plaything; a toy

あそびどうらく〔遊び道楽〕
〈名〉(事)gadding about:(人)a gadabout

content:
あそびとも〔遊び友〕
〈名〉A playmate; a playfellow

content.content: この子は遊び友が無い
The child has no one to play with.
犬を遊び友にしている
He plays with a dog.

あそびなかま〔遊び仲間〕
〈名〉A playmate; a boon companion

あそびにん〔遊び人〕
〈名〉A (professional) gambler

あそびぬく〔遊び抜く〕
〈自動〉To drain the cup of pleasure to the dregs; to see through life

あそびば〔遊び場〕
〈名〉A pleasure resort; a holiday resort

content:
あそびばしょ〔遊び場所〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あそびば〔遊び場〕

content:
あそびぶり〔遊びぶり〕
〈名〉One's way of taking pleasure

content.content: あの人の遊びぶりはどうか
How does he take his pleasure?
盛んな遊びぶりだ
He takes his pleasure royally―takes his pleasure like a prince.
遊びぶりがケチだ
He takes his pleasure like a miser.
人は遊びぶりでわかる
A man is known by the way he takes his pleasure―Pleasure shows a man as he is.

あそびまわる〔遊び廻る〕
〈自動〉To go about in quest of pleasure; to travel for pleasure

あそびめ〔遊び女〕
〈名〉A woman of pleasure; a woman of the town; a prostitute; a harlot; a whore

content:
あそぶ〔遊ぶ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=戯れる)to play; to amuse oneself; to enjoy oneself; to disport oneself

content.content: 子どもらが遊んでいる
The children are at play.［注意］次の如き場合のほかは“playing”と言わず。
子どもらが表に遊んでいる
The children are playing in the street.
野に遊んでいる
They are playing in the field.
球を投げて遊んでいる
They are playing (at) ball.
今日は何をして遊ぼうか
What shall we play today?
兵隊ゴッコして遊ぼう
Let us play (at) soldiers.
戦争ゴッコをして遊ぼう
Let us play (at) war.
トランプをして遊ぼう
Let us play (at) cards.
お医者ゴッコをして遊ぼう
Let us play that I am the doctor and you are the patient.
雨降りには何をして遊ぶか
What do you play―How do you amuse yourself―in rainy weather?
船中では何をして遊ぶか
How do you amuse yourselves on board ship?
君は誰と遊ぶか
Whom do you play with?
僕はあいつらと遊ばない
I do not play with that set―go with that set.
この子は独りで遊ぶ事が好きだ
The boy likes to play by himself.
面白く遊ぶ
to―enjoy oneself―have a good time
皆で温泉へ行って一日面白く遊んで来た
We went to the hot springs, and enjoyed ourselves―had a good time―passed a pleasant day.
一週間ばかり田舎へ行って面白く遊んだ
I have passed a pleasant week in the country.
(休みが三日続くが)どうして遊んだら一番に面白かろうか
How can I make the most of my time?
子どもらは余念無く遊んでいる
The children are absorbed in play―intent on play.
よく務めよく遊べ
“Work while you work, and play while you play”―Work with all you might, and play with all your heart.
働く味を知らない者は遊ぶ味を知らぬ
He who knows not what it is to labour, knows not what it is to enjoy.
子どもを遊ばせないとバカになる
“All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.”
人を面白く遊ばせる
to amuse―divert―entertain―people
あの女は人を上手に遊ばせる
She has tact in entertaining people.
遊んで暮らす
to pass one's time in play―play one's time away
僕は病気で一年遊んだ
I have played away a year.
遊びたわむれる
to disport oneself―frolic―lark

content: 2. (=業を休んで遊ぶ) to make holiday; to take a holiday; to take one's ease

content.content: 一週間ばかり遊びに行って来ようと思う
I am going to take a week's holiday.
(年百年中勉強ばかりしていないで)たまには遊ぶがよい
You ought to make holiday―take a holiday―take your ease―once in a while.
今は遊ぶには一番好い時節だ
Now is the best time for making holiday.
せめて日曜だけも遊ぶがよい
You ought to take your ease on Sunday at least.

content: 3. (=遊興をする)to take one's pleasure; to pursue pleasure; to make merry; to see life:(若い時遊ぶは)to sow one's wild oats:(廓通いするは)to visit gay quarters

content.content: あの人は遊ぶか
Does he ever take his pleasure?―go out for pleasure?―visit gay quarters?
コッソリ遊ぶ
He visits gay quarters on the sly.
なかなか遊ぶ
He is a man of pleasure―very much of a man of pleasure.
なかなか遊んだ人だ
He has seen life―seen much of life.
若い時は遊んだ
He has sown his wild oats.
遊ぶ時は遊んでも締まる時は締まる
A young man who sows his wild oats, will become steady in time―A gay young man will sober down in time―“Young sinner, old saint.”
船乗りは上陸して遊ぶのを何よりの楽しみにしている
Sailors at sea look forward to making merry on shore.
彼は盛んに遊ぶ
He takes his pleasure royally―takes his pleasure like a prince―goes on at a great rate.
綺麗に遊ぶ
to take one's pleasure like a gentleman―leave a welcome behind one
あっさり遊ぶ
to take light pleasure―dip in pleasure
思い切って遊ぶ
to take one's fling―have one's fling
羽目をはずして遊ぶ
to have a gay frolic―have a boisterous merry-making―have high jinks―go on the spree
羽目をはずして遊んでいる
They are on the spree.
金びら切って遊ぶ
to sport one's fortune
遊んで暮らす
to pass one's time in pleasure―lead a life of pleasure―live a gay life

content: 4. (=ただ居る)to be idle; to be doing nothing:(職に離れてなら)to be out of employment:(金なら)to be idle; to be dormant

content.content: 僕は遊んでいられぬ
I can not afford to be idle.
お前は遊んでばかりいてはならぬ
You must not be idle.
子どもを遊ばしておく
to have a boy idle―have a boy doing nothing
いくら金持ちでも子どもを遊ばしておくものでない
However rich a man may be, he should not have his boy idle.
子どもを遊ばしておくな
Keep a boy busy.
からだを遊ばせるのは好くない
It is not good to be idle.
からだを遊ばせるな
Don't be idle―Keep yourself busy.
遊んで暮らす
to pass one's time in idleness―idle one's time away―lead an idle life―eat the bread of idleness
彼は金ができたから遊んでくらせる
As he has become rich, he need not work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His wealth has raised him above the necessity of labour.
彼は離れて遊んでいる
He is out of employment―out of work―at a loose end.
久しく遊んでいる
He has been out of employment―doing nothing―for a long time.
(仕事がなくて)職人が遊んでいる
The men are lying idle.
職人を遊ばしておく
They have the men lying idle.
金が遊んでいる
The money is lying idle―lying dormant.
金を遊ばしておくのは無益だ
It is unadvisable to have your money lying idle.
遊んでいる金
idle money―dormant money―money to spare
遊んでいる金とては無い
I have no money to spare.

content: 5. (=遊びに行く)to visit, make a trip to (a place)

content.content: 一日日光に遊ぶ
One day I visited―paid a visit to―made a trip to―went on a trip to―Nikko.
海外に遊ぶ
to visit foreign countries―go abroad
野に遊ぶ
to have a picnic
ちょっと遊びに来給え
Come to see me.
一日遊びに来給え
Come to spend a day with me.

content: 6. (=漫遊する、遊学する)to travel, study (in a place)

content.content: 幼にして欧米に遊ぶ
In his youth, he visited―travelled in―studied in―Europe and America.
江戸に出でて佐久間象山の門に遊ぶ
He went to Edo, and studied under Sakuma Shozan.
芸に遊ぶ
to follow art
文筆に遊ぶ
to follow literary pursuits

あそん〔朝臣〕
〈名〉A court noble

content:
あだ〔仇〕
〈名〉
1. (=仇敵)an enemy; a foe; a rival

content.content: 君父の仇は倶に天を戴かず
One should not live under the same sky with the slayer of one's lord or father.
不倶戴天の仇
One's sworn enemy―deadly enemy―mortal foe
昨日の仇は今日の友
Yesterday an enemy, today a friend.
恋の仇
They are rivals in love.―She is my rival in love.

content: 2. (=仇を為すの仇)a wrong:(実用には通例)wrongs

content.content: 仇を為す、仇をする
to do one a wrong―do one an ill turn―(蔭で悪口を言うなどなら)―injure one's reputation―take liberties with one's reputation
(自分の)仇を返す、仇を報ずる
to revenge one's wrongs―(を略して通例)―revenge oneself―(または)―be revenged―(また)―take one's revenge―have one's revenge―(また)―settle accounts with one's enemy―get even with one's enemy
親の仇を討つ
to avenge one's father's wrongs―avenge one's father's death―(を略して通例)―avenge one's father
親の仇を討った
I have avenged my father.―My father is avenged.
君の仇を討つ
to avenge one's lord
犬侍と言われても恥を忍んで君の仇を討ったのは偉い
Who can but admire the man who suffered himself to be called a dog of a samurai, in order that he might avenge his lord?
僕の仇を討ってくれ
Avenge me!
君の仇をきっと討たせる
I will see that you are avenged.―see you avenged.
仇討ち
a vendetta

content: 3. (Good に対し)evil; ruin

content.content: 恩を以て仇に報いる(仇に報いるに恩を以てする)
to return good for evil
仇に報ずるに恩を以てすれば先方は慚愧する
You will heap coals of fire on his head.
仇を以て恩に報いる(恩を仇で返す)
to return evil for good―repay good with evil
金は身の仇
Money brings one evil.
芸は身の仇
Accomplishment proved his ruin.
惚れられたのが身の仇
He was beloved to his ruin.
情けが却って仇となる
One's love turns out another's ruin.

あだ〔徒〕
〈形〉Empty (dream); vain (hope); useless (thing); fruitless (attempt); transient (life); ephemeral (splendour); faithless (heart); inconstant(love)

content:
あだ〔婀娜〕
〈形〉Coquettish; charming

content.content: 婀娜な姿
a charming figure.
婀娜な女
a coquettish girl―a coquette.

あだあだしい〔婀娜婀娜しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=あだっぽい)coquettish, charming, bewitching, enchanting, captivating, fascinating, ravishing, voluptuous (beauty, etc.)
2. (=薄情な)faithless, false (woman)

content:
あたい〔価〕
〈名〉
1. (売買の価は)price; figure:(原価は) cost:(実価は) value:(真価は)worth:(=する) to cost (so much money or labour):(値打があるの意味なら) to be worth (so much); to be worthy of (praise or blame); to deserve (reward or punishment); to merit (praise or blame, reward or punishment)

content.content: 物の価を払う
to pay a price for anything―pay the price of anything
すべて貴重な物はその価を払わなければ得られぬ
We must pay a price for―pay the price of―anything valuable.
労という価を払わなければならぬ
We must pay the price of labour for anything valuable.
成功するにも価を払わなければならぬ
We must pay a price for―pay the price of―success.
成功する為にはどんな価をも払う(どんな勉強をもいとわぬ)
I will pay any price for success.
どんな価を払っても(どんな勉強をしても)是非成功する
I must succeed at any price.
価が安い
The price is low―cheap―reasonable.
安い価で買う
to buy anything at a low price
価が高い
The price is high―dear―unreasonable.
高い価を払って買う
to buy anything at a high price
快楽は苦痛という価をもって買う
Pleasure is bought at the price of pain.
自由という価をもって平和を買う国民は奴隷国民
It is a nation of slaves who buy peace at the price of liberty.
価は法外だ
The price is exorbitant.
骨董は法外な価なものだ
Curios are bought and sold at fabulous prices.
価は望み次第
You shall have whatever price you may name―You my name your price.
価は品によって違う
The price varies with the quality.
品が違うから価も違う
The articles are different in quality, and ought to be different in price.
これは一万円価した家だ
The house cost me 10,000 yen.
これは七年の労を価した作だ
The work cost me seven year's labour.
これは発明者の生命を価した発明だ
The invention cost a life―cost the inventor his life.
この本は一読の価がある
The book is worth reading―worthy of a perusal.
彼の手際は賞讃の価がある
His performance deserves praise―It is worthy of praise.
この罪は厳罰の価がある、死の価がある
The crime deserves severe punishment―deserves death.
びた一文の価も無い
It is not worth a farthing.
(その思い)価千金
It is delicious―a delicious experience.

content:
あたう〔能う〕
〈助動詞相当〉Can; (one) is able (to do something); (it) is possible (to do it)

content.content: 能う限りを仕尽くした
I have done all I can.
能うべくんば老練家を得よ
Get an old hand, if possible.

あだうち〔仇討ち〕
〈名〉A vendetta:(=する) to avenge (one's lord or father)

content:
あたえ〔与え〕
〈名〉A gift

content.content: 天の与え
a godsend
これ天の与えと喜んだ
I rejoiced over the godsend.
天の与えを取らざればかえってその咎めあり
“Take the good the gods provide.”

content:
あたえる〔与える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=くれる)to give (one anything); to give, afford (one pleasure); to give, cause, occasion (one pain); to grant (one a pension); to accord (one a privilege); to award (one a prize, etc.)

content.content: 人に満足を与える
to give one satisfaction―afford one pleasure
苦痛を与える
to give on pain―cause one pain―occasion one pain―inflict pain on one
便宜を与える
to afford one facilities for doing something
授業の参考となる注意を与える
to give one hints―give one points―on teaching
事業に打撃を与える
to give a blow to an enterprise
事業に致命傷を与える
to give a death-blow to an enterprise
英語の研究に刺戟を与える
to give an impetus to the study of English
惜しまず与える
to give freely
いやいや与える
to grudge one anything
彼は僅かの物を与えるにも喜んで与えぬ
They grudge him the little they give him.
人に与うべきものを与える
to give one one's due―do one justice
彼に当然与うべきもの以上にいくらか与えた(給金のほかに礼まで出した)
I give him something over and above what was due to him.
人に当然与うべきものを与えぬ
to deny one one's due―deny one justice
我子にパンを与えぬ親は無い
No father will deny his children bread.

content: 2. (=授ける)to confer (a title on one); to bestow (praise on one); to inflict (pain on one)

content.content: 敵にでき得るだけの損害を与える
to inflict as much damage as possible on the enemy

content: 3. (=供給する)to supply (one with school-expenses); to furnish (one with capital); to provide (one with necessaries)

content.content: 人に職を与える
to provide one with work―find one in work

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 人に感動を与える
to make an impression on one
恥辱を与える
to insult one
屈辱を与える
to humiliate one―humble one―humble one in the dust
(決闘などして)致命傷を与える
to wound one mortally
不快の感を与える
to awaken an unpleasant feeling
不快の感を与える物
a disagreeable thing―a loathsome object

あだおろそかにおもう

content:
あだおろそかにおもう〔徒疎かに思う〕
〈熟語〉To make light of (anything)

content.content: ご好意をあだおろそかには思いません
I do not make light of your kindness.―I appreciate your kindness.
このご恩はあだおろそかには思いません
I shall never forgot your kindness.

content:
あだがたき〔仇敵〕
〈名〉An enemy; a rival

content.content: 仇敵とつけ狙う
to seek one's life

content:
あたかも〔恰も〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: あだかも〔恰も〕

content:
あだかも〔恰も〕
〈副〉Just; like; just like; as it were:(接続詞に訳せば)as; as if

content.content: 白き事恰も雪の如し
It is as white as snow.
相愛する事恰も兄弟の如し
They love each other (just) like brothers―as if they were brothers.
彼は恰も成長せる赤児の如し
He is, as is were,―so to speak,―in a manner,―a grown-up baby.
人生は恰も風前の灯火の如し
Life is (like) a candle flickering in the wind.
恰も青年の如く熱烈なる愛を捧ぐ
He loves as ardently as if he were a youth―with all the ardour of youth.

content:
あだかもよし〔恰も好し〕
〈副〉At this juncture; just then

content.content: 恰も好し第二艦隊の帰るに会す
Just then we met the Second Squadron returning.

あだごころ〔徒心〕
〈形〉A faithless heart

content:
あだざくら〔徒桜〕
〈名〉Transient cherry-blossoms

content.content: 明日ありと思う
Hope not the transient blossom shall
心のあだ桜
Until the morrow last:
夜半に嵐の
For who knows but the midnight gale
吹かぬものかは
Thy cherished hope may blast?

あだしおんな〔あだし女〕
〈名〉(A married man's) paramour

あだしごころ〔あだし心〕
〈名〉A fickle heart; a faithless heart; inconstancy

あだししおとこ〔あだし男〕
〈名〉(A married woman's) paramour, lover

あだしちぎり〔あだし契り〕
〈名〉Illicit intercourse; improper connection

content:
あだしの〔あだし野〕
〈名〉The field of death; a graveyard; a battlefield

content.content: あだし野の露と消え行く
to pass away like dew―die.
あだし野にいざ
Now scatter o'er the battlefield,
輝かせますらをが
Ye heroes of my guard,
研ぎ澄ましたる
The lightning flashes of the blades
太刀の光りを
That ye have burnished hard!

あだしびと〔あだし人〕
〈名〉A paramour (of a married man or woman)

content:
あだしめ〔あだし女〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あだしおんな〔あだし女〕

あだする〔寇する〕
〈他動〉To invade, to raid (a country)

content:
あたたかい〔温かい〕
〈形〉Warm (clothes); genial (weather, etc.)

content.content: 日本の気候は温かい
Japan has a warm climate.
温かい天気
warm weather―genial weather
温かい同情
warm sympathy―genial sympathy
この座敷は温かい
It is nice and warm―snug and warm―here.
風邪を引いたら温かにしておれ
If you have a cold, you must be wrapped up warm―warmly wrapped up.
温かにして寝る
to lie covered up warm―sleep warmly covered up
お温かになりました
It is getting warmer.
南の方へ行けば行くほど温かになる
The farther south you go, the warmer is becomes.
(寒いなら)一つ駈けると温かになる
If you have a run, you will get warm―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A run will make you warm.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 温かい冬
a mild winter―a green winter
この冬は温かい
We have a mild winter.
冬温かいと死人が多い
“A green winter makes a fat churchyard.”
温かい家庭
a happy home
懐が温かい
I am flush of money―in funds―in full feather―I have a well-filled pocket―a well-lined purse.
従兄弟の肌は温かい
“Blood is thicker than water.”

content:
あたたかみ〔温か味〕
〈名〉Warmth

content.content: 温か味のある人だ
He has a warm heart―He is warm-hearted.
温か味の無い人だ
He has a cold heart―He is cold-hearted.

content:
あたたまる〔温まる〕
〈自動〉(自然となら) to become warm, get warm:(日に当たりなどしてなら) to be warmed:(火に当たりなどしてなら) to warm oneself

content.content: 床へ入って温まる
to get warm in bed
温まる暇{いとま}も無く起こされた
I was roused before I could get warm.
席の温まるに遑{いとま}あらず
I am too busy to keep my seat.

content:
あたためる〔温める〕
〈他動〉To warm (anything)

content.content: 着物を温めて着る
to warm one's clothes before putting them on
交情を温める
to cultivate one's friendship
旧情を温める
to renew old relations―(友人間なら)―renew one's acquaintance―revice old friendship―(男女間なら)―revive old love―rekindle an old flame.
懐を温める
to fill one's pocket―line one's purse―feather one's nest

content:
あたって〔当たって〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. ［方向］

content.content: 中国の東に当たって島あり
There is an island(to the) east of the Middle Empire.
はるか西方に当たって陸がある
There is land far to the westward.
京都の東北に当たって山がある
There rises a mountain (to the) north-east of Kyoto.
道路の右に当たって館がある
There stands a mansion to the right of the road―Right of the road stands a mansion.
本船の航路に当たって島がある
An island lies in our course.
この時に当たって
at this time―at this juncture―at this period
事ある時に当たって
in time of need―in case of emergency―in the day of trouble
何々するに当たって
in doing something
専門を選ぶに当たって最も注意すべきことは何であるか
What war the most important things to be considered in choosing a profession?

あたってくだけろ〔当たって砕けろ〕
〈熟語〉I will take my chance; I will take the chances; I will take the risks; I will risk it; I will chance it

content:
あたってみる〔当たって見る〕
〈自他動〉To try

content.content: 物は試しだ当たってみろ
There is nothing like trying.
値段を当たってみよう
I will feel the price―feel the pulse of the market.
寸法を当たってみる
to take the measure
彼はどんな意見を持っているか当たってみよう
I will sound his views―sound him on the subject.
小当たりに当たってみた
I threw out a feeler.

あだっぽい〔婀娜っぽい〕
〈形〉Coquettish, charming, bewitching, enchanting, captivating, fascinating, ravishing, voluptuous (beauty, etc.)

content:
あだな〔綽名〕
〈名〉A nickname; a cognomen; a sobriquet

content.content: 人にあだ名をつける
to nickname one
彼は唐辛子と言うあだ名がついている
He is nicknamed “Pepper.”

あだなみ〔徒波〕
〈名〉A light wave:(より)a fickle heart

content:
あだに〔徒に〕
〈副〉Vainly; in vain

content.content: 徒に時を過ごす
to waste time

あだばな〔徒花〕
〈名〉A neuter flower

content:
あたま〔頭〕
〈名〉
1. (=頭部)the head; the pate

content.content: 頭を上げる
to raise one's head―hold up one's head
恩人には頭が上がらぬ
One can not hold up one's head before one's benefactor.
あの人に頭が上がる者は無い
No one can hold up his head before that man.
こんなところにいては一生頭が上がらぬ
I shall never be able to hold up my head in my present place.
頭を下げる
to lower one's head―bow one's head―(謙遜してなら)―humble oneself
ペコペコ頭を下げる
to cringe
頭を下げて頼む
to ask humbly―make a humble request―for something
彼は頭を下げる事が嫌いだ
He is proud―above asking favours.
恥じて頭を垂れる
to hang one's head for shame
頭を掻く
to scratch one's head―(恥じてなら)―hang one's head for shame
頭を振る(かぶりを振る)
to shake one's head―(首を振る)―swing one's head from side to side
この酒は頭へ上がる
This wine gets into the head.
頭へ上がる酒
heady wine
人の頭を打つ
to strike one on the head―hit one over the head
子どもの頭をなでる
to pat a child on the head
(柱や壁に)頭をぶっつける
to knock one's head against a post―bump one's head against the wall
二人で頭をぶっつけ合った
We bumped our heads together―I brought my head into collision with his.
頭を丸める
to take the tonsure
頭が痛い
My head aches―I have a headache.
頭が割れるように痛い
I have a splitting headache.
頭が痛いとか足が痛いとか言って出て来ない
He will not come, saying he is sick or something.
頭がピンピンする、ガンガンする
My head throbs―I have a throbbing in the head.
頭が禿げる
One's head grows bald―One becomes bald.
僕の血統は頭が早く禿げる
Premature baldness runs in my family.
頭禿げても浮気止まぬ
He is an old sinner.
禿げ頭
a bald head―a bald pate
しらが頭
a gray head―a white head
ごましお頭
a grizzled head
しらくも頭
a seald-head
稽古頭
a head for a barber to practise upon
稽古頭にする
to practise upon one's head―“A barber learns to shave by shaving fools.”
稽古頭になる
to have one's head practised upon
頭のてっぺんから足の爪先まで
from head to foot―from top to toe
頭から足の先まで人を見る
to look over one from head to foot―(を面白く言うと)―look one up and down―measure a man from head to foot with one's eye
頭の毛
the hair of the head―a head of hair
頭の鉢
the brain-pan―the skull―the cranium

content: 2. (=頭脳)the head; the brain; brains; intellect

content.content: あの人は頭がよい
He has a good head―He has a clear head―He is clear-headed.
頭の悪い
He has a bad head―He has a muddled head―He is muddle-headed.
頭が無い
He has no head―no brains.
緻密な頭を持っている
He has a closely thinking head―a fine brain―a discriminating mind―He is a close thinker.
粗雑な頭を持っている
He has a gross head―a coarse brain―an undiscriminating mind―He is a loose thinker.
冷静な頭を持っている
He has a cool head―He is cool-headed.
公平な頭を持っている
He has a level head―He is level-headed.
数学の頭がある
He has a head for mathematics.
頭を使う
to use one's head―do head-work―do intellectual work―exercise one's intellect
頭を使う仕事
head-work―intellectual work
ある思想を人の頭に入れる(叩き込む)
to get an idea into one's head―beat an idea into one's head
この考えがどうして彼の頭に入らぬ
I can not get the idea into his head―beat the idea into his head.
間違った考えが彼の頭に染み込んでどうしても抜けない
I can not get the notion out of his head―beat the notion out of his head.
頭を痛める、頭を悩ます
to beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―rack one's brains―ransack one's brains

content: 3. (=考え)an idea

content.content: 僕はそういう頭でこの仕事を引き受けたのだ
I undertook the work with that idea.

content: 4. (=頭髪)(a man's) hair; (a woman's) head-dress

content.content: 頭を刈る
to cut one's hair
頭を刈って来る
I am going to have my hair cut.
頭を剃る
to shave one's head―(坊主になるの意味なら)―take the tonsure
いがぐり頭
close-cropped hair―a close-cropped head
妙な頭がはやる
A curious style of head-dress is in fashion.
彼は頭{ず}が高い
He is proud―haughty.
頭が低い
He is humble―condescending.
社会に頭を持ち上げる
to become prominent―rise into prominence―make a figure―cut a figure―cut a conspicuous figure―cut a prominent figure―in society
彼は政界の大頭だ
He is a conspicuous figure―a prominent figure―in the political world.
賃銀などの頭をはねる、頭を張る
to squeeze the wages―cheat the men of their pay―(米国では)―take graft
人の頭を抑える
to place a person under restraint―keep a person under control―keep a person under one's thumb
そう頭を抑えられては困る
I can not stand such restraint.
若い者は頭を抑えられるのをいやがる
Young men are impatient of control.
(何に)頭を突っ込む
to pose one's nose into―thrust one's nose into―meddle in―dabble in―a matter
政界に頭を突っ込む
to dabble in politics
あの人は何にでもやたらに頭を突っ込む
He has a finger in every pie.
頭を抱えて逃げる
to retreat in disgrace―beat a disgraceful retreat
(人の言う事を)頭からけなす、頭からかっけなす、頭からこなしつける
to contradict one flatly―condemn one without a hearing
頭から冷水を浴びせられたような心地がした
A cold shudder ran through me.
己が頭の蠅を追え
“Mind your own business.”
頭かくして尻かくさず
ostrich policy―fancied security―self-delusion
鰯の頭も信心から
“Believe well and have well.”
正直の頭に神宿る
God dwells in an honest heart―“God defends the right.”
頭の黒い鼠
a dishonest servant―a thievish servant

content:
あたまかず〔頭数〕
〈名〉The number of man; numerical strength

content.content: 頭数を数える、頭数を読む
to count noses―tell noses
頭数だけ
as many as there are men
頭数を揃える
to make up the (requisite) number―complete the number
頭数が揃った
The number is made up―The number is complete.
頭数をふやす
to increase the number―add to the number
頭数を減らす
to decrease the number―lessen the men―take from the number
頭数が多い
There are many men.
頭数が少ない
There are few men.
反対党は頭数が多い
Our opponents are strong in numbers―numerically strong.
こちらよりも頭数が多い
They exceeds us in numbers―They outnumber us―They are superior to us in numerical strength―They are superior to us in numbers.
味方の方が頭数が少ない
We are inferior in numbers―inferior in numerical strength.
(決を採る時)こちらは頭数が多い
The majority is on our side―We have the majority on our side.

content:
あたまかぶ〔頭株〕
〈名〉A chief, a leader (among a set of men)

content.content: 頭株になる
to become a leader―come to take a leading part―come to the fore

content:
あたまから〔頭から〕
〈副〉Flatly; squarely; point-blank

content.content: (人の言う事を)頭からけなしつける
to contradict one flatly
頭からはねつける
to refuse flatly―refuse point-blank―give a square refusal
頭からどなりつける
to condemn one without a hearing

あだまくら〔徒枕〕
〈名〉Illicit intercourse; improper connection

content:
あたまごなし〔頭ごなし〕
〈名〉A flat contradiction; a condemnation without a hearing

content.content: 人の言う事を頭ごなしにする
to contradict one flatly―condemn one without a hearing

あたまのけ〔頭の毛〕
〈名〉The hair of the head; a head of hair

あたまのはち〔頭の鉢〕
〈名〉The brain-pan; the skull; the cranium

content:
あたまわり〔頭割り〕
〈名〉Capitation; head-money; an equal share

content.content: 費用は頭割りで出そう
Let us each pay an equal share in the expenses―Let us go by capitation.
費用は頭割で一人五十円
The expenses are 50 yen per head.

あだめく〔婀娜めく〕
〈自動〉To coquet; to play the coquette; to be coquettish

あだもの〔婀娜者〕
〈名〉A coquette; a flirt; a houri; a siren; an enchantress

content:
あたら〔可惜〕
〈形〉Dear, precious(の意味なれども英語にてはこの意を全文に含蓄すること多し)

content.content: あたら命をただ棄てた
He threw away his (precious) life in vain.
あたら盛りの花を散らした
She was cut off in the flower of her youth.
あたら蕾の花を散らした
She was cut off in the bud of womanhood.
あたら玉に瑕がある
There is a flaw on the gem―(人格なら)―a blot on his character―(名なら)―a slur on his name―(操なら)―a spot on her honour
あたら花を野で暮す
to “waste one's sweetness on the desert air.”
あたら口に茶を入れる
“My thirst is worthy of a better cause.”

content:
あたらしい〔新しい〕
〈形〉New (thing); fresh (fish, eggs, vegetables); novel (idea); strange (sight, etc.)

content.content: この魚は新しそうだ
This fish looks fresh.
見るもの聞くもの一つとして新しくないものは無い
Everything I see or hear is new to me―strange to me―a revelation to me.
新しき物好き
to be fond of novelty
女房と畳は新しいのが好い
A new wife and new matting make a new home―It is the nature of man to hunt after novelty.
故{ふる}きを温{たず}ねて新しきを知る
We inquire of the ancients about modern affairs.
新しき女
the new woman

content:
あたらしく〔新しく〕
〈副〉Newly; anew; afresh:(=する) to renew (one's life); to renovate (old cloth, etc.)

content.content: 新しく始める
to begin anew―start afresh
新しく建った家
a newly-built house―a new house
新しく来た人
a new-comer―a new arrival

content:
あたらずさわらず〔当らずさわらず〕
〈副〉(To act or speak) without harm or offence to any one, without harming or offending anybody

content.content: 当らずさわらずの話をする
to talk on indifferent topics
そんな話をしていりゃ当らずさわらずで好い
Such talk is harmless.

当らずといえども遠からず
あたらずといえどもとおからず

content:
あたらずといえどもとおからず〔当らずといえども遠からず〕
〈熟語〉(You are) not far from the mark; (you are) very nearly right; (it is) approximate

content.content: 君の臆測は当たらずといえども遠からずだ
You have guessed very nearly right―Your conjecture is not far from the mark.

content:
あたり〔当たり、中り〕
〈名〉
1. (=命中、成功)a hit; a success

content.content: 十本の矢で当たりが九本はずれがたった一本
I made nine hits and only one miss out of ten arrows.
あたりかはずれか
Is it a hit or a miss?―a success or a failure?
今度の山は大当たり
The speculation is a great hit―a big success―I have made a great hit in speculation.
今度の狂言は大当たり
The new play have made a great hit―made a big success of it.
当たり狂言
a successful play
まぐれ当たりだ
It is a chance hit―(臆測なら)―a lucky guess.

content: 2. (=風の当たり)exposure (to the wind)

content.content: その家は海岸で風の当たりがはげしい
The house stands by the seaside, and is directly exposed to the sea-breeze.

content: 3. (=暑気当たり、陽気当たりの当たり)the effects (of something injurious to health)

content.content: 暑気当たりです
I am suffering from the effects of exposure to the heat―I have a touch of heat-stroke.
陽気当たりです
I am under the weather.

content: 4. (=人に対する当たり)(one's) behaviour, conduct (towards people)

content.content: 人に当たりが好い、当たりが悪い
He is affable―unaffable.

content: 5. (=果物の当たり)a bruise

content.content: 果物の荷造りが悪いと当たりができる
Fruits get bruised if they are ill packed.
当たりのある梨は腐りやすい
Bruised pears will not keep.

content:
あたり〔当たり、中り〕
〈名〉
1. (=命中、成功)a hit; a success

content.content: 十本の矢で当たりが九本はずれがたった一本
I made nine hits and only one miss out of ten arrows.
あたりかはずれか
Is it a hit or a miss?―a success or a failure?
今度の山は大当たり
The speculation is a great hit―a big success―I have made a great hit in speculation.
今度の狂言は大当たり
The new play have made a great hit―made a big success of it.
当たり狂言
a successful play
まぐれ当たりだ
It is a chance hit―(臆測なら)―a lucky guess.

content: 2. (=風の当たり)exposure (to the wind)

content.content: その家は海岸で風の当たりがはげしい
The house stands by the seaside, and is directly exposed to the sea-breeze.

content: 3. (=暑気当たり、陽気当たりの当たり)the effects (of something injurious to health)

content.content: 暑気当たりです
I am suffering from the effects of exposure to the heat―I have a touch of heat-stroke.
陽気当たりです
I am under the weather.

content: 4. (=人に対する当たり)(one's) behaviour, conduct (towards people)

content.content: 人に当たりが好い、当たりが悪い
He is affable―unaffable.

content: 5. (=果物の当たり)a bruise

content.content: 果物の荷造りが悪いと当たりができる
Fruits get bruised if they are ill packed.
当たりのある梨は腐りやすい
Bruised pears will not keep.

content:
あたり〔辺り〕
〈名〉
1. (=近所)the neighbourhood; the vicinity

content.content: あたりに人家が無い
There are no human habitations in the neighbourhood.
あたりの様子をうかがう
to take one's bearings―look about one
勇気凛々あたりを払う
He has a dashing air.
その説は畏{かしこ}き辺りにも行われているらしい
The doctrine seems to prevail in high places.

content: 2. (=あたりの人々)the people present; the others

content.content: あたりかまわず見せつける
They indulge in demonstrative behaviour in the presence of people.
そんな事をされるとあたりが迷惑だ
If you do such a thing, the others will suffer―You do it at the expense of others.
あたりが気が利かない
The others are slow to take the hint.

content: 〈副詞、前置詞相当〉About; around; or thereabouts

content.content: あたり見廻す
to look around
あたりに目を配る
to look about one―look sharp about one―have all one's eyes about one
あたりに気を配る
to be watchful―on the watch
彼の家はここらあたりだ
He lives somewhere about here.
火事は浅草あたりだ
The fire is somewhere about Asakusa.
先月あたりのことだ
It occurred about last month.
今日あたり来そうなものだ
I hope he will come today or tomorrow.
一作年あたりのことであった
It occurred the year before last or thereabouts.
入費は五十円あたりと見てよかろう
The expense my be put at 50 yen or there abouts.
まずそこらあたりだろうね
That's about it―That's about the size of it.

content:
あたりきんじょ〔辺り近処〕
〈名〉The neighbourhood; the vicinity

content.content: あたり近所に人家が無い
There is no human habitation in the neighbourhood.

content:
あたりくじ〔当たり籤〕
〈名〉A prize (ticket); the prize number (in a lottery)

content.content: 当たり籤を引く
to draw a prize
当たり籤は何番か
What is the prize number?

content:
あたりさわり〔当たり障り〕
〈名〉Harm or offence

content.content: 当たりさわりが無い
to be harmless and inoffensive―indifferent―neutral―non-committal
彼は当たりさわりの無い事を言っている
He talks on indifferent topics.
当たりさわりの無い処置をする
to act so as to harm or offend no one―use tact and delicacy
こうすれば当たりさわりはあるまい
This line of conduct will do no harm―give no offence.
当たりさわりの無いようにやってくれ頼む
See that you give no offence.
当たりさわりの無い態度を取る
to assume a neutral attitude
当たりさわりの無い返事をする
to give a non-committal answer

content:
あたりちらす〔当たり散らす〕
〈他動〉To vent one's anger at random; to vent one's anger on everybody; to fall foul of everybody; to run amuck at everybody; to snarl at everybody

content.content: 彼は機嫌が悪いと八つ当たりに当たり散らす
When he is in ill humour, he will fall foul of everybody―run amuck at everybody―He will work off his ill temper on everybody.
世に当たり散らす哲人を犬儒と言う
A cynic is a philosopher who snarls at everybody.

content:
あたりて〔当たりて〕
〈前置詞相当〉→『

content.content: あたって〔当たって〕

content:
あたりどし〔当たり年〕
〈名〉A good year (for some fruit or vegetable)

content.content: この年や南瓜の当たり年
Pumpkins have turned out well this year―This is a good year for pumpkins―(より)―This is a great year for homely girls.

content:
あたりはずれ〔当たりはずれ〕
〈名〉Hit or miss; success or failure

content.content: 山の事だから当たりはずれはある
A speculation is liable to failure.
当たりはずれは時の運
Success depends on luck.
弾のあたりはずれは運命である
“Every bullet has its billet.”

content:
あたりまえ〔当たり前〕
〈形〉
1. (=当然のこと)(a matter) of course

content.content: 怒ったかって? あたりまえさ
Am I angry? Of course, I am.

content: 2. (=当然の義務) proper

content.content: 借りた物を返すのはあたりまえだ
It is proper that one should pay what one owes―One ought to pay what one owes.
親が子の世話をするのはあたりまえだ
It is proper that parents should care for their children―Parents ought to care for their children.

content: 3. (=当然の結果、当然の期待)natural; not strange; no wonder

content.content: あんな勉強家が成功するのはあたりまえだ
It is quite natural that such a hard-working man should succeed―It is in the natural order of things that he should succeed―It is no wonder that he should succeed―He ought to succeed.
(こんな事をされて)僕が怒るのはあたりまえでないか
It is no great wonder that I should be angry―What wonder (is it) that I should be angry?―Ought I not to be angry?
子が親の世話になるのはあたりまえだ
It is quite natural that a son should depend on his father―There is nothing strange in a son depending on his father.

content: 4. (=当然の、相当の賞罰など)due, deserved, merited (reward or punishment)

content.content: (あんな事をすりゃ)そんな目に逢うのはあたりまえだ
You richly deserve it―It serves you right―Serve you right!

content: 5. (=普通の)ordinary:(変わり者に対しては) other

content.content: あたりまえに行けば何年かかるだろうか
How long will it take in the ordinary course of things?
(戦争中でなく)あたりまえならもう英国から返事が来るはずだ
At other times, I should have an answer from England by this.
お前があたりまえにさえしていれば金が残るばかりだ
If you were to conduct yourself like other men, you could not help getting rich.

content:
あたる〔当たる、中る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=命中する)to hit (the mark); to strike (the object aimed at)

content.content: 的にあたる
to hit the mark―take effect―tell
星にあたる
to hit the bull's-eye
銃弾が頭部にあたった
The bullet hit him on the head.
砲弾が司令塔にあたった
The shell hit the ship on the conning-tower―struck (the ship on) the conning-tower.
弾があたった
The shot has taken effect.
弾があたらない
The shot has missed―gone wide of the mark―gone wild.
弾としてあたらざる無し(百発百中)
Every shot tells.
鉄砲弾にあたる
to be hit by a bullet―be struck by a bullet
敵の弾はあたらない
The enemy's shots do not take effect.
敵の撃ち方はあたらない
The enemy do not shoot straight―They shoot wide―shoot wild.
日本人は鉄砲弾があたっても死なないと言う者があった
It was said that the Japanese were proof against bullets.

content: 2. (=的中する)to hit the mark

content.content: 評が当たっている
The word hits the mark―hits the nail on the head―hits it.
肯綮にあたる
to hit the mark
(評などが)当たる
to be true―just―correct―right
答が当たる
The answer is correct.
いい加減に書いて出した答案が当たった
The answer I gave at random proved correct.
その評が当たっている
The criticism is just―The estimate is just.
