暑い寒いのあいさつ
the common civilities of life
暑い寒いのあいさつをする
to exchange the civilities of life

content: 2. (=熱い)hot

content.content: 風呂が熱い
The bath is too hot.
地下へ下がれば下がるほど熱くなる
The lower you go down into the earth, the hotter it becomes.
私は猫の性で熱い物は食べられません
Like the cat, I can not cat anything hot.
熱い茶を飲んで口を焼いた
I drank my tea too hot, and burned my mouth.
酒を熱く燗して飲む
We drink sake hot.
支那料理は口が焼けるほど熱い
Chinese dishes are served piping hot.
熱い涙を流す
to cry hot tears―shed scalding tears
熱い恋は冷め易い
“Hot love is soon cold.”
女に熱くなる
to fall in love with―lose one's heart to―a girl
彼はある女に熱くなっている
He is in love with―taken with―gone on―a certain girl.
二人は大あつあつだ
They are madly in love―over head and ears in love―with each other.

content:
あつい〔篤い〕
〈形〉Warm (hospitality); hearty (welcome); cordial (reception); handsome (treatment)

content.content: 篤い礼、篤い感謝を述べた
I tendered warm thanks―cordial thanks.
篤いもてなしを受けた
I received a warm hospitality―I met with a hearty welcome―I was accorded a cordial reception.
篤い恩賞にあずかった
I received a handsome reward―I was handsomely rewarded.

content:
あっか〔悪化〕
〈名〉Deterioration; degeneration:(=する)to deteriorate; to degenerate

content.content: 花は培養しないと悪化してもとの雑草にかえる
Flowers, it left uncultivated, degenerate into weeds.

content:
あつかい〔扱い〕
〈名〉
1. (=取扱い)treatment (of a person or subject); care (of students); charge (of a class); management (of affairs); handling (of a tool); manipulation (of an instrument); working (of a machine); cognizance (of a case)

content.content: 五年組は私の扱いです
The Fifth Year Class is under my charge.
五年生は私の扱いです
The Fifth year students are under my care.
紳士の扱いをする
to treat one as a gentleman
僕は紳士だから紳士の扱いをして貰いたい
I am a gentleman, and with to be treated as such.
彼女は彼を子ども扱いにする
She treats him as a child.
皆彼を食客扱いにしている
They treat him as a sort of dependant.
君だけは破格の扱いにする
I will make an exception of your case―make an exception in your favour.
こういう事件は当裁判所の扱いではない
We take no cognizance of such cases.

content: 2. (=仲裁)mediation

あつかいかた〔扱い方〕
〈名〉The way to treat (people); how to treat of (a subject); how to deal with (students); how to manage (affairs); how to handle (a tool); how to manipulate (an instrument); how to work (a machine)

content.content: 君は生徒の扱い方を知らぬ
You do not know how to deal with students.
彼は生徒の扱い方には妙を得ている
He has tact in dealing with students.
雇人は扱い方一つだ
Everything depends on how you treat your servants―The way you treat your servants is everything.
彼は事務の扱い方が上手だ
He is skilful in managing affairs.
彼は道具の扱い方が上手だ
He is skilful in handling tools.
この機械の扱い方が上手だ
He is skilful in manipulating this instrument―skilful in working this machine.
この機械は扱い方がむつかしい
This machine is hard to work―This instrument is difficult to handle.
この機械は扱い方一つだ
The way you handle this instrument is everything―Everything depends on how you handle this instrument.
どんなよい機械があっても扱い方を知らなけりゃ無用の長物だ
The best machines are useless if you don't know how to work them.

content:
あつかいにくい〔扱いにくい〕
〈形〉Awkward (tool); unwieldy (weapon); unhandy (ship); unmanageable (boat); unworkable (machine); intractable (material); refractory (horse)

content.content: ここの生徒は扱いにくい
These students are hard to deal with.
この機械は扱いにくい
This machine is hard to work―This instrument is difficult to handle―awkward to handle.

あつかいにん〔扱い人〕
〈名〉A mediator

content:
あつかいやすい〔扱い易い〕
〈形〉Handy (ship); manageable (boat); wieldy (weapon); workable (machine); tractable (material)

content.content: ここの生徒は扱いやすい
These students are easy to deal with.
この機械は扱いやすい
This machine is easy to work―This instrument is easy to handle.

content:
あつかう〔扱う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=如何に扱う)(how) to treat (a person or a material); (how) to treat of (a subject); (how) to deal with (students); to use (one ill or well); to serve (one ill or well); (how) to manage (affairs); (how) to handle (a tool); (how) to manipulate (an instrument); (how) to work (a machine)

content.content: 人をていねいに扱う
to treat a man with courtesy―with consideration
人を公平に扱う
to deal justly with one―do one justice
人を手ひどく扱う
to deal severely with one―deal harshly by one―serve one ill―ill-use one―handle one without gloves
人を手荒く扱う
to handle a man roughly
品物を手荒く扱ったから損じたのだ
The goods are damaged by rough handling.
道具などをドタンバタンと手荒く扱う
to bang about the furniture
人を紳士として扱う
to treat one as a gentleman
僕は紳士だから紳士として扱って貰いたい
I am a gentleman, and with to be treated as such.
人を犬のように扱う
to use one like a dog
犬よりもひどく扱う
to serve a man worse than one would serve a dog
彼は生徒を扱うのに妙を得ている
He has tact in dealing with students.
事務を扱う事が上手だ
He is skilful in managing affairs.
道具を扱う事が上手だ
He is skilful in manipulating this instrument―skilful in working this machine.
彼は支那の留学生を扱った経験がある
He has experience with Chinese students.
僕は大金を扱った経験が無い
I have no experience in handling large sums of money.
日々扱う件数が百に達する
The number of cases daily dealt with run up to a hundred.
浜の小娘は巧みに櫓かじを扱う
The little sailor girl can handle the scull with skill.

content: 2. (=何を扱うか扱わぬかの扱う)to deal in (certain goods); to deal with, concern itself with (a certain class of facts); to treat of (a subject); to carry on, conduct, transact (business); to take in, accept (private messages); to take cognizance of (certain cases)

content.content: どんな品物をお扱いになりますか
What line of goods do you deal in?―What goods do you handle?
哲学は万物の大原因、大原則を扱う学問である
Philosophy deals with―concerns itself with―is concerned with―treats of―the general causes and principles of things.
日曜に事務をお扱いになりますか
Do you carry on business―conduct business―transact business―on Sunday?
日曜は事務を扱いません
Business is not carried on―The office is closed―on Sunday.
銀行では日曜に事務を扱うか
Does the bank transact business on Sunday?
銀行では日曜に事務を扱わぬ
The bank is closed to business―The bank is closed―on Sunday.
当裁判所ではかような事件を扱わない
This court does not take cognizance of such cases.
この駅で電報を扱いますか
Do they take in telegrams at this station?
公衆電報を扱う
Telegrams accepted here.
外国行の貨物はここで扱います
Goods destined for abroad are taken in here.

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 内外人を区別して扱う
to discriminate between Japanese and foreigners
僕は外人を区別して扱わぬ(優待せぬ)
I do not discriminate in favour of foreigners.
米国では日本人を区別して扱う(虐待する)
The Americans discriminate against the Japanese.

content:
あつかましい〔厚かましい〕
〈形〉Impudent; audacious; bold (as brass); shameless; unblushing; brazen; brazen-faced; brazen-browed; brass-visaged; barefaced; cheeky; saucy; cool

content.content: ずいぶん厚かましいね
He is a cool hand―I like his impudence.
彼は厚かましくも金をくれろと言った
He was so impudent as to―had the impudence to―had the effrontery to―had the assurance to―had the hardihood to―had the face to―had the cheek to―had the forehead to―had the front to―ask for money.
よくも厚かましくそんなことが言えたものだ
I wonder how he could have the face to say such a thing.

content:
あつかましさ〔厚かましさ〕
〈名〉Impudence; audacity; effrontery; assurance; hardihood; face; cheek; front; forehead; brass

content.content: あの厚かましさにはあきれるね
I like his impudence.

あつがみ〔厚紙〕
〈名〉Cardboard; pasteboard:(表紙用なら)millboard

content:
あつがり〔暑がり〕
〈名〉One who is sensitive to heat

content.content: 僕は暑がりだ
I am sensitive to heat―I feel the heat―I can not stand the heat of summer―I am an enemy to heat.

あつがる〔暑がる〕
〈自動〉To be sensitive heat; to feel heat of summer; to complain of the heat

content:
あっかん〔悪感〕
〈名〉Ill-feeling; ill blood

content.content: (何か見て)悪感を起す
to revolt at some sight
(なにかしら二人の間に)悪感を起こしたものがある
Something created ill blood between the two.

content:
あっかん〔悪漢〕
〈名〉A knave; a rogue; a rascal; a scoundrel; a villain; a black-gurad

content.content: こんな悪漢を世に放つのは危険千万だ
It is dangerous, to loose such scoundrels on society.
悪漢の真相をあばく
to expose a villain―unmask a scoundrel

content:
あつかん〔熱燗〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あつがん〔熱燗〕

content:
あつがん〔熱燗〕
〈名〉Heating sake hot

content.content: 熱燗で飲む
to drink sake hot

content:
あっかんじょう〔悪感情〕
〈名〉Ill-feeling, ill blood (between two persons, parties, etc.)

content.content: 悪感情を懐く
to harbour ill-feeling towards one
悪感情を生ずる
to breed ill blood between two persons

あっき〔悪気〕
〈名〉Noxious air; miasma

あっき〔悪鬼〕
〈名〉An evil spirit; a demon; a devil

content:
あつぎ〔厚着〕
〈名〉Wearing thick clothes:(=する) to be thickly clad

content.content: 田舎者は厚着だ
Countryfolk are thickly clad―heavily clad―overclothed.

content:
あつくるしい〔暑苦しい〕
〈形〉Sultry (weather); sweltering (atmosphere); oppressive (heat)

content.content: 今晩は暑苦しい
The heat is oppressive this evening.
暑苦しい天気だ
It is sultry weather―sweltering weather.

content:
あっけい〔悪計〕
〈名〉An evil design; a wicked design; a sinister design; a dark design; an evil scheme; a sinister scheme; machinations

content.content: 悪計をめぐらす
to devise an evil design―revolve an evil scheme―concoct schemes―devise mischief―machinate
その悪計にかかった
I fell a victim to his schemes.
悪計をあばく
to expose an evil design
一見して彼の悪計を看破した
I saw through his design at a glance.

あつげしょう〔厚化粧〕
〈名〉Heavy toilette:(=する) to make a heavy toilette; to paint one's face thick; to put on a thick coat of paint

content:
あっけない〔飽気無い〕
〈形〉(Too) short-lived, evanescent, unsatisfying:(副詞に訳せば)all too soon; but too soon; only too soon

content.content: (面白い事などが)あまりあっけなかった
It ended all too soon.
あっけない死にようだった
His death came but too soon.
人生はあっけないものだ
Life is but a span.
年末の休暇はいつもあっけない
The Christmas holidays always pass but too quickly.

あっけらかんとして
〈副〉Listlessly; absent-mindedly

content:
あっこう〔悪口〕
〈名〉Abuse; vituperation; sarcasm; scandal; calumny; slander; (insulting or malicious) remarks

content.content: 悪口を言う

(向かってなら)to abuse one―revile one―vituperate one―rail at (or against) one―call one names―call one by hard (or ugly) names―make insulting remarks―(蔭でなら)―make malicious remarks―indulge in remarks―speak ill of on (behind one's back)―backbite one―stab one in the back―talk against one―whisper against one―calumniate one―slander one―pick one to pieces―talk scandal―make free with one's―take liberties with one's reputation
蔭で悪口を言う人
a backbiter
蔭で悪口を言っている人があると見えてくしゃみが出る(に相当するは)
My ears are burning.
昨夜は君の悪口を言ったぜ
Were your ears burning last night?
人の悪口を言うものでない
You should not speak ill of people.
彼は僕のことをそんな悪口を言ったか
Did he say such things of me?
彼は僕に向かって(ばかだの畜生だの泥棒だの)いろいろの悪口言った
He called me names―called me by hard names―called me by ugly names.
彼は口にまかせて悪口を言った
He called me by every name he could lay his tongue to.
僕は悪口を言われても平気だ
I am indifferent to abuse―quite used to malicious remarks.
悪口を言われても怒らない
I can take an abuse in good part.
うっかり人の悪口を言ってひどい目に逢った
I indulged in some remarks which cost me dear.
君はそんなことをすると人が悪口を言うぞ
If you do such things, people will make remarks―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You conduct will elicit malicious remarks.
あの人ほど悪口を言われた人はあるまい
No man has been more talked against than he.
あの人は学校の悪口を言っている
He takes liberties with the reputation of the school.
会員がストーブのまわりに集まってひどい悪口を言っていた
The members were gathered around the stove, talking infinite scandal.
彼らが寄るときっと人の悪口だ
They can not come together without picking their neighbours to pieces.
彼らはありとあらゆる悪口を言い尽した
They have left no scandal unspoken―left no calumny unspoken.
彼は有る事ない事人の悪口を言う
He calumniates people.
あの人は雇人の食物まで限るというが、しかしそれは悪口だ
People say he stints his servants in their food, but that's calumny.
口汚い悪口
foul abuse―scurrilous abuse
口汚い悪口を言う
to use foul language―use filthy language―use scurrilous language―fling dirt at a man
口汚い悪口を言う人だ
He is foul-tongued―foul-mouthed―foul-spoken―a scurrilous reviler.
皮肉な悪口
cynical remarks―malicious remarks
痛い悪口
scathing remarks―scathing sarcasm
彼は僕のことを失敬な悪口を言った
He made insulting remarks about me.
悪口を言い合う
to exchange compliments

content:
あっこうぞうごん〔悪口雑言〕
〈名〉Abusive language

content.content: 彼は僕に向かって悪口雑言を言った
He used abusive language towards me.

あっこん〔悪混〕
〈名〉Adulteration:(=する) to adulterate (wine, etc.)

content:
あつさ〔厚さ〕
〈名〉Thickness

content.content: 扶桑艦の甲鉄は厚さがどのくらいあるか
How thick is the Fuso's armour?―What is the thickness of the Fuso's armour?
厚さ十二インチ
It is 12 inches thick―It measures 12 inches in thickness―It has a thickness of 12 inches.

content:
あつさ〔暑さ、熱さ〕
〈名〉
1. The heat (of summer)

content.content: 暑さに耐える
to stand the heat
暑さに負ける、暑さにあたる
to be affected by the heat―be prostrated by the heat
君は暑さを苦にするようだね
You seem to be sensitive to the heat.
僕は暑さはいっこう平気だ
I am quite indifferent to the heat―I do not mind the heat.
暑さを避ける(避暑をする)
to escape from the heat of summer―go somewhere for the summer―pass the summer somewhere
暑さをしのぐ
(耐えるの意味なら)to stand the heat―(避けるの意味なら)―go somewhere for the summer―pass the summer somewhere
暑さよりも寒さの方がしのぎやすい
Cold is easier to stand than heat.
西洋人は多く軽井沢へ行って暑さをしのぐ
Many foreigners go to Karuizawa for the summer―pass the summer at Karuizawa.
暑さをしのぐには海水浴が一番だ
The seaside is the best place to pass the summer―Sea bathing is the best way to forget the heat of summer.
暑さにあたったのだ
I have a heat―stroke.
言うまじと
I'll never say,
思えど今日の
And yet can you deny,
暑さかな
How hot it is today!

content: 2. (=熱さ)heat

content.content: のどもと過ぐれば熱さを忘る
Once down the throat, the heat is forgotten―(に相当する格言は)―“Danger past, God is forgotten.”

content:
あつさ〔暑さ、熱さ〕
〈名〉
1. The heat (of summer)

content.content: 暑さに耐える
to stand the heat
暑さに負ける、暑さにあたる
to be affected by the heat―be prostrated by the heat
君は暑さを苦にするようだね
You seem to be sensitive to the heat.
僕は暑さはいっこう平気だ
I am quite indifferent to the heat―I do not mind the heat.
暑さを避ける(避暑をする)
to escape from the heat of summer―go somewhere for the summer―pass the summer somewhere
暑さをしのぐ
(耐えるの意味なら)to stand the heat―(避けるの意味なら)―go somewhere for the summer―pass the summer somewhere
暑さよりも寒さの方がしのぎやすい
Cold is easier to stand than heat.
西洋人は多く軽井沢へ行って暑さをしのぐ
Many foreigners go to Karuizawa for the summer―pass the summer at Karuizawa.
暑さをしのぐには海水浴が一番だ
The seaside is the best place to pass the summer―Sea bathing is the best way to forget the heat of summer.
暑さにあたったのだ
I have a heat―stroke.
言うまじと
I'll never say,
思えど今日の
And yet can you deny,
暑さかな
How hot it is today!

content: 2. (=熱さ)heat

content.content: のどもと過ぐれば熱さを忘る
Once down the throat, the heat is forgotten―(に相当する格言は)―“Danger past, God is forgotten.”

content:
あっさく〔圧搾〕
〈名〉Compression; pressure:(=する) to compress (air); to press (hay, etc.)

content.content: 圧搾空気
compressed air

あっさくき〔圧搾器〕
〈名〉A compressor; a press:(外科用のは)a constrictor

content:
あっさり
〈副〉Lightly; briefly:(=した) light (food or drink); simple (ornament); chaste (design); brief (speech); frank (person or disposition)

content.content: あっさり食事をする
to partake of a light repeat―make a light meal
夏はあっさりしたものが好い
Light food is best in summer.
酒の肴にはあっさりした物が好い
Light dishes go well with wine.
あっさり言う
to say briefly―make a light remark
言いにくい事をあっさりとごまかす
to slide over a delicate subject
小言を言うならあっさりと言うがよい
You ought to give them a light scolding.
あっさり遊ぼう
Let us have some light pleasure.
模様があっさりしている
The design is simple and chaste.
あっさりした人だ
He is of a frank disposition.

content:
あっし〔圧死〕
〈名〉Death from pressure:(=する) to be pressed to death; to be crushed to death; to be squeezed to death

content.content: 東京の大地震で圧死した者がたくさんある
Many people were crushed to death in the Great Earthquake of Tokyo.

content:
あっしゅく〔圧縮〕
〈名〉Compression:(=する) to compress

content.content: 空気を圧縮すると液体になる
Air is liquefied by compression.

あっすいぽんぷ〔圧水ポンプ〕
〈名〉A force-pump

content:
あっする〔圧する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=押す、抑える)to press; to press down
2. (=圧制する)to oppress

content.content: 武力を以て人民を圧する
to oppress the people with the mailed fist

content: 3. (=制す)to dominate (the situation); to dominate over, lord it over (the world); to domineer over, lord it over (the sea, etc.)

content.content: 局面を圧する
to dominate the situation
四海を圧する
to dominate over the world―domineer over the world
武力を以て世を圧したる二大国も地上にその影をとどめず
The two mighty powers, which dominated over the world by military power, have been wiped out of existence.
山容四隣を圧す
The mountain domineers over the surrounding country―lords it over the surrounding country.
堂々たる軍艦、大海を圧するの観あり
How she domineers over the deep!―lords it over the deep!
軍艦、海を圧して敵艦隊に迫る
The squadron, lording it over the deep, bore down upon the enemy.

content: 4. (=圧倒する)to overpower, overwhelm (the enemy); to overawe (a man); to bear down (opposition)

content.content: 敵を圧する
to overwhelm the enemy by numbers
威風堂々四辺を圧す
His commanding presence overawes the people he has to deal with.
大勢で行って反対を圧するよりほかは無い
We must go in such force as to bear down opposition.

content:
あっせい〔圧制〕
〈名〉Tyranny; despotism; oppression:(=する) to oppress (the people); to tyrannize over (the people); to rule (the people) with an iron hand; to rule (the people) with a rod of iron:(=な) tyrannical (prince); despotic (government); oppressive (measures)

content.content: 民は圧制を受けている
The people are oppressed―groan under oppression―crouch under oppression―crouch to oppressors.
圧制された国民
an oppressed people―a downtrodden people
圧制政府
a despotic government
処置が圧制極まる
The measures are most oppressive.
多数の圧制
tyranny of the many―tyranny of the majority

あっせいか〔圧制家〕
〈名〉A tyrant; a despot; an oppressor

あっせいせいふ〔圧制政府〕
〈名〉A despotic government

content:
あっせつ〔圧接〕
〈名〉Impact:(=する) to impact

content.content: 日本の気候の温暖なるは黒潮の圧接による
The mildness of Japan's climate is due to the impact of the Black Current.

content:
あっせん〔斡旋〕
〈名〉
1. (=周旋)good offices; kind office:(=する) to use one's good offices, use one's influence, exert oneself (in behalf of some one)

content.content: 斡旋の労をとる
to use one's good offices
田中君の斡旋によって事がまとまった
The thing was brought about through the good offices of―by the kind offices of―by the kindness of―Mr. Tanaka.
本会の為に斡旋の労を取られた方々に深く感謝致します
I cordially thank those gentleman who have exerted themselves in behalf of the association.
よろしくご斡旋のぼど願います
I beg you will use your influence in my behalf―exert yourself in my behalf.
就職を斡旋する
to help the unemployed to find employment

content: 2. (=媒介)mediation:(=する) to mediate between, go between (the parties)

content.content: 二人の間を斡旋したのは彼だ
It is he who mediated between the two.
斡旋者
a mediator

content:
あったかい
〈形〉→『

content.content: あたたかい〔温かい〕

content:
あったかみ
〈名〉→『

content.content: あたたかみ〔温か味〕

content:
あったまる
〈自動〉→『

content.content: あたたまる〔温まる〕

content:
あっためる
〈他動〉→『

content.content: あたためる〔温める〕

content:
あったら〔可惜〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: あたら〔可惜〕

content:
あっち〔彼方〕
〈代名副詞〉→『

content.content: あちら
あっちへ行け
Go away!―Go along!―Get along with you!―Go about your business!―Begone about your business!
僕はあっちの方へめったに行かない
I seldom go that way―(山の手の方なら)―up that way―(下町の方なら)―down that way.

有っても無くてもよい
あってもなくてもよい

content:
あってもなくてもよい〔有っても無くてもよい〕
〈形〉Indifferent

content.content: 甘い物はあっても無くてもよい
(客観的に言えば)Sweets are indifferent to me―(主観的に言えば)―I am indifferent to (or about) sweets―I am careless about sweets―I don't care for sweets.

content:
あっといわせる〔アッと言わせる〕
〈他動〉To take away one's breath; to knock the breath out of one's body

content.content: 彼は試験官にアッと言わせた
His answer took away the breath of the examiner.

content:
あっとうする〔圧倒する〕
〈他動〉To overpower, overwhelm (the enemy by numbers); to overrule (the minority); to overthrow, crush (one's rival); to drive out (other goods); to bear down (opposition)

content.content: 多数に圧倒される
(戦場なら)to be overwhelmed by numbers―(議場なら)―be overruled by the majority
彼は競争者をことごとく圧倒して今は独り舞台だ
He has crushed all his rivals, and is now the sole master of the field.
そうすりゃ日本品が支那市場において他国品を圧倒することはわけは無い
Then it would be easy for the Japanese goods to drive out the others from the Chinese market.
大勢で行って反対者を圧倒しよう
Let us go in such numbers as to bear down opposition.

あっとばかりにおどろく

あっとばかりにおどろく〔アッと計りに驚く〕
〈熟語〉To have one's breath taken away; to have the breath knocked out of one's body

content:
あっぱく〔圧迫〕
〈名〉
1. (=押し迫ること)pressure:(=する) to press

content.content: 敵を圧迫する
to press the enemy hard―press hard on the enemy
我が軍は敵の右翼を圧迫せり
We pressed hard on the enemy's right flank.
人に圧迫を加える
to bring pressure to bear upon―put the screw on―a man
義務を尽くさない者には多少圧迫を加える必要がある
Some pressure must be brought to bear upon the delinquents.
圧迫を受ける
to be subjected to pressure―(敵の圧迫なら)―be hard pressed.
敵は我が軍の圧迫を受けて退却した
The enemy retreated under pressure of our troops.
圧迫に耐える
to stand the pressure
圧迫に屈服する
to yield to the pressure

content: 2. (=強制)compulsion; coercion; logic (of facts, necessity, etc.):(=する) to compel; to coerce

content.content: 言論を圧迫する
to coerce silence
反対党は圧迫されて服従した
The opposition was coerced into submission.
圧迫の下に約す
to promise under compulsion
圧迫の下になせる約束は無効
A promise made under compulsion is not binding.
事実の圧迫には抵抗し難し
There is no resisting the logic of facts―The logic of facts is irresistible.

content: 3. (=圧制)oppression:(=する) to oppress

content.content: 人民は長く圧迫を受けている
The people have long been oppressed―groaned under oppression.
強者は弱者を圧迫する
The strong oppress the weak.

content:
あっぱれ〔天晴〕
〈副〉Honourably; to one's honour; creditably; to one's credit; with credit:(感嘆詞に用いれば)bravo(!):(=な) honourable (conduct); creditable (performance):(その他すべてあっぱれ感心賞すべきの意味に用いれば)praiseworthy, commendable, admirable, splendid, glorious, etc.

content.content: あっぱれな仕打ち
honourable conduct
彼の敵に対する仕打ちは実にあっぱれだ
His conduct towards his enemy is honourable―It does him honour―It does his heart honour―It is to his honour―It redounds to his honour―He has conducted himself honourably towards his enemy.
あっぱれな手際
a creditable performance―an admirable performance
お手際あっぱれ
Your performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
あっぱれな働きぶり
You have played your part with credit―acquitted yourself to your credit.
彼はあっぱれ見事にやってのけた
He has acquitted himself to his credit―succeeded to admiration.
あっぱれ見事に及第した
He has come off with flying colours.
あっぱれ講和大使の大任を果たした
He has acquitted himself of his duty as peace envoy to his credit.
あっぱれな武者ふり
(働きぶりなら)splendid prowess―(様子なら)―a gallant mien.
あっぱれな手柄
a glorious deed―a splendid achievement
あっぱれ功名手柄する
to do glorious deeds―perform deeds of high renown
あっぱれ武士の典型
a splendid pattern of Japanese chivalry
(見ず知らずの人に頼まれてその罪まで背負うとは)お前の侠気はあっぱれである
I admire your spirit of chivalry.
あっぱれ見上げた男だ
You are an admirable man―a wonderful man.
彼は親の仇を討ったあっぱれな者だ
He is a brave man who has avenged his father.
あっぱれな武士だ
He is a brave samurai.
あっぱれな大将だ
He is a gallant general.
女ながらもあっぱれなものだ
She is an admirable woman.
最期まで奮闘したのは敵ながらあっぱれであった
To his honour be it said that the enemy fell fighting to the last.
あっぱれでかしたり
Bravo!―Well done!―(競技なら)―Well played!

content:
あっぷくする〔圧伏する〕
〈他動〉To overpower; to overwhelm

content.content: 多数をもって敵を圧伏する
to overwhelm the enemy by numbers

content:
あつまり〔集り〕
〈名〉
1. (=人の集り)a gathering; an assembly; a meeting:(教会なら)a congregation
2. (=物の集り)a collection (of curiosities); an assemblage (of facts); a concourse (of atoms, etc.)

content.content: 天地万物を無意識の物質の集まりと見るのは唯物論者
The materialist regards the universe as a concourse of blind atoms.

content:
あつまる〔集まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=人が集まる)to gather; to assemble; to meet; to muster; to come together; to flock together

content.content: 集まる者無慮一万
They gathered to the number of 10,000.
人が四方八方から集まって来る
People come flocking from all quarters.
(頼朝が旗を揚げると)源氏の残党その旗に集まる
The remnants of the Genji forces flocked to his banner.
友は類をもって集まる
“Birds of a feather flock together.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 集まれー(号令)
Fall in!
(学校は)場所が好いから生徒が集まる
There are many students owing to the goodness of the situation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The goodness of the situation brings many students―accounts for the large number of students.
場所が悪いから生徒が集まらない
There are few students owing to the badness of the situation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The badness of the situation accounts for the small number of students.

content:
2. (=物が集まる)to come together:(にわかに集まる)to gather; (段々に集まる)to collect
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 寄付金がよく集まる
Many subscriptions are made.
寄付金がいくら集まったか
What do the contributions amount to?
寄付金が千円以上集まった
The contributions amount to―come to―over 1000 yen.
税がよく集まる
The tax draws well.
人気が集まる
to become popular―become known
私立学校は年数が経たなけりゃ人気が集まるものではない
It takes years for a private school to become known.
種々の事情が集まって彼の今日をなしたのである
Various circumstances concurred―conspired―to make him what he is.

content: 3. (=一点に集まる、集中する)to converge (on a point); to centre (on a person)

content.content: 日本艦隊の砲火がロシアの旗艦に集まった
The fire of the Japanese fleet converged on―was concentrated upon―was brought to bear upon―the Russian flagship.
衆望彼の一身に集まる
All hopes centre in him―All hopes are centred on him.
衆目彼に集まる
All eyes were turned upon him―He was the object of general gaze―the focus of universal attention―the cynosure of universal observation―the observed of all observers.

content:
あつめる〔集める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=人を集める)to gather (people); to assemble (the estates of the realm); to mass (forces); to muster (all troops); to brings or get (men) together

content.content: 人を呼び集める
to call men together
同志を集める
to gather men of the same views
討ちもらされし残党を集める
to gather the remnants of a vanquished army

content: 2. (=物を集める)to gather (flowers); to collect (curiosities); to get or bring (things) together

content.content: 散った物を集める
to gather things which are scattered
(動植物の)標本を集める
to collect specimens
郵便切手を集める
to collect postage-stamps―make a collection of postage-stamps
骨董を集める
to collect curios―make a collection of curios
彼は刀剱を集めている
He has a collection of swords.
彼はなかなか珍書を集めている
He has a large collection of rare volumes.
材料を集める
to gather materials―(長くかかってなら)―collect materials
材料を方々から集めた
The materials have been gathered from various sources.
著書の材料を集める
to collect the materials for a new work
類を集める
to bring together objects of the same class
貸金を集める
to collect debts
掃き集める
to sweep things together (into a heap)

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 寄付金を集める
to call for contributions―set a subscription on foot―send round the hat (for some one)―(申込の寄付金を集金するのなら)―collect contributions
ひたいを集めて相談した
We laid our heads together.

content: 3. (=一点に集める、集中する)to concentrate (forces on a point)

content.content: 日本艦隊はその砲火をロシアの旗艦に集めた
The Japanese fleet concentrated its fire on the Russian flagship―brought its fire to bear upon the Russian flagship.
全力を一事に集める
to concentrate all one's powers on one object―bring all one's energies to bear upon one object
彼は衆望を一身に集めている
He is the centre of popular hopes.

content:
あつもの〔羹〕
〈名〉Soup; broth

content.content: 羹{あつもの}に懲りて膾{なます}を吹く
“A burnt child dreads the fire.”

content:
あつらえ〔誂え〕
〈名〉An order:(誂え物の意味なら)the article ordered; the order:(=る) to order (an article from a shop or from abroad); to give an order (for an article to a firm); to place an order (for an article with a firm)

content.content: 品物をあつらえる
to order an article―give an order for an article
英国へあつらえた
An order has been given to England―An order has been placed with an English firm.
品物を英国へあつらえた
The article has been ordered from England.
軍艦を英国へあつらえる
to order a warship from England
日本の軍艦は元は英国へあつらえて造らした
Japanese warships used to be ordered from England―Orders for Japanese warships used to be placed with English firms.
あつらえた品
an article made to order―(未調製品なら)―an article on order
きみの靴はおあつらえか出来合いか
Were your shoes made to order or ready-made?

content:
あつらえむき〔誂え向き〕
〈形〉Ideal (person or thing); to very (person or thing); just the (person or thing)

content.content: そりゃおあつらえ向きだ
That's the very thing―just the thing―the thing―the card―the ticket.
それはちょうどおあつらえ向きの人だ
He is the very man for me―just the man for me―the man for me―He will suit me to a T.
実用英語のできる人ならまことにおあつらえ向きの人物がある
If it is practical English you want, here is just the man for you―here is your man.
彼は教師にはあつらえ向きの人だ
He is just man for a teacher―made for a teacher―cut out for a teacher.
遠足にはおあつらえ向きの天気だ
It is just the weather―an ideal weather―for an excursion.
この本は日本学生にはあつらえ向きだ
The book is adapted for Japanese students―made to order for Japanese students.

content:
あつりょく〔圧力〕
〈名〉Pressure

content.content: 圧力を加える
to subject anything to pressure―bring pressure to bear upon anything
圧力に耐える
to stand the pressure
圧力に耐えぬ
to yield to the pressure

あつりょくけい〔圧力計〕
〈名〉A manometer

content:
あつれき〔軋轢〕
〈名〉Friction, discord, collision, clash, jar, strained relations (between two parties―among the members):(=する) to collide, clash, jar (with each other)

content.content: 教員間にあつれきがある
There is friction among the teachers―friction between two parties of teachers.
内部にあつれきがある
There is friction among the members―Strained relations subsist among the members.
人選の事から内部にあつれきを生じた、あつれきを来した
Choice of men gave rise to friction―led to friction―among the members.
内部にあつれきがあって円満を欠いている
Friction among the members prevent things from going on smoothly.

content:
あて〔宛〕
〈形〉(A letter) addressed to (some one); (a parcel) directed to (some one); (goods) consigned to (some one); (a bill drawn) in favour of (one)

content.content: 田中君宛の手紙
a letter addressed to Mr. Tanaka―a letter for Mr. Tanaka
高橋君宛の小包
a parcel directed to Mr. Takahashi―a parcel for Mr. Takahashi
日英社宛の貨物
Goods consigned to the Nichieisha―goods for the Nichieisha.
田中宛に手紙を出す
to address a letter to Tanaka
高橋宛に小包を出す
to direct a parcel to Takahashi
日英社宛に荷物を送る
to consign the goods to the Nichieisha
手紙は誰宛にして出せばよいか
To whom shall I address my letters?
幹事宛
Address your letter to the secretary.
小包は誰宛にして送ればよいか
To whom shall I direct the parcel?
該貨物は貴殿宛にて積出し申候
We have shipped the goods to your consignment―to your consignation.
荷は日英社宛に送れ
Consign the goods to the Nichieisha―Send the goods to the consignment of―to the consignation of―the Nichieisha.
誰宛に為替を組む
to draw a cheque in favour of some one
君宛に千円の為替を振出した
I have drawn a bill for 1000 yen in your favour.

content:
あて〔当て〕
〈名〉
1. (=期待)expectation; calculation; hope; trust; reliance

content.content: 当てにする
(約束なら)to rely upon one or one's promise―(物なら)―expect―lay one's account with―something―(結果なら)―expect―wait for―look for―count upon―calculate upon―reckon upon―lay one's account with―some event.
きっとか? 当てにして待っているよ
I shall rely upon you―May I count upon you?
当てにして待っておれ
You may rely upon me―Rely upon me!
当てにしないで待っておれ
You must not count upon me.
お約束を当てにして待っています
I shall rely on your promise―wait in reliance on your promise.
親の財産を当てにする
to lay one's account with one's father's property―“wait for dead men's shoes”
親の財産を当てにして金を借りる
to borrow money on post-obits
彼は伯(叔)父などの財産を当てにしている
He has expectations―He is a man of expectations.
当てにした財産を貰い損なった
He is disappointed of his expectations.
君の話を当てにして品物を買ってみた
I have bought the article on the strength of your statement.
(万一の)僥倖を当てにして試験を受けてみた
I took the examination on the chance of passing―on the off-chance of passing.
当てになる
to be reliable―trustworthy―authentic
当てにならぬ
to be unreliable―untrustworthy―unauthentic―deceptive―delusive―treacherous
あの男は当てになるか
Is he reliable?―Can I rely upon him?
彼の言うことは当てにならぬ
He is not to be relied upon―unreliable.
口約束は当てにならぬ
Promises are unreliable―No reliance is to be placed on promises.
あの人の話は当てになるか
Can I depend upon the truth of what he says?―Is his statement trustworthy?
彼の話は当てにならぬ
You can not depend upon the truth of what he says―His statement is untrustworthy.
この報告は当てになるか
Can I depend upon the truth of this report?―Is the report authentic?
こんな報告は当てにならぬ
You can not depend upon its truth―It is unauthentic.
外観は当てにならぬ
Appearances are not to be depended upon―Appearances are delusive―Appearances are deceptive.
僕の記憶は当てにならぬ
My memory is treacherous―I have a treacherous memory.
運は当てにならぬものだ
Fortune is not to be relied upon―uncertain―doubtful.
この天気は当てにならぬ
The weather is not to be relied upon―changeful―fickle.
当てがはずれる、当てが違う
to be disappointed of one's hopes―be out in one's reckoning―“reckon without one's host.”
すっかり当てがはずれた
I am out in my reckoning―I have “reckoned without my host.”
少々当てがはずれた
I am rather disappointed―I have miscalculated a little―My calculation was a little wrong.
がらりと当てがはずれた
My hopes are dashed to earth―My hopes are shattered.
洋行の当てがはずれた
I am disappointed in my hopes of going abroad.
当てにした褒美を貰い損なった
I am disappointed of my reward.
君が来ないので当てがはずれた
I was disappointed at your absence.
お前には当てが違った
I am disappointed in you―I have been deceived in you.
当てにするとはずれがち
“Expect everything, and you get nothing; expect nothing, and you get everything”―“There is many a slip betwixt the cup and the lip.”

content: 4. (=目当て、目的) (one's) aim, object

content.content: 当てがはずれる
to miss one's aim―miss one's object
別にこれという当ても無い
I have no particular aim.
僕は別に行く当てが無い
I have nowhere in particular to go.
どこも行く当てが無い
I have nowhere to go―(を面白く言えば)―I have all the world before me.
東京へ出ても頼る当てが無い
There is no one in Tokyo to whom I can look for assistance―I know of no one in Tokyo to look to for assistance.
金策の当てが無い
I have no means of raising the money.
金を借りる当てが無い
There is no one to lend me the money―There is no one to whom I can go for pecuniary help―I have no one to go to for pecuniary help.
探すに当てが無い
We do not know where to look―We have no clue to guide us.
当ての無い捜索
an aimless search
人を知らないから選ぶに当てが無い
As I do not knew the men, I must choose at random.
当ても無い企てをする
to form a visionary scheme―lay a chimerical scheme―“go on a wild-goose chase.”
当ても無い臆測をする
to make a random guess
当ても無く
without any definite aim―aimlessly―at large
彼は当ても無く洋行したのだ
He went abroad without any definite aim.
どこへ行くとういう当ても無く出かけた
I went out without knowing where to go.
当ても無く徘徊した
I wandered about aimlessly.
彼はボンヤリ当ても無く歩いている
He walks about listlessly―moons about.
当ても無くぶっぱなす
to let drive at large
当ても無く悪口を言い散らす
He scatters imputations at large.
遠方に見える灯火を当てに路をたどった
I followed my path guided by a light in the distance.

content: 5. (=何当て、当てのもの) a pad (for the protection of some part)

content.content: すね当て
pads for the legs―leggings―(蹴球用のは)―leg-guards

content:
あてがい〔宛がい〕
〈名〉(分け前なら) an allotted share; one's share:(役目なら)an assigned part; one's part:(手当なら)allowance (of money); a monthly allowance:(食物なら)allowance (of food); a daily allowance:(糧食なら)ration; a daily ration:(一家のなら)provision (for the family)

content.content: 一家のあてがいが充分だ
The family is sufficiently provided for―well provided for.
あてがいが不充分だ
They are badly provided for―scantily provided for.
あてがいが悪いから働かなかいのだ
They will not work hard because of the poor allowance.
彼は細君から小遣のおあてがいを頂戴している始末だ
He is reduced to receiving an allowance of pecket-money from his wife.

content:
あてがいぶち〔宛行扶持〕
〈名〉
1. (=家臣にあてがわれた扶持米) the allowance of rice (made to retainers in the feudal times); (the samurai's) fief
2. (=あてがわれた給金) wages imposed upon the employed without his consent; imposed wages

content.content: 職人はあてがい扶持をいやがる
Workmen do not like to have wages imposed upon them.

content: 3. (=指図)dictation

content.content: あてがい扶持を待っているのはいやだ
I will not be dictated to.

content:
あてがう〔宛行う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=割り当てる)to allot, apportion (a share to each); to assign (a part or task to each); to allow (one so much money a month―each so much food for daily ration); to devote, appropriate (a fund to some purpose); to earmark (a fund for some purpose); to provide for (a family)

content.content: 銘々に分け前をあてがう
to allot a share to each―apportion a share to each
銘々に役目をあてがう
to assign a part to each
銘々に仕事をあてがう
to assign a task to each
月五十円の手当をあてがう
to allow one 50 yen a month
一人前いくらの糧食をあてがう
to allow each so much food(for daily ration)
銘々に部屋があてがってある
A room is appropriated to each.
一家は充分にあてがってある
The family is sufficiently provided for―well provided for.
充分にあてがってない
They are scantily provided for―badly provided for.

content: 2. (=勝手に当てる)to suit (a man with a wife―a woman with a husband); to choose (a wife for one's son―a husband for one's daughter)

content.content: 今時の若い者は親にあてがわれた嫁で満足する者は無い
No young man nowadays will be contented with a wife chosen for him by his parents.

content: 3. (=当てて見る)to put (one thing on or over another); to try and see (if one thing will fit another)

content.content: つぎが間に合うかどうかあてがってご覧
See if the patch will cover the hole.

あてがね〔当て金〕
〈名〉A patch (on a boiler, etc.)

content:
あてくら〔当てくら〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あてっこ〔当てっこ〕

content:
あてこすり〔当てこすり〕
〈名〉An insinuation; an innuendo; an oblique hint; an allusive remark

content.content: 当てこすりを言う
to insinuate―innuendo―drop a hint―(that he is a miser, etc.)
人に当てこすりを言う
to hint obliquely at one―make an allusive remark at one―direct one's remark at one―speak at one―talk at one

あてこする〔当てこする〕
〈他動〉To insinuate, innuendo, drop a hint (that he is a miser, etc.); to hint obliquely at, make an allusive remark at, direct one's remark at, speak at, talk at (some one)

content:
あてこと〔当て事〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あてごと〔当て事〕

content:
あてごと〔当て事〕
〈名〉One's expectations; one's hopes

content.content: 当て事がはずれる
to be disappointed for one's hopes―“reckon without one's host”
当て事がすっかりはずれた
I have reckoned without my host―I am out in my reckoning.
当て事がガラリとはずれた(おじゃんになった)
My hopes have gone to the ground―My hopes are dashed to the ground―My hopes are dashed to earth―My hopes are shattered.
当て事はばずれやすい
One's hopes are apt to be disappointed―(に相当する格言は)―“There is many a slip betwixt the cup and the lip.”

content:
あてこむ〔当て込む〕
〈他動〉To anticipate, expect, hope for, count upon, calculate upon, reckon upon (gain, etc.)

content.content: 君はあまり儲けを当て込んだのが間違いだ
You made a mistake in counting too much upon the gain.
彼は大儲けを当て込んて贅沢を始めた
He launched forth into extravagance in expectation of a large gain―in anticipation of a large gain.
当て込んだことがはずれた
I am disappointed of my hopes―My hopes are disappointed.
当て込んだことがすっかりはずれた
I have reckoned without my host―I am out in my reckoning.
当て込んだことがガラリとはずれた(おじゃんになった)
My hopes are dashed to earth―My hopes are shattered.

あてじ〔当て字〕
〈名〉(A Chinese character which is) a mere phonetic equivalent for the Japanese word (as―寸断寸断{ずたずた})

あてすいりょう〔当て推量〕
〈名〉A guess; a conjecture; a surmise

content:
あてずいりょう〔当て推量〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あてすいりょう〔当て推量〕

content:
あてずっぽう〔当てずっぽう〕
〈名〉A random guess; guess-work:(=に) by guess-work; at random; at hazard; at haphazard

content.content: 当てずっぽうを言う
to make a random guess―talk at random
当てずっぽうに出した答案が当たった
The answer I give at random, proved correct.

あてそこない〔当て損い〕
〈名〉A miss:(臆測なら)a wrong guess

あてそこなう〔当て損う〕
〈他動〉To miss (the mark)
〈自動〉To guess wrong

content:
あてちがい〔当違い〕
〈名〉A disappointment (in something)

content.content: 今度の先生には大当違いをした
We are greatly disappointed in our new man―We have been greatly deceived in our new man.

content:
あてつけ〔当付け〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あてこすり〔当てこすり〕

content:
あてつける〔当付ける〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: あてこする〔当てこする〕

content:
あてっこ〔当てっこ〕
〈名〉A guessing math

content.content: 当てっこをしよう
Let us see who guesses right!―Let us see who makes the best guess!

あてどころ〔宛処〕
〈名〉The address (of a letter); the direction (of a parcel); the consignment, the consignation (of goods, etc.)

content:
あてどなく〔当途なく〕
〈副〉At random; at hazard; at haphazard

content.content: あてどなく本を開く
to open a book at random
人を選ぶに当てどなく選んだのだ
I chose the men at hazard―at haphazard.

content:
あてどなしに〔当てど無しに〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: あてどなく〔当途なく〕

content:
あてな〔宛名〕
〈名〉The address, the superscription (on a letter)

content.content: 手紙に宛名を書く
to address a letter
手紙の宛名が間違っている
The letter is wrongly addressed.
宛名の人
the addressee
宛名の人は宛名の所におらぬ
The addressee is not to be found at the address.
宛名不明の信書
a blind letter
宛名不明信書係
a blindman

content:
あてにならぬ〔当てにならぬ〕
〈形〉(He is) not to be relied upon; unreliable (person or promise); untrustworthy (statement); unauthentic (report); deceptive, delusive (appearances); treacherous (memory); uncertain, doubtful (fortune); changeful, fickle (weather)

content.content: あの人の言うことは当てにならぬ
He is not to be relied upon.
概観は当てにならぬ
Appearances are deceptive―Appearances are delusive.

content:
あてはまる〔当て嵌まる〕
〈自動〉To apply (to a case); to hold true; to be true of (some one)

content.content: この規則はどんな場合にも当てはまる
The rule applies to every case―It is applicable to every case―It holds true in every case―It is true of all cases.
今言ったことの当てはまらない人がある
The above statement does not apply to all men―It is not applicable to all men―It is not true of all men.

content:
あてはめる〔当て嵌める〕
〈他動〉To apply (a rule to a case); to assign (a part to each)

content.content: 規則を無理に当てはめる
to strain a rule to apply to a case
役割りを無理に当てはめる
to force a part to each

content:
あてもない〔当ても無い〕
〈形〉Aimless (wanderings); random (choice, etc.)

content.content: 当ても無い捜しもの
an aimless search
当ても無い臆測をする
to make a random guess
当ても無い企てをする
to form a visionary scheme―lay a chemical scheme―“go on a wild-goose chase.”

content:
あてもなく〔当ても無く〕
〈副〉Aimlessly; without any definite aim; at large

content.content: 当ても無くさまよった
I wandered about aimlessly.
あても無く洋行した
I went abroad without any definite aim.
どこへ行くという当ても無く出かけた
I went out without knowing where to go.
当ても無く悪口を言い散らす
to scatter imputations at large

content:
あてもの〔当てもの〕
〈名〉
1. (=当てる問題)something for one to guess
2. (=当てて保護するもの)a pad (for protecting some part)

content.content: 足に当てものをする
to pad the legs

あてやか〔貴やか〕
〈形〉Noble; refined

あでやか〔艶やか〕
〈形〉Charming, enchanting, bewitching, captivating, fascinating, ravishing, voluptuous (beauty, etc.)

content:
あてられる〔当てられる、中てられる〕
〈受動〉
1. (=人の臆測が当たる)to have (one) guess right

content.content: 当てられた(お手の筋)
You have guessed right―guessed it―hit it―hit right―hit the nail on the head.
うまく当てられた
You have made a lucky guess―made a good guess―made a good hit―made a good shot.

content: 2. (=中毒する)to have (some food) disagree with (one); to be poisoned (by some food)

content.content: 海老にあてられた
The crayfish has disagreed with me.
海豚にあてられた者がある
Some people are poisoned by the globe-fish.
時候にあてられた
The weather has disagreed with me―I am under the weather.
暑気にあてられた
I am suffering from the effects of exposure to the heat―I have a heat-stroke.

content: 3. (=閉口する)to be nonplussed

content.content: あの演説にはひどく当てられた
I was bored to death by that speech.
昨夜の話にスッカリ当てられた
We were carried off our feet―carried off our legs―by last night's talk.
当てられ気味だ
I am rather nonplussed.

content:
あてられる〔当てられる、中てられる〕
〈受動〉
1. (=人の臆測が当たる)to have (one) guess right

content.content: 当てられた(お手の筋)
You have guessed right―guessed it―hit it―hit right―hit the nail on the head.
うまく当てられた
You have made a lucky guess―made a good guess―made a good hit―made a good shot.

content: 2. (=中毒する)to have (some food) disagree with (one); to be poisoned (by some food)

content.content: 海老にあてられた
The crayfish has disagreed with me.
海豚にあてられた者がある
Some people are poisoned by the globe-fish.
時候にあてられた
The weather has disagreed with me―I am under the weather.
暑気にあてられた
I am suffering from the effects of exposure to the heat―I have a heat-stroke.

content: 3. (=閉口する)to be nonplussed

content.content: あの演説にはひどく当てられた
I was bored to death by that speech.
昨夜の話にスッカリ当てられた
We were carried off our feet―carried off our legs―by last night's talk.
当てられ気味だ
I am rather nonplussed.

content:
あてる〔宛る〕
〈他動〉To address (a letter to some one); to direct (a parcel to some one); to consign (goods to a firm); to draw (a bill) in favour of (some one)

content.content: 手紙は誰へ宛て出せばよいのか
To whom shall I address the letter?
為替は君に宛て振り出した
I have drawn the cheque in your favour.

content:
あてる〔充てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何に用いる)to put (money to some use); to apply, devote (a sum to some purpose); to appropriate (a fund to or for some purpose); to allot (land to or for some purpose); to set aside (a sum for some purpose)

content.content: この金は不時の用にあてるのだ
The money will be put to emergent uses.
この金は慈善事業にあててある
The money will be applied to charitable works―The fund is appropriated to charitable purposes.
この金は子どもの教育費にあてるのだ
The money will be devoted to the education of the children―The money is set aside for the education of the children.
日曜は読書にあてている
I devote my Sundays to reading.
学校設立にあてた資金
a fund appropriated for the establishment of a school
校舎建築にあてた地所
a plot allotted for a school

content: 2. (=割り当てる)to assign (a part or a task to each); to allot, apportion (a share to each)

あてる〔当てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=命中する)to hit (the mark)

content.content: 星にあてる
to hit the bull's-eye
的に当てる、あて損なう
to hit the mark―miss the mark

content: 2. (=あてがう)to put (one thing to or on or over another); to apply (one thing to another)

content.content: 胸に手を当てて(考える)
to apply one's hand to one's breast (or bosom)
口に手を当てる(口をふさぐ)
to put one's hand over one's mouth
耳に手を当てる(耳をふさぐ)
to put one's hands over one's ears
唇に指を当てる(黙れの合図)
to put a finger on one's lips
受話器を耳に当てる
to hold the receiver to one's ear
孔へ耳を当てる
to put the ear to a hole
額に手を当てる
(熱を見るためなら)to lay one's hand on the forehead―(考えるためなら)―touch one's forehead with a finger
笛に口を当てる
to put one's mouth to a flute
つぎを当てる
to put a patch on a coat
物差を当てる
to apply a measure to an object
規則を当てる
to apply a rule to a case

content: 3. (=ぶっつける)to strike (one thing with or against another); to hit (one thing with another)

content.content: 窓に球を当てる
to hit the window with a ball
杖を振って窓に当てる
to strike one's stick against the window―strike the window with one's stick
木材を壁に当てるな
Do not strike the timber against the wall.
道具をドタンバタンと方々へ当てる
to bang things about

content: 4. (=晒す)to expose (anything to some influence); to subject (anything to heat, etc.)

content.content: 日にあてる
to expose anything to the sun
顔を日にあてる
to expose one's face to the sun
身体を日にあてる
to expose oneself to the sun
板を日にあてると反る
A board warps if it is exposed to the sun―through exposure to the sun―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Exposure to the sun warps a board.
雨に当てる
to expose anything to the rain
着物を雨にあてて濡らした
My clothes are wet by exposure to the rain―My clothes are wet with the rain.
木材を雨にあてて腐らした
The timbers are rotten through exposure to the rain.
風にあてる
to expose anything to the wind
風にあてると着物が乾く
Your clothes will dry in the wind―be dried by the wind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The wind will dry your clothes.
荒い風にもあてないように
to keep any one like the apple of one's eye
夜露にあてる
to expose anything to the night-dew
火にあてる
to expose anything to fire―subject anything to fire
火にあてると匂いが抜ける
Hold it over the fire,―Show it the fire,―and the smell will go off.

content: 5. (=臆測する)to guess; to conjecture; to surmise

content.content: 何だか当ててご覧
Guess what it is.
(どうなるか)当ててご覧
It is for you to guess.
当てたね
You have guessed right―guessed it―hit it―hit right―hit the nail on the head―You are right in your conjectures.
うまく当てた
You have made a lucky guess―made a good guess―made a good hit―made a good shot.
当たるか当たらないか当ててみよう
I will guess at it.
当て損なう
to guess wrong

content: 6. (=成功する)to succeed; to make a success of it; to make a hit

content.content: 山を当てる
to succeed in speculation―make a hit in speculation
彼は今度は当てた
He has made a lucky hit―made a good hit―made a good deal.
彼は相場を当てて身代をこしらえた
He has made a fortune by lucky speculation.

content:
7. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 先生が僕に問を当てた
My teacher put a question to me.
先生は順番でなく当てる
Our teacher calls upon us in random order.
罰則に当てる
to punish a culprit according to the penal regulations
刑に当てる
to sentence a criminal to a penalty
選び当てる
to make a good choice―pitch upon the right person or thing
(鉱脈などを)掘り当てる
to strike the lode
うまく掘り当てる
to strike it rich
割り当てる
(役目などなら)to assign a part to each―(分け前などなら)―allot a share to each
目も当てられぬもの
a hideous object
震災の跡は目も当てられぬ
The scene of the seismic disaster is a gruesome sight.

content:
あと〔後〕
〈副詞、前置詞、接続詞相当〉［注意］名詞、形容詞は副詞より出た。
1. (=後で、後からの後)after; afterward(s)

content.content: 後で聞かせよう
I will tell you afterwards.
そんなことをすると後で困るぞ
You will be sorry for it afterwards.
家族は後から来る
My family are coming after me.
荷物は後から送ってくれ給え
Please send my luggage after me.
もう後の祭りだ
It is too late―“a day after the fair.”
火事の後の火の用心
“The stable-door is shut after the horse is stolen.”
俺が死んでから(または去ってから)後の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone.
後で苦情は言うまいな
You will not complain afterwards―Don't grumble afterwards!―Are you satisfied?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それでは後から苦情が出る
That isn't fair.
そうすりゃ後から苦情が出ない
That's fair.
後から苦情の出ないように前もって断っておく
I give you fair warning―give you due warning.
後で説明する
I will explain later on―farther on.
それから後に何かあったが
What followed?―What ensued?
それから後のことは知らぬ
I do not know what followed.
儀式の後に宴会があった
A banquet followed the ceremony.
後にまわす
to put off―defer―postpone
今こそ笑っているが後で泣くなよ(今に泣くぞ)
You will soon laugh on the wrong side of your face―laugh out of the other corner of your mouth.
後の百より今の五十
“A bird in the land is worth two in the bush.”
善い後は悪い
Every good has its evil―Every weal has its woe―Every flow has its ebb―Every day has its night.
嘘は後からはげる
“Liars should have good memories.”

content: 2. (=何年後の後)ago

content.content: 三年後(今を去る三年前)のことだ
It happened three years ago―three years since―three years back.
それより三年後のことだった
It had happened three years before―three years since―three years back.

content: 3. (=後を追うの後)after

content.content: 人の後を追う
to run after a man
(君先に行け)僕は後から行く
I will come after you.
入って後を締めろ
Come in, and shut the door after you!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 子が母の後を追う
The child wants to come with mamma.
犬はどこまでも僕の後を追って来る
My dog follows me wherever I go.
(君先に行け)僕は後から追いつく
I will come up with you―catch up with you.
人の後をつける
to shadow a man―dog his steps
探偵に後をつけられる
to be shadowed by a detective
見え隠れに人の後をつける
to follow a man at a distance
人の後からついて行く
to follow at one's heels
犬が後からついて来る
My dog follows at my heels.
後になり先になり人について行った
I followed him, now ahead of him, now behind him―I hovered about him.
行列の後につく
to bring up the rear
後から続く
to follow anything
戦争の後に飢饉が起こった
A famine followed the war.
すぐ後に続く
to tread (close) on the heels of―follow close on―something
大地震のすぐ後に大火が起こった
A great fire trod on the heels of the great earthquake.
後を慕う
to follow a person
彼女は夫の後を慕って米国へ行った
She followed her husband to America.
うつし世を神さりましし
He mingles with the gods on high,
大君の
My mighty Sovereign Lord;
み後慕いて
And with intensely yearning hear
我は行くなり
I follow heavenward.

content: 4. (=後へ戻るの後)back; backward(s)

content.content: 後へ戻る
to go backward―turn back―(退歩するの意味なら)―move backwards―retrograde―retrogress―(病人なら)―have a relapse
後へ下がる
to stand back
後へ下がれ
Stand back!―Step back!
列から後へ下がる
to fall behind―drop behind
びっくりして後へ下がった
I recoiled from the horrible sight.
群衆を後へ下がらせる
to bear back the crowd
後へ(号令)
Backward!―(船なら)―Go astern!
三歩後へ
Three steps backwards!
三歩後へ下がる
to take three steps backward
後を振り向く、後を振り返る
to look back
後へ退く
to fall back―retreat―recede
一歩も後へは退かぬ
We will hold our ground―stand our ground.
いったん言い出したら後へは退かぬたちだ
He never swerves from his resolutions.
頼まれれば後へは退かぬ
I will not recede from engagement.
(歩きながら言う)その家は五六丁後だった
I saw the house some way back.
後へ引き返す
to retrace one's way―retrace one's steps―double on one's tracks

content: 5. (=後に残るの後)behind

content.content: 後に残る
to remain behind―be left behind
皆行って僕だけ後に残った
They all went, myself alone remaining behind―leaving me behind.
彼が死んだら後に残るものは借金ばかりだ
When he dies, nothing will remain behind but his debts―(他動詞構文にすれば)―He will leave nothing but debts behind him.
彼は妻子を後に残して死んだ(または去った)
He left his wife and family behind him.
(彼が死んで)後に残った妻子
his surviving family
後に残れる妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうしてその日を送るやら
How shall they their means of living find?
(死ぬ時や去る時に)後に残す
to have anything behind one［注意］この形の終りの代名詞を落とさぬよう。
彼が死んで後に残したものは借金ばかりだ
He has left nothing but debts behind him.
生まれ故郷を後にして行く
I leave my beloved home behind me.
花の都を後にして、奥州街道踏み始む
Leaving the flowery capital behind me, I enter upon my journey to the land of Mutsu.

content: 6. (=後から押すの後)behind

content.content: 後から車を押す
to push a ricksha from behind

content:
〈名〉
1. (=What is left behind by some one―の意味より)the property, estate (left behind by some one); the seat, place, office, post (vacated by some one)

content.content: (誰の)後を取る、後を継ぐ
to succeed to the property―(子が親の後をとれば)―accede to one's property―come to one's property―inherit the estate―fall heir to the estate
総領が後をとる
The eldest son succeeds to the property―The eldest son is heir to the property.
彼が死んだら誰が後をとるか
If he dies, who will succeed to his property?―who will be heir to his property?―be successor to his property?―be his successor?
子どもが無ければ最近親が後を継ぐ
If a man dies without issue, one next of kin will succeed to the property.
(親父が死んで、または丁年に達して)彼が後をとった
He has acceded to his property―come to his property.
彼が死んで弟が後を継いだ
When he dies, his brother succeeded to his property―succeeded him.
人の立った後へ坐る
to take the seat vacated by some one
僕は彼の立った後へ坐った
I tooks his seat.
人の去った後へ入る
to take the place vacated by some one―take the place of some person―take his place―(しゃれて言えば)―step into his shoes
彼は僕を追い出してその後へ入って澄ましている
He has ousted me, and quietly stepped into my shoes.
人の後を継ぐ、後を引き継ぐ、後を襲う(後任になる)
to take one's place―succeed to one's post―succeed one (in one's post)―become one's successor
君が去ると誰が後を引き継ぐか
When you leave, who will take your place?―succeed to your office?―succeed you (in your office)?―be your successor?
あの人の後へ君を入れようと思う
I intend you to take his place―to step into his shoes―to succeed to his post―to succeed him―to be his successor.
甲男爵が乙伯爵の後を襲って大臣の椅子にすわった
Baron A succeeded Count B in the office of minister―succeeded to the office of minister in place of Count B.

content: 2. (=後取り)a successor (to office or property)

content.content: 君が去ったら後があるか
Can you find your successor?―Is there any one to take your place?
君が去ったら後は困るだろう
If you should leave, it would be hard to find a successor―there would be no one to take your place.
君の後はきまったかね
Has your successor been fixed upon?
後がきまらないと去れない
I can not leave before I find a successor―before I find some one to take my place.
あの人は誰の後か
Whose successor is he?―Whom has he succeeded?―Whose place has he taken?

content: 3. (=What remains behind―の意味より)the remainder; the rest; the others

content.content: 百円だけ払って後は借りておく
I will pay 100 yen, and owe you the remainder.
後は言わずと知れたこと
The rest needs no telling.
後はよろしく察し給え
You may imagine the rest.
(堂々たる彼すらこうだから)後は推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.
悪いところはこれだけで後はよろしい
This is the only fault. For the rest, it is all right.
この本の欠点はこれ一つで後は申し分が無い
This is the only fault of the book. For the rest, it leaves nothing to be desired.
それでは後の者はどうなるか、後が困るじゃないか
Then, what will become of the others?―Where do the others come in?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人はいつも半分言いかけて後は言わない
He always begins talking about something, and never finishes it.

content: 4. (=What comes after―の意味より)the sequel; the consequence; the end; the conclusion

content.content: あの話の後はどうなるのか
What is the sequel of the story?
後を読むとわかります
You will see by the sequel―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sequel will show.
あの人に賞められると後が怖い(何か思惑がある)
When he praises you, he has some end in view―“an axe to grind.”
後はどうなろうと僕が責任を負う
I will answer for the consequences.
そんな事をすると後の祟りが恐ろしいぞ
Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.
君の話は後が悪い
Your remarks have bad conclusions.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (人の話を聞いていて)その後は(?)
Please go on (with your story)!

content: 〈形〉Past:(the former に対し)the latter, a later:(the first に対し)the last, the next:(this, there, that, those に対し)the other, the remaining

content.content: 百円だけ払って後の五十円は借りておく
I will pay 100 yen, and owe you the remaining 50 yen.
(七人帰って)後の三人はどうなったか
What has become of the other three?
一番後に来たのは誰か
Who was the last to come?
船が沈没する時は船長が一番後に残る
The captain is the last man to leave a sinking ship.
後の雁が先になる
The last one becomes the first―(聖書の言葉で言えば)―“The first shall be the last, and the last shall be the first.”
(食卓で主人が給仕に向かって)後を出せ
Bring on the next course.
(二人の名前が似ているから)先のと後のと間違いそうだ
I am afraid I shall mistake the former for the latter―the one for the other.
後の申込は断った
We have declined later applications.
その後は(?)
Next!―Whose turn comes next?―What is your next business?―What is your next question?―What else do you want?―Any one else?
彼は後にも先にも無い名判官だ
He is the greatest of all judges, past or future.

content: 〈熟語〉

content.content: 後にも先にもたった一人の子
He was the only child they ever had.
話が後や先になる(話す言葉は後や先)
One gets confused in one's talk―gets mixed up.
後白浪と消え失せた
He disappeared no one knew whither―He vanished God knows where.
後の始末は俺がする
I will set matters right.
勝負事は後を引く
Sporting becomes a habit.
あの人の酒は後を引く
He sits long over his wine―“tarries long at his wine.”
仕事が後から後から出て来る
Business requiring attention turns up without end.
俺が死んでから(または俺が去ってから)後々の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone―Look to my affairs after I am gone.
彼は僕に後々の事を頼むと言った
He charged me to see to his affairs after his departure.
後々のためを図る
to consult the welfare of one's descendants―look to the interests of posterity―provide for the future
立つ鳥後を濁さず
A bird taking wing does not foul the water―(に相当する格言は)―“It is a dirty bird that fouls its own nest.”
僕は(ここを去るのに)後を濁したくない
I wish to leave a good name behind me―leave no enemies behind me.
後は野となれ山となれ
“It may go to the devil for all I care”―“After me the deluge.”

content:
あと〔跡〕
〈名〉
1. (=形跡、痕跡)marks; traces; vestiges; evidences ［注意］打ち消しのほかは複数。

content.content: 人の入った跡がある
There are marks of man―traces of man―vestiges of man―evidences of man.
人の入った跡が無い
There is no mark of man―no trace of man―no vestige of man―no evidence of man.
彼の手には労働した跡がある、跡が無い
His hands bear marks of toil―bear no mark of toil.
その島には人の住んだ跡が見える、跡が見えぬ
The island shows traces of human habitation―shows no trace of human habitation.
この文章には筆を入れた跡が見える、跡が見えぬ
The composition gives evidences of correction―gives no evidence of correction.
この作には苦心の跡が見える
The work gives evidences of labour―smells of the midnight oil―smells of the lamp.
苦心の跡ある文章
a laboured style
感情は顔に跡を留める
Emotions leave traces on the face.
行人の跡が絶えぬ
The traffic is continuous.
十時には行人の跡が絶える
At ten o'clock, the streets are deserted.
跡を絶つ
to blot anything out of existence―wipe anything out of existence
この悪弊は全く跡を絶った
The evil has been blotted out of existence―completely disappeared.
軍国主義は地上にその跡を留めず
Militarism has disappeared off the face of the earth.
武力をもって世を圧したる二大国は今や地上にその跡を留めず
The two mighty powers, which domineered over the world by their military power, have vanished off the face of the earth―been wiped off the face of the earth.
堂々たる艦隊は海上にその跡を留めず
The vaunted squadron had been wiped off the face of the deep.

content: 2. (=押しつけた跡)a mark; a print; an impression

content.content: 何に跡がつく
to leave a mark (on anything)
板の間に足跡をつける
to leave foot-marks on the floor
指の跡
a finger-mark―a finger-print
歯の跡
an impression of teeth
(砂の上の)波の跡
a ripple-mark

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 車の跡
ruts
艦の通った跡
wake
甲丸が乙丸の跡を走る
One ship sails in the wake of another.
筆の跡
writing―handwriting
傷の跡
a scar―a cicatrice
傷は跡が残る
A wound leaves a scar behind it.
できものの跡
a scar or mark left by a tumour
疱瘡は跡が残る
The smallpox leaves marks behind it.
疱瘡の跡
pockmarks
城の跡
the site of a castle―(多少その廃址を留むれば)―the ruins of a castle―the remains of a castle
跡に立つ
to rise on its ruins
ローマ帝国が倒れてその跡に立ったのが現今の欧州各国
The Roman Empire fell, and the modern European states rose on her ruins.
明治政府は徳川幕府の跡に立った
The Meiji government rose on the ruins of the Shogunate.
焼け跡
the site of a burnt house―the scene of a recent fire
東京の焼け跡に新東京が立つ
A new Tokyo will rise, like a phoenix, out of her ashes.
震災の跡は目も当てられなかった
The scene of the seismic disaster was a gruesome sight.

content: 5. (=人や獣の通った跡)a track; a trail:(臭いを残す跡は)a scent

content.content: なめくじが這うと跡を引く
A slug leaves a trail behind it.
流星が跡を引く
A meteor leaves a shining trail behind it.
勝負事は跡を引く
Sporting becomes a habit.
あの人の酒は跡を引く
He sits long over his wine―“tarries long at the wine.”
(犬が鹿などの)跡を追う
to track game―trail game―follow up the scent
猟犬が狐の跡を追っている
The hounds are on the track of a fox―on the trail of a fox―on the scent of a fox.
人の跡を追う
to run after―pursue―a man
(猟犬が)跡を失う
to lose the scent
(失った)跡を探す
to cast about for the scent
行方不明になった舶の跡を探る
to trace the track of a lost ship
川の跡を探す
to trace the course of a stream
人の跡をつける
to follow in one's track―follow up one's track―follow up one's footsteps―dog one's steps―shadow one
探偵に跡をつけられる
to be shadowed by a detective
見え隠れに跡をつける
to follow one at a distance
(賊などが)跡をくらます
to cover one's traces―put one on a wrong scent―throw one off the scent
泥棒が跡をくらまして逃げた
The burglar threw the police off the scent.
その男は跡をくらまして逃げた
The man absconded―decamped.
立つ鳥跡を濁さず
A bird taking flight does not foul the water―(に相当する格言は)―“It is a dirty bird that fouls its own nest.”
僕は跡を濁したくない
I wish to leave a good name behind me―leave no enemies behind me.

content:
あとあし〔後足〕
〈名〉The hind legs

content.content: 後足で立つ
An animal stands up on his hind legs―A horse rears.
後足で砂をかける
to leave a place with imprecations on it―turn one's back on one
あれは好い口があると後足で砂をかけて行く奴だ
He will turn his back upon you as soon as he finds a good opening.

content:
あとあと〔後々〕
〈名〉The distant future(の意味なれどもかく訳す場合無し)

content.content: 俺が死んでから(または俺が去ってから)後々の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone―Look to my affairs after I am gone.
彼は僕に後々の事を頼むと言った
He charged me to look to his affair after his departure.
彼は後々の事まで考える
He takes long views―He looks far ahead―He is far-sighted.
後々のためを図る
to consult the welfare of one's descendants―look to the interests of posterity―provide for the future

content:
あとう〔能う〕
〈助動詞相当〉→『

content.content: あたう〔能う〕

content:
あとおし〔後押し〕
〈名〉
1. The man who pushes a ricksha from behind; (the puller and) the pusher

content.content: 後押しをおつけなさい
You must have another man to push your ricksha from behind.
しりおし〔尻押し〕

content:
あとかたづけ〔後片付け〕
〈名〉Putting things to rights (after a disturbance); restoration to order:(=する) to put things to rights; to restore things to order

content.content: 後片づけがかえって骨が折れる
After the event comes the hardest part of the work.
戦いよりも後片づけの方が困難だ
It is when the battle ends that the hardest of the work begins.

content:
あとかたもない〔跡形も無い〕
〈形〉Unfound (rumour); groundless (report); baseless (report); cock-and-bull (story)

content.content: 跡形も無い話だ
It is a groundless rumour―a cock-and-bull story―a pure fabrication.

content:
あとがま〔後釜〕
〈名〉A successor:(概して悪しき意味なれば)a supplanter

content.content: (誰の)後釜になる
to take one's place―step into one's shoes
女房を叩き出して芸者を後釜に据えた
He put away his wife, and installed a geisha in her place―got a geisha-sweetheart into her shoes.

content:
あとからあとから〔後から後から〕
〈副〉Without end

content.content: 仕事が後から後から出て来る
Business requiring attention turn up without end.

content:
あとくされ〔後腐れ〕
〈名〉After-trouble

content.content: 売物買物は後腐れが無くて好い
A commercial transaction leaves no after-trouble―You have no trouble afterwards with a professional woman―You can be done with her when you have done with her.

content:
あとくち〔後口〕
〈名〉
1. (=飲食した後の口)an after-taste

content.content: 肝油を飲むと後口が悪い
Cod-liver oil leaves a bad after-taste in the mouth.
後口を直すのに何か食べなければならぬ
You must eat something after it to remove the after-taste―to get rid of the after-taste.

content: 2. (=後の申込み)an after-engagement

content.content: (芸人などが)後口を受ける
to accept an after-engagement
後口がある
She is booked for an after-engagement.

あとげつ〔後月〕
〈名、副〉Last month

content:
あどけない〔仇気無い〕
〈形〉Simple; artless; guileless; innocent; na?ve (as a child)

content.content: あの人は子どものようにあどけない
He is as artless as a child―as simple as a child.
子どものようなあどけなさがある
He has the simplicity of a child―the na?vety of a child.

content:
あとさき〔後先〕
〈副〉Before and behind; first and last

content.content: 後先に巡査の護衛がつく
He is escorted by policemen before and behind.
後先に無い出来事だ
It is the first and the last event.
後先を見る
to be prudent―circumspect
後先見ず
to be imprudent―reckless―rash
言う事が後先になる
One gets confused in one's talk―gets mixed up.

content:
〈名〉
1. (=両端)both ends; either end

content.content: 後先を切る
to cut off both ends
後先を伸ばす
to lengthen anything at either end
後先を一間あて伸ばす
We shall lengthen it at either end by six feet.

content: 2. (=文脈)the context

content.content: 言葉の意味は後先でわかる事がある
The meaning of a word is sometimes shown by the context.
意味を後先で判断する
to judge the meaning by the context―infer the meaning from the context

content: 3. (=行動の結果、こうすればどうなるということ)the consequences of one's action

content.content: 後先を考える
to reflect on the consequences of one's action
若い時は後先の考えが無い
Young man do not reflect on the consequences of their actions.
後先の考えも無くありたけ使ってしまった
I spent all the money without reflecting on the consequences―reckless of the consequences.
後先にかまわず尽くすべきことを尽くせ
Do your duty irrespective of the consequences.
後先を考えて物を言うものだ
You should speak with deliberation―consider carefully what you say―weigh what you say in your mind―weigh your words.

あとざん〔後産〕
〈名〉The afterbirth; the placenta

content:
あとしざりする〔後しざりする〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: あとずさりする〔後ずさりする〕

content:
あとじさりする〔後じさりする〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: あとずさりする〔後ずさりする〕

content:
あとしまつ〔後始末〕
〈名〉Setting matters right; remedial measures; settlement (of a dispute, etc.):(=する) to set matters right; to take remedial measures; to settle (a dispute, etc.)

content.content: 後始末は僕がする
I will set matters right.
後始末を頼む
See that matters are set right.
後始末がついたか
Are things all right now?
後始末はまだつかぬ
Things are not yet set right―Matters want setting right.
けんかの後始末をしなけれりゃならぬ
I must settle the quarrel.
借金をすると僕に後始末を頼むくせに
And you will come to me to help you out of your difficulties.
伯(叔)父が借金の後始末をしてくれた
My uncle helped me out of my difficulties.
会社の後始末をする(残務を整理する)
to wind up the affairs of a company

content:
あとしらなみと〔跡白浪と〕
〈副〉No one knows where

content.content: 跡白浪と消え失せた
He vanished God knows where.

content:
あとずさりする〔後ずさりする〕
〈自動〉
1. (=後へ下がる)to move backward; to step backward

content.content: ビックリして後ずさりした
I recoiled from the horrible sight.

content: 2. (=尻込みする)to back out; to hang back; to hold back; to shrink back; to recede (from an engagement)

あとぢえ〔後智慧〕
〈名〉After-wit

content.content: 下衆{げす}の後知恵
“A fool's wit is after-wit”―“Fools are wise after the event.”

content:
あとつぎ〔後継ぎ〕
〈名〉A successor; an heir

content.content: 後継ぎをする
to succeed one―succeed to the property

あとづけ〔後づけ〕
〈名〉(=洋食の後づけ)Dessert

content:
あととり〔後取り〕
〈名〉A successor; an heir

content.content: 後取り娘
an heiress

content:
あとのまつり〔後の祭り〕
〈名〉“A day after the fair.”

content.content: いまさら言っても後の祭りだ
It is now a day after the fair―too late―to discuss the matter.

content:
あとはら〔後腹〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あとばら〔後腹〕

content:
あとばら〔後腹〕
〈名〉The after-pains (of childbirth):(より) after-trouble

content.content: 産婦が後腹を病む
A woman in childbed suffers after-pains.
そんなことをすると後腹が病める(後腹が痛む)
If you do such a thing, you will have after-trouble―you will have to pay dearly for it―there will be the devil to pay―Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.

あとひきじょうご〔後引き上戸〕
〈名〉One who sits long over his wine; one who “tarries long at the wine”; an insatiable toper

あとぼう〔後棒〕
〈名〉The hindmost bearer (of a sedan-chair, etc.)

content:
あとまわし〔後廻し〕
〈名〉Postponement; deferment

content.content: 事を後まわしにする
to postpone a matter―put off a matter―defer matters
この議案は後まわしにします
We shall shelve the bill―pigeon-hole the bill―table the bill―lay it on the table―put it aside for future consideration―let the bill stand over.

あとめそうぞく〔跡目相続〕
〈名〉(嫡子なら)accession to the property:(養子なら)succession to the property
あとめをそうぞくする

あとめをそうぞくする〔跡目を相続する〕
〈熟語〉(嫡子なら)to accede to the property:(養子なら)to succeed to the property

あともどり〔後戻り〕
〈名〉Going backward; retrogression:(=する) to go backward; to turn back:(引き返すの意味なら)to retrace one's way, retrace one's steps, double on one's tracks:(退歩の意味なら)to retrogress:(病人なら)to have a relapse

あとり〔花鶏〕
〈名〉The brambling; the mountain-finch; cock of the wood

アトリエ
〈名〉An atelier; a studio

content:
あな
〈間投詞〉Oh!; Ah!; How...!

content.content: あな恐ろしや
How dreadful!
あな有り難や
Thank Heaven!―Heaven be thanked!
あなかしこ
Amen!

content:
あな〔穴、孔〕
〈名〉
1. A hole:(洞穴)a cave; a cavern:(地面の凹み)a cavity; a hollow:(竪穴、落とし穴)a pit; a shaft:(横穴) a tunnel:(壁などの孔)an aperture; an orifice; an opening

content.content: 戸に孔がある
There is a hole in the door―The door has a hole in it.
あれは何をする孔か
What is the hole for?
猫の出入りする孔だ
It is (a hole) for the cat to go in and out.
地面に穴がある
There are holes―cavities―hollows―in the ground.
顔に穴がある
His face is pitted (with pockmarks).
穴を掘る
to dig a hole (in the ground)
かには甲羅に似せて孔を掘る
The crab makes a hole suited to its shell―(意訳すれば)―“Cut your coat according to your cloth.”
孔をあける
to make a hole
壁に孔をあける
to make a hole in the wall―pierce the wall―perforate the wall
壁をつついて孔をあける
to pick a hole in the wall
鼠が壁に孔をあける
A mouse gnaws a hole in the wall―gnaws through the wall.
障子に指で孔をあける
to tear a hole in the paper-screen
障子をなめて孔をあける
to lick a hole in the paper-screen
紙を鋏んで孔をあける
to snip a hole in paper
着物を焼いて孔をあける
to burn a hole in one's coat
虫が着物に孔をあけた
The moths have eaten holes in my coat.
岩に孔をあける
to bore a hole in the rock―perforate the rock
戸に錐で孔をあける
to bore a hole in the door―bore through the door
錐で鉄板に孔をあける
to drill (a hole in) an iron plate
耳に孔をあける
to make a hole in the ear―pierce the ear
耳に孔を明けて耳環を下げる
The ears are pierced for ear-rings.
砲弾が舷側に孔をあける
A shell perforates the ship's side.
舷側が孔だらけ
The ship's sides are perforated with shot-holes―riddled with shot.
孔があく
A hole is made.
雨滴で石に穴があく
Falling drops will wear a hole in a stone―“Falling drops will wear a stone.”
石に穴があいている
The stone is perforated.
耳に孔があいている
The ears are pierced.
耳に孔があいて耳環を下げるようになっている
The ears are pierced for ear-rings.
丸い孔のあいた戸
a door with a round hole in it
孔のあいた靴下
stockings with holes in them―holed socks
靴下は穴だらけ
My socks are full of holes.
孔のあいた石
a perforated stone
孔のあいた耳
pierced ears
穴のあくほど顔を見る
to scrutinize one's face―scan one's face―(可愛ゆくてなら)―devour one's face
穴をふさぐ
to stop a hole―close a hole
鼠の孔をふさぐ
to stop a mouse-hole
孔がふさがる
A hole closes.
穴をうめる
to stop up a hole―fill up a hole―fill in a cavity―plug a hole
穴に入る
to enter a hole
穴があったら入りたいよう
I felt like sinking into the floor―I was ready to sink into the ground.
穴より出でて穴に入る
“From dust thou comest, and to dust returnest.”
孔を潜る
to pass through a hole
孔を抜け出る
to go through a hole
孔を抜け出ようとして太っているものだからはさまってしまった
He tried to creep through the hole, but, being very stout, got jammed in it.
孔から覗く
to look through a hole―peep at a hole
鍵の孔から覗いている者がある
Somebody is peeping at the keyhole.
穴に住む
to dwell in a cave
有史以前の人は穴に住んだ
Prehistoric men dwelt in caves.
穴を埋める
to fill up a hole
千丈の堤も蟻の穴より崩る
An ant-hole will destroy a dike―(に相当するは)―“A little leak will sink a great ship.”
棒が穴にはさまる
A peg fits into a hole.
耳の穴
the cavity of the ear
耳の孔を掘ってよく聴け
Listen with attention!
眼の孔
the socket of the eye
鼻の孔
the nostrils
尻の穴
the anus
笛の孔
the finger-holes of a flute―the stops of a flute

content: 2. (=狐などの穴)an earth:(兎などの穴)a burrow

content.content: 兎は穴を掘って棲む
Rabbits burrow in the earth.
狐が穴に隠れる
A fox takes earth.
狐を穴へ追いつめる
to run a fox to earth
一つ穴の狐、一つ穴の貉{むじな}だ
They are of a hair―of a gang.
穴の貉を値段する
to “sell the calf in the cow's belly”―“count the chickens before they are hatched.”

content: 3. (=墓)a grave

content.content: 穴を掘る
to dig a grave
穴掘り
a grave-digger
穴の縁に立っている(死にかけている)
He stands on the verge of the grave.
人を祈らば穴二つ
“Curses come home to roost”―“A curse cuts both ways”―“Harm watch, harm catch”―“Harm set, harm get.”

content: 4. (=欠陥)a gap; a deficit; a deficiency; a hole

content.content: 大穴をあける
to leave a gap―cause a deficit―(through peculation)
番頭が店に大穴をあけた
The head-clerk has been peculating on a large scale―embezzling to a great extent.
穴があく
A gap is left―A deficit occurs.
五千円の穴があいた
There is a deficit of 5,000 yen.
近頃の物入りで身代に大穴があいた
My late outlays have left a gap in my finances―made a hole in my finances.
穴をふさぐ、穴をうめる
to stop the gap―make up the deficit―supply the deficiency
穴ふさぎ
a stop-gap

content: 5. (=あら)faults; defects; flaws

content.content: 穴を探す
to carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws
人の穴を探す
to find faults in one―pick holes in one's coat
人の作などの穴を探す
to find faults in―pick holes in―criticize―one's work
この文は穴だらけだ
The writing is full of faults―full of holes.
穴を探したがる人
a fault-finder―a captious man―a caviller
貰い物の穴を探すな
Do not criticize a free gift―“Do not look a gift-horse in the mouth.”

あなかしこ
〈間投詞〉Amen!:(手紙の終りに書けば)Yours respectfully,...

content:
あながち〔強ち〕
〈副〉
1. (=必ずしも)(not) necessarily; (not) always

content.content: あながちそうとも限らぬ
That is not necessarily the case―It is not always so.
学者だとてあながち常識を欠くとは言えぬ
Scholars are not always wanting in common sense.

content: 2. (=まんざら)(not) wholly; (not) altogether

content.content: 先方の主張もあながち無理でない
The other party is not altogether in the wrong.
彼の処置はあながち悪くもない
His conduct is not wholly bad.

content:
あなぐら〔穴蔵〕
〈名〉A cellar

content.content: 穴蔵へ入れる
to cellar anything

あなご〔穴子〕
〈名〉The conger(-eel); the sea-eel

content:
あなさがし〔穴探し〕
〈名〉Carping; cavilling; fault-finding

content.content: 穴探しをする
to carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws
人の作などの穴探しをする
to find faults in―pick holes in―criticize―one's work
貰い物の穴探しをするな
Do not criticize a free gift―“Do not look a gift-horse in the mouth.”
穴探しをしたがる人
a fault-finder―a captious man―a caviller
東京穴探し
“The Dark Side of Tokyo”

content:
あなた〔貴方〕
〈代名詞〉You

content.content: 貴方ですよ
It is you―You are the man.
貴方の事なら(何でも)
I can refuse you nothing (=refuse you no favour).
貴方の物はわたしの物、わたしの物はわたしの物
What is yours is mine; what is mine is my own―the principle of selfishness.

あなたがた〔貴方がた〕
〈代名詞〉(The plural) you

content:
あなたに〔彼方に〕
〈代名副詞〉There

content.content: あなたこなたに
here and there

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Beyond

下に親しめば侮りを招く
“Familiarity breeds contempt.”

You made a mistake in holding a woman in contempt.

Despise not a small enemy.

彼は我々を侮ってものも言わぬ
He scorns to speak to us.

content:
あの
〈指摘代名詞〉
1. That (there, over there); yonder

content.content: 君はあの煙が見えるか、火事かしら

Do you see that smoke over there? I wonder if it is a fire.［注意］元「この」は“this person or thing (here―by me)”「その」は“that person or thing (by you)”「あの」は“yonder person or thing (in the distance)”なりしが、現今の英語にては“yonder”に代うるに“that...(over)there”をもってす。
(少し離れた人を指して)あの人は誰か
Who is that man there?
(遠く離れた山を指して)早く行きたいあの山越えて
How I long to go across that mountain over there!

content: 2. (=指で指さずに言うあの)that; the; you know which; you know what

content.content: あの事か
(指して言えば)It that what you mean?―(指さずに言えば)―Do you mean that affair?
ついでにあの人も連れて来い
By the way, bring you know which man―bring you know whom.
あの本を持って来い
Bring the book―Bring you know which book―Bring you know what book.
あのことをしよう
Let us do you know what!
あのことはどうなったか
What has become of the matter?
あの人、あの方
he―she
あの日に
(on) that day
あの時
at that time―then
あの頃
in those days―then
あの後
after that―thenceforth―thenceforward―since―ever since
あの辺
somewhere about there→『あのよ〔あの世〕』

content:
あのくらい〔あの位〕
〈副〉
1. (About) that much

content.content: いつもあのくらいあればよい
About that much will do every time.
あんなに

content:
あのね
〈間投詞〉Look here!

content.content: あのね君
I say, Jack―(は英、米は)―Say, Frank.

content:
あのまま〔あの儘〕
〈副〉As it was

content.content: あの事はあのままにしておいた
I have left the matter as it was.
あれはあのままになっている
It remains as it was.
あれはあのままにしておけ
Leave it as it was.

content:
あのよ〔あの世〕
〈名〉The next world; the other world; the world to come; the other life; the future existence; the future state; eternity

content.content: あの世へ行く
to go to Heaven―go to glory―go to a better world―go to one's long account―go to one's long home―go to one's own place―be haunched into eternity
東京の震災であの世へ行った者が十万人ある
In the seismic disaster of Tokyo, 100,000 souls were launched into eternity.
あの世の人となる
to join the majority
彼もあの世の人となった
He has joined the majority―He is in Heaven―He is no more.
あの世で逢おう
We shall meet in the next world―beyond the grave.

content:
あばく〔発く〕
〈他動〉To open (a grave); to disclose (a secret); to expose (a villain); to lay bare (an evil design)

content.content: 墓をあばく
to open a grave―dig a grave open
秘密をあばく
to disclose a secret―divulge a secret―reveal a secret―give away the secret
(医者が患者の、弁護士が依頼人の、など)職業上の秘密をあばく
to disclose a professional secret
人の秘密をあばくものでない
You should not betray people―give away people.
お前は仲間の秘密をあばいて悪い奴だ
You are a bad man to give away your pal.
悪計をあばく
to expose a design―lay bare a design―lay open a design
悪事をあばく
to expose a villainy
悪漢の真相をあばく
to expose a villain―unmask a villain
人の罪をあばく
to expose one's crime
人の非をあばくとは卑劣だ
It is mean of him to expose others' faults.
偽りをあばく
to nail a lie

content:
あばずれ
〈形〉Sophisticated, saucy, pert, bold (girl); abandoned, shameless (woman)

content.content: あの子はあばずれで男を男とも思わぬ
She is a bold girl, and makes nothing of men.

content:

〈名〉Pockmarks

content.content: その人はあばたがある
He is pockmarked―pitted.
疱瘡はあばたになる
The smallpox leaves marks behind it.
僕の疱瘡は軽くてあばたにならなかった
My smallpox was a slight case, and left no mark behind it.
惚れた欲目にゃあばたも笑窪
“Love is blind.”
惚れた欲目にゃ
When one is lost in love's sweet dream,
あばたも笑窪
A pockmark will a dimple seem.

あばたづら〔あばた面〕
〈名〉A pockmarked face; a pitted face

〈名〉The ribs

content.content: (注意を促す為に)肋をえぐる
to dig one in the ribs―poke one in the ribs―nudge one

〈名〉A rib

content.content: 肋骨を折る
to break a rib―fracture a rib

〈名〉
1. (=荒家)a dilapidated house; a ramshackle building; a tumble-down cottage

content: 2. (=弊屋)one's humble abode

content.content: 見苦しきあばら家へようこそ御入来{ごじゅらい}

content:
あばれだす〔暴れだす〕
〈自動〉To break out (into violent behaviour):(暴状を極めるの意味なら)to break out into excesses

content.content: 彼はどうして暴れ出したのか
What is the cause of his outbreak?

あばれっこ〔暴れっ子〕
〈名〉A fretful child; a refractory child:(少年なら)a wild boy; a hooligan

content:
あばれまわる〔暴れ回る〕
〈自動〉To rage about; to rave about; to tear about; to rip and tear about

content.content: 気違いが暴れ回る
A madman raves about―rips and tears about.

content:
あばれもの〔暴れ者〕
〈名〉A rough; a rowdy:(啖呵切って暴れる奴なら)a bully; a blusterer; a brawler; a hector:(少しこっけい分子を含めば)a rantipole:(青年なら)a wild young man

content.content: 暴れ者で手がつけられない
He is so wild that I can do nothing with him.
書生は天下の暴れ者(と言ったものだ)
The students (used to) lord it over the land.

content:
あばれる〔暴れる〕
〈自動〉To behave violently; to indulge in violent behaviour; to rage; to rampage; to make ［kick up］ a row; to kick up a racket; to kick up a rumpus; to kick up a shindy:(啖呵を切って暴れるのなら)to bluster, brawl, bully, hector, rage, storm:(暴状を極めるのなら)to commit excesses:(気違いなら)to rave, tear about, rip and tear about:(子どもなら)to fret, kick and struggle:(暴民なら)to run riot:(馬なら)to jib, turn restive:(馬車馬なら)to kick over the traces

content.content: 彼は時々酒に酔って暴れる
He will often get drunk and kick up a row―commit excesses.
酒を飲んで暴れる
to go on the spree―go on a racket―paint the sky red
彼らは酒を飲んで暴れている
The are on the spree―on the rampage.
あの気違いは暴れない
The madman does not rave about―rip and tear about.
これを合図に民衆は暴れ出した
This was the signal for the mob to run riot.
彼は若い時はずい分暴れた
He has sown his wild oats.
この子は寝かそうとするとじたばた暴れる
If you try to put him to bed, he will kick and struggle.
暴れる馬を制す
to control a restive horse
天井裏で鼠が暴れる
The mice scramble among the beams.
鼠が暴れる時は安心して寝られる
When the mice play, you can sleep in peace.
うんと暴れる
to have one's fling

content:

content.content: 阿鼻叫喚の巷と化す
It has turned into the veriest hell.

〈他動〉

to pour water on one―throw water over one―dash water over one
全身に水を浴びせられたような心地がした(ぞっとした)
A shudder ran through me.
背中から水を浴びせられるような気がした
It sent a chill down my back.
敵に砲弾(銃弾)を浴びせる
to rain shells upon the enemy―shower bullets upon the enemy
悪口を浴びせる
to rain abuses upon one―shower abuses upon one―pump abuses upon one
ひと太刀浴びせる
to deal one a blow on (or over) the head
罪を浴びせる
to lay the blame on one

あひる〔家鴨〕
〈名〉The (domestic) duck

content.content: 家鴨を飼う

a drake and duck
