a duckling
家鴨のような歩き(をする)
a waddling gait―to waddle

content:
あびる〔浴びる〕
〈自動〉
1. To bathe

content.content: 水を浴びる
to bathe in cold water―pour cold water on (or over) oneself―perform ablutions
湯を浴びる
to take a hot bath
海でひと浴び浴びよう
Let us take a dip―have a dip―in the sea.
日光を浴びる
to bathe in the sun's rays―be bathed in the sunlight―bask in the sun
船が時々大浪を浴びる
We often ship a sea.
酒を浴びる
to be steeped in liquor
浴びるほど飲む
to booze―soak
君のは飲むのじゃない浴びるのだ
You do not drink, but booze.
砲火を浴びる
to be under fire
兵は敵弾を浴びつつ冷静に働いた
The men behaved coolly under a hail of bullets.
家は風下で火の粉を浴びた
The house, standing to leeward of the fire, was under a shower of sparks.
弁士は喝采を浴びつつ降壇した
The speaker left the platform amidst applause.

content:
あぶ〔虻〕
〈名〉The gad-fly; the horse-fly

content.content: 虻蜂取らず
to fall between two stools―(一文とすれば)―Between two stools, one falls to the ground.

content:
あぶく〔泡沫〕
〈名〉Bubbles:(口から吹けば)foam:(ビールに立つのは)froth

content.content: あぶくが立つ
to bubble―foam―froth
あぶくを吹く
to foam―froth―at the mouth
蟹が口からあぶくを吹く
A crab foams at the mouth.

content:
あぶくぜに〔あぶく銭〕
〈名〉Money easily obtained; unearned money

content.content: あぶく銭は身につかず
“Lightly got, lightly spent”―“Lightly come, lightly go.”

content:
あぶない〔危ない〕
〈形〉
1. (=危険)dangerous (experiment); perilous (adventure); not safe

content.content: (そんな事をして)危なくないか
Is there no danger?
危ない事はない
There is no danger.
君のするのを見ると危ないようだ
To see you do it, one would think it dangerous.
君は思い切って危ないことをするね
You are daring.
危ない目に逢った
I had a dangerous experience―I was exposed to danger―I was threatened with danger.
今少しで危ないところだった
I was in imminent danger.
(けが人などの)命が危ない
His life is in danger―He is in danger of losing his life―He is in peril of his life.
(病人は)今日明日にも危ない命だ
His life hangs by a thread.
火事が広がったらこの家は危なかった
If the fire had spread, this house would have been in danger.
もう大丈夫危ない事はない
It is out of danger now.
危ない芸当(狂言)をする
to play a dangerous game
(お前は人の女房を盗もうと言うのか)危ない芸当をやりおるな
You are playing a dangerous game.
危ない橋を渡る
(投機などなら)to run a risk―(知らない事に口を出してなら)―tread on dangerous ground
(専門違いの話だから)危ない橋を渡るまい
I will not tread on dangerous ground―go beyond my depth.
あの犬は傍へ寄ると危ない
That dog is not safe to touch.
こんな小さい舟では危ない
Such a coclke-shell is not safe.

content: 2. (=商売上危険)risky (business); hazardous (enterprise); not safe

content.content: (損をする憂いある)危ない商売だ
It is a risky business.
この商売は危なくない
My business is not risky―quite safe.
こりゃ危ない山だ
This is a hazardous speculation.
危ない山をやる、危ない橋を渡る
to venture on a hazardous speculation―run a risk
危ない山をやるのはご免だ
I don't care to run risks.
ちょっとは危ないことをしないと金が儲からない
You can not make money without running some risks.

content: 3. (=不安な)unsafe (position); insecure (situation); precarious (existence); critical (state or condition); unsteady (hand or gait); slippery (ground); ticklish (footing); touch-and-go (arrangement, etc.)

content.content: 危ない仕掛けだ
It is a touch-and-go arrangement―a house of cards.
危ない立場だ
He has a ticklish footing―He stands on slippery ground.
危ない手つきだ
He has an unsteady hand.
危ない足つきだ
He has an unsteady gait.
危ない腰つきだ
He has an unsteady body.
(いつ食い損うかも知れない)危ない生活だ
It is a precarious existence.
(いつ免職になるのか知れない)危ない地位だ
It is an insecure position―His tenure of office is precarious―He holds his office on a precarious tenure.
病人は危ない
The invalid is in a critical state.

content: 4. (=不安心な)untrustworthy (person); unreliable (promise); uncertain (event); doubtful (result, etc.)

content.content: 成功は危ないものだ
Success is doubtful―Success is uncertain.
危ない人だ
He is untrustworthy―not to be trusted.
あの人の口約束は危ないものだ
His promises are unreliable―He is not to be relied upon.
危ない話だ
It is a doubtful story―His account is not to be depended upon.
新聞の記事は危ないものだ
The papers are unreliable―not to be relied upon―not to be depended upon.

content: 5. (=かながなの)bare (majority); narrow (escape); near (escape); close (shot, etc.)

content.content: (食うや食わずの)危ない世渡りをする
to make a bare living
危ないところを助かった(間髪を容れず、九死に一生を得)
I had a narrow escape―a near escape―a hairbreadth escape―It was a close shave―a close call―I missed it by a hair's breadth―missed it by the skin of my teeth.
危ないところを命からがら助かった
I escaped with bare life―I was snatched from the jaws of death.
危ないところだった
It was a close shot.
危ない多数だ
It is a bare majority.
危ない勝ちだ
It is a bare victory―a narrow victory.
(旅費など)百円じゃ危ない
A hundred yen is barely sufficient (for the purpose).
(今一歩進めば法令に触れる、道徳に背くというような)危ない事をする
to do something very near―do something very close―sail close to the wind―sail near the wind

content:
6. 
〈動詞を以て表わす場合〉

content.content: あの男に金を預けるのは危ない
(You may trust him with money.「彼に金を預けても安心」より)You can not trust him with money―He is not to be trusted with money.
この子はまだ独りで世の中へ出すのは危ない
You can not trust him alone in the world―He is too young to be trusted alone in the world.
僕は(慣れないから)演説をするのは危ない
I can not trust myself on the platform.

content:
7. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 汽車が今立つという危ないところだった
The train was on the point of starting.
その人の名が咽まで出かかっていて実に危なかった
His name was on the tip of my tongue.
危ないよ
Look out!―You will fall! you will fall!
そこは危ないからこっちへ来い
Come away!
危ないから深いところへ行くな
Do not go out of your depth!
落ちると危ないから崖から下を覗くな
Don't look over the precipice lest you should fall―for fear you may fall―for fear of falling.
危ないに怪我無し
“It is time enough to cry Oh! when you are hurt.”

content:
あぶながる〔危ながる〕
〈自他動〉To be afraid (of failure); to be apprehensive (of danger); to shrink from (a task)

content.content: 危ながって手を出す者はない
They are afraid of the risk, and nobody will make the attempt.
あの人は人の危ながる事を好んでする
He will attempt tasks which others shrink from.

content:
あぶなく〔危なく〕
〈副〉Very nearly (doing something); (to be) on the point of (doing something); (to be) in imminent danger of (doing something):(動詞に訳して)to come near (doing something); to go near (to do something); to miss (doing something)

content.content: 僕は危なくこの崖から落ちるところであった
I very nearly fell over this precipice―I came near falling over this precipice―I came within an inch of falling over this precipice―I just missed falling over this precipice.
あの河で危なく死ぬところだった
I was very nearly drowned―I came near being drowned―I came within an ace of being drowned―I just missed being drowned―in that river.
危なく自動車に轢れるところだった
A motor-car very nearly ran over me―went near to run over me―just missed running over me.
船が危なく衝突するところであった
The ships were very nearly colliding with each other―The ships were in imminent peril of collision.
彼は危なくその書類を火中にするところであった
He was on the point of committing the papers to the flames, when I prevented him.
僕は危なくその名を言うところであった(咽まで出ておった)
I was on the point of uttering his name―His name was on the tip of my tongue―when I suddenly recollected myself.

content:
あぶなげ〔危な気〕
〈名〉
1. (客観的に用いれば)appearance of danger; a dash of danger

content.content: 少し危な気があると冒険の興を増す
A dash of danger adds a zest to the adventure.

content: 2. (主観的に用いれば)apprehension; diffidence; want of confidence

content.content: 老練家の芸は見ていても危な気がない
A veteran artiste inspires confidence.

content: 〈形〉(=な)dangerous (experiment); risky (enterprise); untrustworthy (person); unreliable (promise); doubtful (success); unsteady (hand or gait); delicate (matter); slippery (ground); ticklish (footing, etc.)

content.content: 危な気な試みだ
It is a dangerous attempt.
危な気な商法だ
It is a risky business.
危な気な人だ
He is untrustworthy.―not to be trusted.―unreliable.―not to be relied upon.
危な気な手つきだ
He has an unsteady hand.
危なげな足つきだ
He has an unsteady gait.
危な気な立場だ
He has a ticklish footing.―He stands on slippery ground.
あの人は危な気な英語を使う
You can not trust him to speak English.
今一人の英語は危な気がない
You may trust the other man to speak English.

あぶなさ〔危なさ〕
〈名〉The danger or dangerousness (of an experiment); the peril or perilousness (of an adventure); the risk or riskiness (of an enterprise, etc.)

〈名〉A stirrup

content.content: 鐙を踏む
to rest one's feet on the stirrups
鐙を踏んで立つ
to rise in one's stirrups
鐙を踏みはずす
to miss one's stirrups

あぶみずれ〔鐙擦れ〕
〈名〉(=馬腹の鐙擦れ)A stirrup-sore

content:
あぶら〔油〕
〈名〉
1. Oil:(脂肪の意味なら)fat; grease:(豚の脂肪)lard:(牛羊の固い脂肪)suet:(牛羊の骨の脂肪)tallow:(鯨の油)blubber; speck:(精の意味なら)essence:(民の膏血の意味なら)sweat

content.content: 種から油を締める
to press oil―extract oil―from seed
民の油を絞る
to sweat the people―put the screw on the people―put the people under the screw―grind the faces of the poor
機械に油をさす
to oil machinery―grease machinery―lubricate machinery
時計に油をさす
to oil a watch
時計の油が切れた
The watch is out of oil.
油をさして貰おう
I will have it oiled.
靴に油を引く
to oil boots―grease boots
ランプに油を注ぐ
to put oil into a lamp―feed a lamp (with oil)
(鹿肉など)油が掛かっている、油が乗っている
Venison is in grease―in the prime of grease―in the pride of grease.
(肉など)油が強い
The meat is fatty―greasy.
油の強い魚
oily fish
(魚や野菜を)油で揚げる
to fry fish or vegetables (in oil)
椿油
camellia-seed oil
丁子油
essense of cloves
鼻の油
grease on the nose
油を取る、油を絞る
to take it out of one―have it out of one―give one a rating―give it him
一つ油を絞ってやろう
I will give it him.
うんと油取られた
I got a severe rating.―got a sound rating.
英語の試験には油を取られた
The English paper had it out of me.
油を掛ける(煽動する)
to pour oil on the fire―set one on
彼は油を掛けられて乱暴を働いた
He was set on to acts of violence.
油を売る
to idle―laze―loaf
油を売って暇をつぶす
to idle away one's time
(仕事や話に)油が乗る
to warm to one's work―warm up to one's subject
